Text

IT was only just light enough to discern the five human forms in the dimness of [the garret]293-the garret ; the rays of the moon having to find their way through the deep window - embrasures of [the keep]294-the keep . Less illumination would have sufficed to disclose the ancient character of [the garret]293-the garret , with [its]293-the garret low ceiling , and the graduated mouldings of the cornice , giving the effect of a shallow dome . [The house]296-the house stood obviously very high , for one could see from the windows for miles over [a bleak country]297-a bleak country , coldly lit by the rays of the moon , which was almost at the full . Into the half light stole presently the sound of some lively instrument : a reel tune played , as it were , beneath one 's breath , but with all the revel and rollicking emphasis of that intoxicating primitive music . And then in correspondingly low relief , but with no less emphasis , [the occupants of [this singular ball - room]299-this singular ball - room]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room began to dance . One might have fancied [them]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room some midnight company of the dead , risen from [their]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room graves for this secret revelry , so strange was the appearance of [the moving figures]300-the moving figures , with the moonlight catching , as [they]300-the moving figures passed , the faces or the hands . [They]298-the occupants of this singular ball - room danced excellently well , as to the manner born , tripping in and out among the shadows , with occasional stamping , in time to the music , and now and again that wild Celtic shout or cry that sets the nerves athrill . In spite of the whole scene 's being enacted in a low key , it seemed only to gain in intensity from that circumstance , and in fantastic effect . Among [the dancers]301-the dancers was [one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy , and [her]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy little cry had a ring and a wildness that never failed to set [the others]303-the others going with new inspiration . [She]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy was [a slight , dark - haired girl , with a pale , rather mysterious face , and large eyes]304-a slight , dark - haired girl , with a pale , rather mysterious face , and large eyes . Not a word was spoken , and the reel went on for nearly ten minutes . At length [the girl with the dark hair]305-the girl with the dark hair gave a final shout , and broke away from the circle . With [her]302-one who danced with peculiar spirit and brilliancy desertion the dance flagged , and presently came to an end . The first breaking of the silence gave a slight shock , in spite of the subdued tones of [the speaker]306-the speaker . ‚Äú It is no use trying to dance a reel without [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äù[307-a tall youth] said [a tall youth]307-a tall youth , evidently [[her]308-her brother]309-her brother , if one might judge from [his]307-a tall youth almost southern colouring and melancholy eyes . In build and feature [he]307-a tall youth resembled [the elder sister]310-the elder sister , [Algitha]81-algitha , who had all the characteristics of [a fine northern race]311-a fine northern race . ‚Äú [Old Maggie]82-old maggie said the other day , that [Hadria]211-hadria 's dancing of the reel was no ‚Äò right canny , ‚Äô ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha observed , in the same low tone that [all the occupants of the garret]312-all the occupants of the garret instinctively adopted . ‚Äú Ah ! ‚Äù[83-fred] cried [Fred]83-fred , ‚Äú [old Maggie]82-old maggie has always looked upon [Hadria]211-hadria as half bewitched since that night when [she]82-old maggie found [her]211-hadria here ‚Äò a wee bit bairn , ‚Äô as [she]82-old maggie says , at this very window , in [her]211-hadria nightshirt , standing on tiptoe to see the moonlight . ‚Äù[83-fred] ‚Äú It frightened the poor old thing out of [her]211-hadria wits , of course , ‚Äù[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha , who was leaning with crossed arms , in a corner of the deep - set window . The fine outlines of face and form were shewn in the strange light , as in a boldly - executed sketch , without detail . Pride and determination were the dominant qualities so indicated . [[Her]308-her sister]313-her sister stood opposite , the moonshine making the smooth pallor of [her]313-her sister face more striking , and emphasizing its mysterious quality . [The whole group of young faces , crowded together by the window , and lit up by the unsympathetic light]314-the whole group of young faces , crowded together by the window , and lit up by the unsympathetic light , had something characteristic and unusual in its aspect , that might have excited curiosity . ‚Äú Tell [us]3676-we the story of the garret , [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äù[84-austin] said [Austin]84-austin , [the youngest brother]315-the youngest brother , [a handsome boy of twelve , with curling brown hair and blue eyes]316-a handsome boy of twelve , with curling brown hair and blue eyes . ‚Äú [Hadria]211-hadria has told it hundreds of times , and [you]84-austin know it as well as [she]211-hadria does . ‚Äù[84-austin] ‚Äú But [I]84-austin want to hear it again ‚Äî about the attack upon [the keep]294-the keep , and the shouting of [the men]3678-the men , while [the lady]3679-the lady was up here starving to death . ‚Äù[84-austin] But [Algitha]81-algitha shook [her]81-algitha head . ‚Äú [We]3676-we do n't come up here to tell stories , [we]3676-we must get to business . ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú Will [you]84-austin have the candle , or can [you]84-austin see ? ‚Äù[83-fred] asked [Fred]83-fred , [the second brother , a couple of years younger than [Hadria]211-hadria , whom [he]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed addressed]317-the second brother , a couple of years younger than hadria , whom he addressed . [Algitha]81-algitha went into [the next room]318-the next room and brought in a couple of chairs . [Fred]83-fred followed [her]81-algitha example till there were enough for the party . [They]319-we all took [their]319-we places , and [Hadria]211-hadria , who had been provided with a seat facing [them]319-we , and with a rickety wooden table that trembled responsively to [her]211-hadria slightest movement , laid down [her]211-hadria notes and surveyed [[her]211-hadria audience]320-her audience . The faces stood out strangely , in the lights and shadows of [the garret]293-the garret . ‚Äú [Ladies]3680-ladies and [gentlemen]3681-gentlemen , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria began ; ‚Äú on the last occasion on which [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society held [its]3682-the preposterous society meeting , [we]319-we had the pleasure of listening to an able lecture on ‚Äò Character ‚Äô by [[our]319-we respected member [Demogorgon]85-demogorgon]3683-our respected member demogorgon ‚Äù[211-hadria] ( [the speaker]306-the speaker bowed to [Ernest]86-ernest , and [the audience]323-the audience applauded ) . ‚Äú [My]323-the audience address to - night on ‚Äò Fate ‚Äô is designed to contribute further ideas to this fascinating subject , and to pursue the enquiry more curiously . ‚Äù[323-the audience] [The audience]323-the audience murmured approval . ‚Äú [We]319-we were left at loggerheads , at the end of the last debate . [The speaker]306-the speaker looked at [her]306-the speaker notes . ‚Äú [I]306-the speaker will read , ‚Äù[306-the speaker] [she]306-the speaker said , ‚Äú a passage from [Emerson]87-emerson , which states very strikingly the doctrine that [I]306-the speaker am going to oppose . ‚Äù[306-the speaker] Hadria [her]306-the speaker paper aslant towards the candle - end , which threw a murky yellow light upon the background of [the garret]293-the garret , contrasting oddly with the thin , clear moonbeams . ‚Äú ‚Äò But the soul contains the event that shall befall it , for the event is only the actualization of its thoughts ; and what [we]3684-we pray to [ourselves]3684-we for is always granted . The event is the print of [your]3685-your form . It fits [you]3685-your like [your]3685-your skin . What [each]3686-each does is proper to [him]3686-each . Events are the children of [his]3686-each mind and body . ‚Äô ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha leant forward . [The members of the Preposterous Society]328-the members of the preposterous society settled into attitudes of attention . [Hadria]211-hadria said that this was a question that could not fail to be of peculiar interest to [them]328-the members of the preposterous society all , who had [their]328-the members of the preposterous society lives before [them]328-the members of the preposterous society , to make or mar . It was an extremely difficult question , for it admitted of no experiment . [One]329-one could never go back in life and try another plan . [One]329-one could never make sure , by such a test , how much circumstance and how much innate ideas had to do with [one]329-one 's disposition . [Emerson]87-emerson insisted that [man]332-man makes [his]332-man circumstance , and history seemed to support that theory . How untoward had been , in appearance , the surroundings of [those who had made all the great movements and done all the great deeds of]333-those who had made all the great movements and done all the great deeds of [the world]334-the world . Let [one]329-one consider the poverty , persecution , the incessant discouragement , and often the tragic end of [[our]336-our greatest benefactors]337-our greatest benefactors . [Christ]88-christ was but one of [the host of the crucified]338-the host of the crucified . In spite of the theory which [the lecturer]339-the lecturer had undertaken to champion , [she]339-the lecturer believed that it was generally [those people who had difficult lives who did the beneficent deeds , and generally [those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep]341-those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep , or actively dragged down what [the thinkers and actors]342-the thinkers and actors had piled up . In great things and in small , such was the order of life]340-those people who had difficult lives who did the beneficent deeds , and generally those people who were encouraged and comfortable who went to sleep , or actively dragged down what the thinkers and actors had piled up . in great things and in small , such was the order of life . ‚Äú Hear , hear , ‚Äù[86-ernest] cried [Ernest]86-ernest , ‚Äú [my]86-ernest particular thunder ! ‚Äù[86-ernest] ‚Äú Wait a minute , ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer . ‚Äú [I]339-the lecturer am going to annihilate [you]86-ernest with [your]86-ernest particular thunder . ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] [She]339-the lecturer paused for a moment , and [her]339-the lecturer eyes rested on the strange white landscape beyond the little group of faces upturned towards [her]339-the lecturer . ‚Äú Roughly , [we]336-our may say that [people]3687-people are divided into two orders : first , [the organizers]3688-the organizers , [the able]3689-the able , [those who build , who create cohesion , symmetry , reason , economy]3690-those who build , who create cohesion , symmetry , reason , economy ; and , secondly , [the destroyers]3691-the destroyers , [those who come wandering idly by , and unfasten , undo , relax]3692-those who come wandering idly by , and unfasten , undo , relax , disintegrate all that has been effected by the force and vigilance of [their]3687-people betters . This distinction is carried into even the most trivial things of life . Yet without that organization and coherence , the existence of [the destroyers themselves]3693-the destroyers themselves would become a chaos and a misery . ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] The oak table over which [Hadria]211-hadria bent forward towards [[her]211-hadria audience]320-her audience , appeared to be applauding this sentiment vigorously . It rocked to and fro on the uneven floor with great clamour . ‚Äú Thus , ‚Äù[306-the speaker] [the speaker]306-the speaker went on , ‚Äú [these relaxed and derivative people]3694-these relaxed and derivative people are living on the strength of [the strong]3695-the strong . [He]3696-he who is strong must carry with [him]3696-he , as a perpetual burden , [a mass of such pensioners , who are scared and shocked at [his]3696-he rude individuality]3697-a mass of such pensioners , who are scared and shocked at his rude individuality ; and if [he]3696-he should trip or stumble , if [he]3696-he should lose [his]3696-he way in the untrodden paths , in seeking new truth and a broader foundation for the lives of [men]3698-men , then a chorus of censure goes up from millions of little throats . ‚Äù[306-the speaker] ‚Äú Hear , hear ! ‚Äù[83-fred] cried [Algitha]81-algitha and [Fred]83-fred , and the table rocked enthusiastically . ‚Äú But when the good things are gained for which [the upholders]3699-the upholders have striven and perhaps given [their]3699-the upholders lives , then there are [no more greedy absorbers of the bounty]3700-no more greedy absorbers of the bounty than these same innumerable little throats . ‚Äù[306-the speaker] The table led the chorus of assent . ‚Äú And now , ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer slowly , ‚Äù consider this in relation to the point at issue . [Emerson]87-emerson asserts that circumstance can always be conquered . But is not circumstance , to a large extent , created by [these destroyers]3701-these destroyers , as [I]339-the lecturer have called [them]3701-these destroyers ? Has [not the strongest soul to count with these , who weave the web of adverse conditions , whose dead weight has to be carried , whose work of destruction has to be incessantly repaired]3702-not the strongest soul to count with these , who weave the web of adverse conditions , whose dead weight has to be carried , whose work of destruction has to be incessantly repaired ? Who can dare to say ‚Äò [I]339-the lecturer am master of [my]339-the lecturer fate , ‚Äô when [he]3696-he does not know how large may be the share of the general burden that will fall to [him]3696-he to drag through life , how great may be the number of these parasites who are living on the moral capital of [[their]3701-these destroyers generation]3703-their generation ? Surely circumstance consists largely in the inertia , the impenetrability of the destroyers . ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] [Ernest]86-ernest shewed signs of restiveness . [He]86-ernest shuffled on [his]86-ernest chair , made muttered exclamations . ‚Äú Presently , ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] said [the lecturer]339-the lecturer reassuringly . ‚Äú Or put it in another way , ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] [she]339-the lecturer went on . ‚Äú [A man]3704-a man may make a thing ‚Äî circumstance included ‚Äî but [he]3704-a man is not [a sort of moral spider]3705-a sort of moral spider ; [he]3704-a man ca n't spin it out of [his]3704-a man own inside . [He]3704-a man wants something to make it of . The formative force comes from within , but [he]3704-a man must have material , just as much as [a sculptor]3706-a sculptor must have [his]3706-a sculptor marble before [he]3706-a sculptor can shape [his]3706-a sculptor statue . There is a subtle relation between character and conditions , and it is this relation that determines Fate . Fate is as the statue of [the sculptor]3707-the sculptor . ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] ‚Äú That 's where [Hadria]211-hadria mainly differs from [you]3708-you , ‚Äù[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , ‚Äú [you]3708-you make the thing absolute ; [Hadria]211-hadria makes it a matter of relation . ‚Äù[83-fred] ‚Äú Exactly , ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] assented [the lecturer]339-the lecturer , catching the remark . ‚Äú Difficulties need not be really obstructive to the best development of a character or a power , nor a smooth path always favourable . Obstacles may be of a kind to stimulate [one person]3709-one person and to annihilate another . It is not a question of relative strength between character and circumstance , as [people]3687-people are so fond of asserting . That is mere gibberish . It means nothing . The two things can not be compared , for they are not of the same nature . [They]3711-they ca n't be reduced to a common denominator . ‚Äù[339-the lecturer] [Austin]84-austin appreciated this illustration , being head of [[his]84-austin class]349-his class for arithmetic . ‚Äú [We]3712-we shall never be able to take a reasonable view of this question till [we]3712-we get rid of that ridiculous phrase , ‚Äò If the soul is strong enough , it can overcome circumstance . ‚Äô In [a room filled with carbonic acid instead of ordinary air]3713-a room filled with carbonic acid instead of ordinary air , [a giant]3714-a giant would succumb as quickly as [a dwarf]3715-a dwarf , and [his]3714-a giant strength would avail [him]3714-a giant nothing . Indeed , if there is a difference , it is in favour of [the dwarf]3716-the dwarf . ‚Äù[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest frowned . This was all high treason against [[his]86-ernest favourite author]350-his favourite author . [He]86-ernest had given [[his]86-ernest sister]351-his sister a copy of [Emerson]87-emerson 's works last Christmas , in the hope that [her]351-his sister views might be enlightened , and this was the disgraceful use [she]351-his sister made of it ! ‚Äú Finally , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , smiling defiantly at [[her]211-hadria brother]309-her brother , ‚Äú let [us]3717-us put the question shortly thus : Given ( say ) great artistic power , given also a conscience and a strong will , is there any combination of circumstances which might prevent the artistic power ( assuming it to be of the highest order and strength ) from developing and displaying itself , so as to meet with general recognition ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú No , ‚Äù[86-ernest] asserted [Ernest]86-ernest , and there was a hesitating chorus on [his]86-ernest side . ‚Äú There seem to [me]211-hadria to be a thousand chances against it , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria continued . ‚Äú Artistic power , to begin with , is a sort of weakness in relation to the everyday world , and so , in some respects , is a nice conscience . [I]211-hadria think [Emerson]87-emerson is shockingly unjust . [His]87-emerson beaming optimism is a worship of success disguised under lofty terms . There is nothing to prove that [thousands]3718-thousands have not been swamped by maladjustment of character to circumstance , and [I]211-hadria would even go so far as to suggest that perhaps the very greatest of all are those whom [the world]334-the world has never known , because the present conditions are inharmonious with the very noblest and the very highest qualities . ‚Äù[211-hadria] No sooner was the last word uttered than the garret became the scene of the stormiest debate that had ever been recorded in the annals of [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society , [an institution that had lately celebrated [its]3682-the preposterous society fifth anniversary]354-an institution that had lately celebrated its fifth anniversary . [Hadria]211-hadria , fired by opposition , declared that the success of [great people]355-great people was due not simply to [their]355-great people greatness , but to some smaller and commoner quality which brought [them]355-great people in touch with [the majority]356-the majority , and so gave [their]355-great people greatness a chance . At this , there was such a howl of indignation that [Algitha]81-algitha remonstrated . ‚Äú [We]3720-we shall be heard , if [you]3721-you do n't take care , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria warned . ‚Äú [[My]211-hadria dear]3722-my dear [Algitha]81-algitha , there are [a dozen empty rooms between [us]3720-we]3723-a dozen empty rooms between us and [the inhabited part of [the house]296-the house]3724-the inhabited part of the house , not to mention the fact that [we]3720-we are a storey above [everyone]3726-everyone except the ghosts , so [I]211-hadria think [you]81-algitha may compose [yourself]81-algitha . ‚Äù[211-hadria] However , the excited voices were hushed a little as the discussion continued . One of the chief charms of [the institution]357-the institution , in the eyes of [the members of [the Society]359-the society]358-the members of the society , was [its]357-the institution secrecy . [The family]360-the family , though united by ties of warm affection to [[their]360-the family parents]361-their parents , did not look for encouragement from [them]360-the family in this direction . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton was too exclusively scientific in [his]89-mr. fullerton bent of thought , to sympathize with the kind of speculation in which [[his]89-mr. fullerton children]362-his children delighted , while [[their]362-his children mother]363-their mother looked with mingled pride and alarm at these outbreaks of individuality on the part of [[her]363-their mother daughters]364-her daughters , for whom [she]363-their mother craved the honours of [the social world]365-the social world . In [this out - of - the - way district]366-this out - of - the - way district , [society]367-society smiled upon conformity , and glared vindictively at the faintest sign of spontaneous thinking . Cleverness of execution , as in music , tennis , drawing , was forgiven , even commended ; but originality , though of the mildest sort , created the same agonizing disturbance in the select circle , as the sight of a crucifix is wo nt to produce upon [the father of Evil]368-the father of evil . In the debate just recorded , that took place on [Algitha]81-algitha 's twenty - second birthday , [Ernest]86-ernest had been [[Hadria]211-hadria 's principal opponent]371-hadria 's principal opponent , but [the others]303-the others had also taken the field against [her]81-algitha . ‚Äú [You]81-algitha have the easier cause to champion , ‚Äù[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said , when there was a momentary lull , ‚Äú for all [your]81-algitha evidences can be pointed to and counted whereas [mine]363-their mother , poor things ‚Äî pale hypotheses , nameless peradventures ‚Äî lie in forgotten [church - yards]3727-church - yards ‚Äî unthought of , unthanked , untrumpeted , and all [their]303-the others tragedy is lost in the everlasting silence . ‚Äù[363-their mother] ‚Äú [You]81-algitha will never make [people]3687-people believe in what might have been , ‚Äù[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . ‚Äú [I]81-algitha do n't expect to . ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Hadria]211-hadria was standing by the window looking out over [the glimmering fields]373-the glimmering fields and [the shrouded white hills]374-the shrouded white hills . ‚Äú Life is as white and as unsympathetic as this , ‚Äù[363-their mother] [she]363-their mother said dreamily . ‚Äú [We]3729-our just dance [our]3729-our reel in [[our]3729-our garret]3730-our garret , and then it is all over ; and whether [we]3729-our do the steps as [our]3729-our fancy would have them , or a little otherwise , because of the uneven floor , or tired feet , or for lack of chance to learn the steps ‚Äî heavens and earth , what does it matter ? ‚Äù[363-their mother] ‚Äú [Hadria]211-hadria ! ‚Äù[375-an astonished chorus] exclaimed [an astonished chorus]375-an astonished chorus . [I]363-their mother think that there are more ‚Äò destroyers ‚Äô to be carried about and pampered in this department of existence than in any other ( material conditions being equal ) . ‚Äù[363-their mother] ‚Äú Do [you]86-ernest mean that [a girl]3734-a girl would have more difficulty in bringing [her]3734-a girl power to maturity and getting it recognized than [a man]3704-a man would have ? ‚Äù[83-fred] asked [Fred]83-fred . ‚Äú Yes ; the odds are too heavy . ‚Äù[83-fred] ‚Äú A second - rate talent perhaps , ‚Äù[86-ernest] [Ernest]86-ernest admitted , ‚Äú but not a really big one . ‚Äù[86-ernest] ‚Äú [I]211-hadria should exactly reverse that statement , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú The greater the power and the finer [its]3744-its quality , the greater the inharmony between the nature and the conditions ; therefore the more powerful the leverage against it . Ah ! that particular obstacle has held many [a woman]3753-a woman helpless and suffering , like some wretched insect pinned alive to a board throughout a miserable lifetime ! What would [Emerson]87-emerson say to these cases ? That ‚Äò Nature magically suits [the man]3754-the man to [his]3754-the man fortunes by making these the fruit of [his]3754-the man character ‚Äô ? Pooh ! [I]211-hadria think Nature more often makes [a man]3704-a man 's fortunes a veritable shirt of Nessus which burns and clings , and finally kills [him]3754-the man with anguish ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] ONCE more [the old stronghold of [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee]381-the old stronghold of dunaghee , inured for centuries to the changes of the elements , received the day 's greeting . The hues of dawn tinged the broad hill pastures , or ‚Äú airds , ‚Äù[81-algitha] as they were called , round about [the Tower of the Winds]382-the tower of the winds . [No one]383-no one was abroad yet in [the silent lands]384-the silent lands , except perhaps [a shepherd]385-a shepherd , tending [his]385-a shepherd flock . [The little farmstead of [Craw Gill]2-craw gill]386-the little farmstead of craw gill , that [lay at a distance of about a couple of miles down the valley , on the side of a ravine]387-lay at a distance of about a couple of miles down the valley , on the side of a ravine , was apparently dead asleep . [Cruachmore]3-cruachmore , [the nearest upland farm]388-the nearest upland farm , could scarcely be seen from [the stronghold]389-the stronghold . [The old tower]390-the old tower had been added to , perhaps two hundred years ago ; [a rectangular block projecting from the corner of [the original building]392-the original building]391-a rectangular block projecting from the corner of the original building , and then a second erection at right angles to the first , so as to form three sides of [an irregular courtyard]393-an irregular courtyard . This arrangement afforded some shelter from the winds which seldom ceased to blow in [these high regions]394-these high regions . [The spot]395-the spot had borne the same reputation for centuries , as the name of [the old tower]390-the old tower implied . [The Tower of the Winds]382-the tower of the winds stood desolately , in the midst of [a wide - eyed agricultural country]398-a wide - eyed agricultural country , and was approached only by a sort of farm track that ran up [hill and down dale]399-hill and down dale , in a most erratic course , to [the distant main road]400-the distant main road . [The country]401-the country was not mountainous , though [it]401-the country lay in [a northern district of [Scotland]4-scotland]402-a northern district of scotland ; [it]401-the country was bleak and solitary , with [vast bare fields of grass or corn]403-vast bare fields of grass or corn ; and below in [the valley]404-the valley , [a river that rushed sweeping over [its]405-a river that rushed sweeping over its rough bed rough bed]405-a river that rushed sweeping over its rough bed , silent where it ran deep , but chattering busily in the shallows . Here was verdure to one 's heart 's content ; [the whole country]406-the whole country being a singular mixture of bleakness on [the heights]407-the heights , and woodland richness in [the valleys]408-the valleys ; bitterly cold in the winter months , when the light deserted [the uplands]409-the uplands ridiculously early in the afternoon , leaving long mysterious hours that held [the great silent stretches of field]410-the great silent stretches of field and [hillside]411-hillside in shadow : a circumstance , which had , perhaps , not been without its influence in the forming of [Hadria]211-hadria 's character . [She]211-hadria , more than the others , seemed to have absorbed the spirit of the northern twilights . It was [her]211-hadria custom to wander alone over [the broad spaces of [the hills]413-the hills]412-the broad spaces of the hills , watching the sun set behind them , the homeward flight of the birds , the approach of darkness and the rising of the stars . Every instinct that was born in [her]211-hadria with [her]211-hadria Celtic blood ‚Äî which lurked still in [the family]360-the family to the confounding of its fortunes ‚Äî was fostered by the mystery and wildness of [her]211-hadria surroundings . Dawn and sunset had peculiar attractions for [her]211-hadria . Although [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society had not separated until unusually late on the previous night , [the President]416-the president was up and abroad on this exquisite morning , summoned by some ‚Äú message of range and of sweep ‚Äî ‚Äù[211-hadria] to [the flushing stretches of pasture]417-the flushing stretches of pasture and [the windy hillside]418-the windy hillside . In spite of the view that [Hadria]211-hadria had expounded in [her]211-hadria capacity of [lecturer]419-lecturer , [she]211-hadria had an inner sense that somehow , after all , the will can perform astonishing feats in Fate 's despite . [Her]211-hadria intellect , rather than [her]211-hadria heart , had opposed the philosophy of [Emerson]87-emerson . [Her]211-hadria sentiment recoiled from admitting the possibility of such tragedy as [her]211-hadria expressed belief implied . This morning , the wonder and the grandeur of the dawn supplied arguments to faith . If the best in human nature were always to be hunted down and extinguished , if the efforts to rise in the scale of being , to bring gifts instead of merely absorbing benefits , were only by a rare combination of chances to escape the doom of annihilation , where was one to turn to for hope , or for a motive for effort ? How could one reconcile the marvellous beauty of [the universe]420-the universe , the miracles of colour , form , and , above all , of music , with such a chaotic moral condition , and such unlovely laws in favour of dulness , cowardice , callousness , cruelty ? [One]329-one aspired to be [an upholder and not a destroyer]422-an upholder and not a destroyer , but if it were a useless pain and a bootless venture ‚Äî ? [Hadria]211-hadria tried to find some proof of the happier philosophy that would satisfy [her]211-hadria intellect , but it refused to be comforted . Yet as [she]211-hadria wandered in the rosy light over [the awakening fields]423-the awakening fields , [her]211-hadria heart sang within [her]211-hadria . [The world]334-the world was exquisite , life was a rapture ! [She]211-hadria could take existence in [her]211-hadria hands and form and fashion it at [her]211-hadria will , obviously , easily ; [her]211-hadria strength yearned for the task . Yet all the time , the importunate intellect kept insisting that feeling was deceptive , that health and youth and the freshness of the morning spoke in [her]211-hadria , and not reason or experience . Feeling was left untouched nevertheless . It was impossible to stifle the voices that prophesied golden things . Life was all before [her]211-hadria [she]211-hadria was full of vigour and longing and good will ; [the world]334-the world stretched forth as a fair territory , with magical pathways leading up to [dizzy mountain tops]426-dizzy mountain tops . With visions such as these , [the members of the Preposterous Society]328-the members of the preposterous society had fired [their]328-the members of the preposterous society imaginations , and gained impetus for [their]328-the members of the preposterous society various efforts and [their]328-the members of the preposterous society various ambitions . [Hadria]211-hadria had been among the most hopeful of [the party]428-the party , and had pointed to the loftier visions , and the more impersonal aims . Circumstance must give way , compromise was wrong ; [we]429-we had but a short time in [this world]430-this world , and mere details and prejudices must not be allowed to interfere with [one]329-one 's right to live to the utmost of one 's scope . But it was easier to state a law than to obey it ; easier to inspire [others]432-others with faith than to hold fast to it [oneself]329-one . The time for taking matters in one 's own hands had scarcely come . [A girl]3734-a girl was so helpless , so tied by custom . [One]329-one could engage , so far , only in guerilla warfare with [the enemy]435-the enemy , who lurked everywhere in ambush , ready to harass [the wayfarers with incessant petty attack]436-the wayfarers with incessant petty attack . But life must have something more to offer than this ‚Äî life with its myriad interests , dramas , mysteries , arts , poetries , delights ! By [the river]437-the river , where [it]437-the river had worn for [itself]437-the river [a narrow ravine]438-a narrow ravine , with steep rocky sides or ‚Äú clints , ‚Äù[439-they] as [they]439-they were called , [several short tunnels or passages]440-several short tunnels or passages had been cut in places where the rock projected as far as the bank of [the river]437-the river , which was followed in [its]437-the river windings by a narrow footway , leading to [the farmstead of [Craw Gill]2-craw gill]442-the farmstead of craw gill . In one part , a series of [such tunnels , with intervals of open pathway]443-such tunnels , with intervals of open pathway , occurred in picturesque fashion , causing a singular effect of light and shade . As [Hadria]211-hadria stood admiring the glow of the now fully - risen sun , upon the wall of rock that rose beyond the opening of [the tunnel which [she]211-hadria had just passed through]444-the tunnel which she had just passed through , [she]211-hadria heard footsteps advancing along [the riverside path]445-the riverside path , and guessed that [Algitha]81-algitha and [Ernest]86-ernest had come to fetch [her]211-hadria , or to join in any absurd project that [she]211-hadria might have in view . Although [Algitha]81-algitha was two - and - twenty , and [Hadria]211-hadria only a year younger , [they]446-they were still guilty at times of wild escapades , with the connivance of [[their]446-they brothers]447-their brothers . Walks or rides at sunrise were ordinary occurrences in [the family]360-the family , and in summer , bathing in [the river]437-the river was a favourite amusement . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria thought [I]211-hadria recognised [your]450-the two figures footsteps , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , as [the two figures]450-the two figures appeared at the mouth of [the tunnel]451-the tunnel , the low rays of the sun lighting [them]450-the two figures up , for a moment , as [they]450-the two figures turned the sharp bend of [the narrow path]452-the narrow path , before entering the shadow . A quantity of brown dead leaves were strewn upon the floor of [the rock - passage]453-the rock - passage , blown in by the wind from [the pathway]454-the pathway at each end , or perhaps through the opening in the middle of [the tunnel]451-the tunnel that looked out upon [the rushing river]456-the rushing river . A willow - tree had found footing in the crevice of the rock just outside , and its branches , thinly decked with pale yellow leaves , dipped into the water just in front of the opening . When the wind blew off [the river]437-the river it would sweep the leaves of the willow into [the tunnel]451-the tunnel . ‚Äú Let 's make a bonfire , ‚Äù[86-ernest] suggested [Ernest]86-ernest . [They]450-the two figures collected the withered harvest of the winds upon [the cavern]459-the cavern floor , in a big brown heap , and then [Ernest]86-ernest struck a match and set light to it . [Algitha]81-algitha , in a large black cloak , stood over it with a hazel stick ‚Äî like a wand ‚Äî stirring and heaping on the fuel , as the mass began to smoulder and to send forth a thick white smoke that gradually filled [the cavern]459-the cavern , curling up into the rocky roof and swirling round and out by the square - cut mouth , to be caught there by the slight wind and illumined by the sun , which poured down upon the soft coils of the smoke , in so strange a fashion , as to call forth a cry of wonder from [the onlookers]461-the onlookers . Standing in the interval of open pathway between [the two rock - passages]462-the two rock - passages , and looking back at [the fire - lit cavern]463-the fire - lit cavern , with [its]463-the fire - lit cavern black shadows and flickering flame - colours , [Hadria]211-hadria was bewildered by what appeared to [her]211-hadria a veritable magic vision , beautiful beyond anything that [she]211-hadria had ever met in dream . [She]211-hadria stood still to watch , with a real momentary doubt as to whether [she]211-hadria were awake . [The figures , stooping over the burning heap]464-the figures , stooping over the burning heap , moved occasionally across the darkness , looking like [a witch]465-a witch and [her]465-a witch familiar spirit , who were conjuring , by uncanny arts , a vision of life , on the strange , white , clean - cut patch of smoke that was defined by the sunlit entrance to [the tunnel]451-the tunnel . [The witch]467-the witch stirred , and [her]465-a witch familiar added fuel , while behind [them]450-the two figures the smoke , rising and curdling , formed the mysterious background of light : opaque , and yet in a state of incessant movement , as of some white raging fire , thinner and more deadly than any ordinary earthly element , that seemed to sicken and flicker in the blast of a furnace , and then rushed upwards , and coiled and rolled across [the tunnel]451-the tunnel 's mouth . Presently , as a puff of wind swept away part of the smoke , a miraculous tinge of rosy colour appeared , changing , as one caught it , into gold , and presently to a milky blue , then liquid green , and a thousand intermediate tints corresponding to the altering density of the smoke ‚Äî and then ! [Hadria]211-hadria caught [her]211-hadria breath ‚Äî the blue and the red and the gold melted and moved and formed , under the incantation , into a marvellous vision of [distant lands]469-distant lands , [purple mountains]470-purple mountains , fair white cities , and wide kingdoms , so many , so great , that the imaginltion staggered at the vastness revealed , and offered , as it seemed , to [him]471-him who could grasp and perceive it . Among [those blue deeps]472-those blue deeps and [faint innumerable mountaintops]473-faint innumerable mountaintops , caught through a soft mist that continually moved and lifted , thinned and thickened , with changing tints , all the secrets , all the hopes , all the powers and splendours , of life lay hidden ; and the beauty of the vision was as the essence of poetry and of music ‚Äî of all that is lovely in the world of art , and in [the world of the emotions]474-the world of the emotions . The question that had been debated so hotly and so often , as to the relation of the good and the beautiful , art and ethics , seemed to be answered by this bewildering revelation of sunlit smoke , playing across the face of a purple - tinted rock , and a few feet of grass - edged pathway . ‚Äú Come and see what visions [you]471-him have conjured up , [O witch]3756-o witch ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha gave a startled exclamation , as the smoke thinned and revealed that bewildering glimpse of [distant lands]469-distant lands , half seen , as through the atmosphere of a dream . [An exquisite city]476-an exquisite city , with [slender towers and temples]477-slender towers and temples , flashed , for a moment , through the mist curtain . ‚Äú If life is like that , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said at length , drawing a long breath , ‚Äú nothing on [this earth]3757-this earth ought to persuade [us]3758-us to forgo it ; [no one]383-no one has the right to hold one back from its possession . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú [No one]383-no one , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria ; ‚Äú but [everyone]3726-everyone will try ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú Let [them]3726-everyone try , ‚Äù[81-algitha] returned [Algitha]81-algitha defiantly . [ERNEST]86-ernest and [[his]86-ernest two sisters]478-his two sisters walked homeward along [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , and thence up by a winding path to [the top of [the cliffs]482-the cliffs]481-the top of the cliffs . It was mild weather , and [they]483-they decided to pause in [the little temple of classic design]484-the little temple of classic design , which [some ancient owner of [the Drumgarran estate]486-the drumgarran estate]485-some ancient owner of the drumgarran estate , touched with a desire for the exquisiteness of Greek outline , had built on [a promontory of the rocks]487-a promontory of the rocks , among rounded masses of wild foliage ; a spot that commanded one of [the most beautiful reaches of [the river]437-the river]488-the most beautiful reaches of the river . The scene had something of classic perfection and serenity . ‚Äú [I]86-ernest admit , ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest in response to some remark of [one of [[his]86-ernest sisters]491-his sisters]490-one of his sisters , ‚Äú [I]86-ernest admit that [I]86-ernest should not like to stay [here]3762-here during all the best years of [my]86-ernest life , without prospect of widening [my]86-ernest experience ; only as a matter of fact , [the world]334-the world is somewhat different from anything that [you]3764-you imagine , and by no means would [you]3764-you find it all beer and skittles . [Your]3764-you smoke and sun - vision is not to be trusted . ‚Äù[86-ernest] ‚Äú But think of the pride and joy of being able to speak in that tone of experience ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria mockingly . ‚Äú [One]329-one has to pay for experience , ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest , shaking [his]86-ernest head and ignoring [her]211-hadria taunt . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria think [one]329-one has to pay more heavily for inexperience , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . ‚Äú Not if [one]329-one never comes in contact with [the world]334-the world . [Girls]3769-girls are protected from the realities of life so long as [they]3769-girls remain at [home]3770-home , and that is worth something after all . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Algitha]81-algitha snorted . ‚Äú [I]81-algitha do n't know what [you]86-ernest are pleased to call realities , [[my]81-algitha dear]3722-my dear [Ernest]86-ernest , but [I]81-algitha can assure [you]86-ernest there are plenty of unpleasant facts , in this protected life of [ours]3772-ours . ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú [Nobody]3732-nobody can expect to escape unpleasant facts , ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . ‚Äú Then for heaven 's sake , let [us]3772-ours purchase with [them]3774-them something worth having ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria cried . ‚Äú Hear , hear ! ‚Äù[81-algitha] assented [Algitha]81-algitha . ‚Äú Unpleasant facts being a foregone conclusion , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added , ‚Äú the point to aim at obviously is interesting facts ‚Äî and plenty of them . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Ernest]86-ernest flicked a pebble off the parapet of the balustrade of [the little temple]492-the little temple , and watched it fall , with a silent splash , into [the river]437-the river . ‚Äú [I]86-ernest never met [girls]3769-girls before , who wanted to come out of [their]3769-girls cotton - wool , ‚Äù[86-ernest] [he]86-ernest observed . ‚Äú [I]86-ernest thought [girls]3769-girls loved cotton - wool . [They]3769-girls always seem to . ‚Äù[86-ernest] ‚Äú [Girls]90-girls seem an astonishing number of things that [they]90-girls are not , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú especially to [men]3698-men . [A poor benighted man]3778-a poor benighted man might as well try to get on to confidential terms with [the Sphinx]3779-the sphinx , as to learn the real thoughts and wishes of [a girl]3734-a girl . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú [You]351-his sister two are exceptional , [you]351-his sister see , ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . ‚Äú Oh , [everybody]3781-everybody 's exceptional , if [you]86-ernest only knew it ! ‚Äù[351-his sister] exclaimed [[his]86-ernest sister]351-his sister . ‚Äú [Girls]3769-girls , ‚Äù[351-his sister] [she]351-his sister went on to assert , ‚Äú are stuffed with certain stereotyped sentiments from [their]3769-girls infancy , and when that painful process is completed , [intelligent philosophers]3783-intelligent philosophers come and smile upon [the victims]3784-the victims , and point to [them]3784-the victims as proofs of the intentions of Nature regarding [our]3785-our sex , admirable examples of the unvarying instincts of [the feminine creature]3786-the feminine creature . A loud shout , accompanied by the barking of several dogs , announced the approach of [the two younger boys]495-the two younger boys . [Boys]496-boys and dogs had been taking [their]495-the two younger boys morning bath in [the river]437-the river . ‚Äú [You]495-the two younger boys have broken in upon a most interesting discourse , ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . ‚Äú [Hadria]211-hadria was really coming out . ‚Äù[86-ernest] This led to a general uproar . When peace was restored , the conversation went on in desultory fashion . [Ernest]86-ernest and [Hadria]211-hadria fell apart into a more serious talk . [These two]498-these two had always been ‚Äú chums , ‚Äù[498-these two] from the time when [they]498-these two used to play at building houses of bricks on [the nursery floor]499-the nursery floor . The day broke into splendour , and the warm rays , rounding the edge of [the eastward rock]500-the eastward rock , poured straight into [the little temple]492-the little temple . Below and around on the cliff - sides , the rich foliage of holly and dwarf oak , ivy , and rowan with its burning berries , was transformed into a mass of warm colour and shining surfaces . ‚Äú What always bewilders [me]211-hadria , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria said , bending over the balustrade among the ivy , ‚Äú is the enormous gulf between what might be and what is in human life . [She]81-algitha had followed the usual aims with unusual success , giving unalloyed satisfaction to [[her]81-algitha proud mother]509-her proud mother . [The laird of [Clarenoc]7-clarenoc]521-the laird of clarenoc ‚Äî [a fine property]522-a fine property , of which [Algitha]81-algitha might have been [mistress]523-mistress ‚Äî had received polite discouragement , much to [his]521-the laird of clarenoc surprise and that of [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood . [She]81-algitha said that [she]81-algitha had long been thinking of accepting the post offered [her]81-algitha by [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan last year , and now [she]81-algitha was resolved . The work was really wise , useful work among [the poor]543-the poor , which [Algitha]81-algitha felt [she]81-algitha could do well . At [home]3770-home , there was nothing that [she]81-algitha did that [the housekeeper]545-the housekeeper could not do better . [She]81-algitha felt [herself]81-algitha fretting and growing irritable , for mere want of some active employment . This was utterly absurd , in an overworked world . [Hadria]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria music and [her]211-hadria study , at any rate , but [Algitha]81-algitha had nothing that seemed worth doing ; [she]81-algitha did not care to paint indifferently on china ; [she]211-hadria was a mere encumbrance ‚Äî a destroyer as [Hadria]211-hadria put it ‚Äî while there was so much , so very much , that waited to be done . [The younger sister]546-the younger sister made no comment . ‚Äú Next time [I]83-fred meet [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , ‚Äù[83-fred] said [Fred]83-fred , drawing a long breath , ‚Äú [I]83-fred will tell [him]94-harold wilkins that if [a girl]3734-a girl does not marry , [she]3734-a girl can devote [herself]3734-a girl to [the poor]543-the poor . ‚Äù[83-fred] ‚Äú Or that [she]3734-a girl can remain to be [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation , eh , [Hadria]211-hadria ? By [Jove]96-jove , what a row there will be ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] The notion of [Hadria]211-hadria in the capacity of the family consolation , created a shout of laughter . It had always been [her]211-hadria function to upset foregone conclusions , overturn orthodox views , and generally disturb the conformity of the family attitude . Now the sedate and established qualities would be expected of [her]211-hadria . [Hadria]211-hadria must be the stay and hope of [the house]296-the house ! [Fred]83-fred continued to chuckle , at intervals , over the idea . ‚Äú It does seem to indicate rather [a broken - down family]3837-a broken - down family ! ‚Äù[86-ernest] said [Ernest]86-ernest . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria wish [one of [[you]3839-you boys]3840-you boys]3838-one of you boys would undertake the position instead of laughing at [me]211-hadria , ‚Äù[211-hadria] exclaimed [Hadria]211-hadria in mock resentment . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria wish [you]3839-you would go to eternal tennis - parties , and pay calls , and bills , and write notes , and do little useless necessary things , more or less all day . [Everyone]3726-everyone was anxious to know when [Algitha]81-algitha intended to go to [London]8-london . [Nobody]3732-nobody doubted for a moment that [she]81-algitha would hold to [her]81-algitha purpose ; as [Fred]83-fred said , [she]81-algitha was so ‚Äú beastly obstinate . ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha had not fixed any time . It would depend on [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother . [She]81-algitha wished to make things as little painful as possible . That it was [her]81-algitha duty to spare [her]81-algitha pain altogether by remaining at [home]3770-home , [Algitha]81-algitha refused to admit . [She]81-algitha and [Hadria]211-hadria had thought out the question from all sides . The work [she]81-algitha was going to do was useful , but [she]81-algitha did not justify [herself]81-algitha on that ground . [She]81-algitha claimed the right to [her]81-algitha life and [her]81-algitha liberty , apart from what [she]81-algitha intended to do with either . [I]81-algitha want to spread [my]81-algitha wings . And why should [I]81-algitha not ? [Nobody]3732-nobody turns pale when [Ernest]86-ernest wants to spread [his]86-ernest . FULLERTON]97-mrs. fullerton had gone to [the study]552-the study , to consult with [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband on some matter of domestic importance . [It]552-the study was [a long , low - pitched room]554-a long , low - pitched room , situated in [the part of [the house]296-the house that stood at right angles to [the central block]557-the central block , with long , narrow windows looking on to [a rough orchard]558-a rough orchard]555-the part of the house that stood at right angles to the central block , with long , narrow windows looking on to a rough orchard . A few old portraits , very yellow and somewhat grotesque , hung on the walls ; a wood fire burnt on the hob - grate , and beside [it]552-the study stood a vast arm chair , considerably worn , with depressions shewing where [its owner]559-its owner had been leaning [his]559-its owner head , day after day , when [he]559-its owner smoked [his]559-its owner pipe , or took [his]559-its owner after - dinner nap . The bookshelves were stocked with scientific works , and some volumes on philosophy of a materialistic character . With the exception of [Robert Burns]98-robert burns , [not one poet]560-not one poet was represented . [The owner of [the house]296-the house]561-the owner of the house sat before a big writing - table , which was covered with papers . [His]561-the owner of the house face was that of [a hard thinker]563-a hard thinker ; the head was fine in form , the forehead broad and high ; the features regular , almost severe . The severity was softened by a genial expression . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , though also obviously above the average of humanity , shewed signs of incomplete development . The shape of the head and brow promised many faculties that the expression of the face did not encourage [one]329-one to expect . [She]97-mrs. fullerton was finely built ; and carried [herself]97-mrs. fullerton with dignity . When [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughters]364-her daughters accompanied [her]97-mrs. fullerton on a round of calls in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , [they]364-her daughters expressed a certain quality in [her]97-mrs. fullerton appearance , in rough and ready terms : ‚Äú [Other married women]3852-other married women always look such fools beside [mother]3851-mother ! ‚Äù[364-her daughters] And [they]364-her daughters did . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton wore [her]97-mrs. fullerton fine black hair brushed neatly over [her]97-mrs. fullerton forehead ; [her]97-mrs. fullerton eyes were large , and keen in expression . The mouth shewed determination . It was easy to see that [this lady]567-this lady had unbounded belief in [[her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband 's wisdom , except in social matters , for which [he]553-her husband cared nothing . On that point [she]567-this lady had to keep [her]567-this lady ambitions to [herself]567-this lady . In questions of philosophy , [she]567-this lady had imbibed [his]553-her husband tenets unmodified , and though [she]567-this lady went regularly every Sunday to [the close little Scottish church at [Ballochcoil]5-ballochcoil]569-the close little scottish church at ballochcoil , [she]567-this lady had no more respect than [[her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband had , for the doctrines that were preached [there]571-there . ‚Äú No doubt it is all superstition and nonsense , ‚Äù[567-this lady] [she]567-this lady used to say , ‚Äú but in [this country]3854-this country , one ca n't afford to fly in the face of prejudice . It would seriously tell against [the girls]370-the girls . ‚Äù[567-this lady] ‚Äú Well , have [your]567-this lady own way , ‚Äù[567-this lady] [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton would reply , ‚Äú but [I]567-this lady ca n't see the use of always bothering about what [people]3687-people will think . What more do [the girls]370-the girls want than [a good home]3858-a good home and plenty of lawn - tennis ? [They]370-the girls 'll get [husbands]3859-husbands fast enough , without [your]567-this lady asphyxiating [yourself]567-this lady every Sunday in [their]370-the girls interests . ‚Äù[567-this lady] In [her]567-this lady youth , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had shewn signs of qualities which had since been submerged . [[Her]567-this lady husband]553-her husband had influenced [her]567-this lady development profoundly , to the apparent stifling of every native tendency . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton thought imagination ‚Äú all nonsense , ‚Äù[89-mr. fullerton] and [[his]89-mr. fullerton wife]573-his wife had no doubt [he]89-mr. fullerton was right , though there was something to be said for [one or two of [the poets]575-the poets]574-one or two of the poets . The buried impulses had broken out , like a half - smothered flame , in [[her]567-this lady children]576-her children , especially in [[her]567-this lady younger daughter]577-her younger daughter . The talent in [[her]567-this lady daughters]364-her daughters , from which [she]567-this lady had hoped so much , seemed likely to prove a most dangerous obstacle to [their]364-her daughters success . Why was it that [clever people]585-clever people were never sensible ? The gong sounded for luncheon . [Austin]84-austin put [his]84-austin head in at the door of [the study]552-the study , to ask if [[his]84-austin father]587-his father would shew [him]84-austin a drop of ditch - water through the microscope , in the afternoon . ‚Äú If [you]97-mrs. fullerton will provide the ditch - water , [I]89-mr. fullerton will provide the microscope , ‚Äù[89-mr. fullerton] promised [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton genially . [Algitha]81-algitha and [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister made spasmodic remarks , and there were long pauses . [The latter]590-the latter had some anecdotes to tell of the ravages made by wasps . ‚Äú If [Buchanan]99-buchanan would only adopt [my]89-mr. fullerton plan of destroying [them]3860-them , ‚Äù[89-mr. fullerton] said [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton , ‚Äú [we]3861-we should soon get rid of the pest . ‚Äù[89-mr. fullerton] ‚Äú It 's some chemical , is n't it ? ‚Äù[97-mrs. fullerton] asked [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton . ‚Äú Oh , no ; that 's no use at all ! What [you]89-mr. fullerton do is this‚Äî. ‚Äù[97-mrs. fullerton] And then followed a long and minute explanation of [his]89-mr. fullerton plan , which had the merit of extreme originality . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton had [his]89-mr. fullerton own particular way of doing everything , a piece of presumption which was naturally resented , with proper spirit , by [[his]89-mr. fullerton neighbours]591-his neighbours . [He]89-mr. fullerton found it an expensive luxury . [He]89-mr. fullerton had taken Croachmore into [his]89-mr. fullerton own hands , and [this devoted farm]598-this devoted farm had become the subject of a series of drastic scientific experiments , to the great grief and indignation of [[his]89-mr. fullerton bailiff]599-his bailiff . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton believed implicitly in the value of these experiments , and so long as [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband tried science only on [the farm]601-the farm [she]97-mrs. fullerton had no misgivings ; but , alas , [he]553-her husband had lately taken shares in [some company]602-some company , that was to revolutionize agriculture through an ingenious contrivance for collecting nitrogen from the atmosphere . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton was confident that the new method was to be a gigantic success . But on this point , [[his]89-mr. fullerton wife]573-his wife uneasily shook [her]573-his wife head . [A mother disappointed in [[her]636-her children]576-her children]637-a mother disappointed in her children must be [a desperately unhappy woman]639-a desperately unhappy woman . But , as it is , the life of [a marionette]651-a marionette ‚Äî how ever affectionate [the wire - pullers]652-the wire - pullers ‚Äî does become monotonous after a time . ‚Äù ‚Äú[651-a marionette] As to that , ‚Äù said [the younger sister]546-the younger sister , with a little raising of the brows , as if half shrinking from what [she]0-i meant to say , ‚Äú[651-a marionette] [I]0-i think [most parents]653-most parents regard [[their]653-most parents children]654-their children with such favourable eyes , not so much because [they]654-their children are [they]654-their children as because [they]654-their children are [theirs]654-their children . ‚Äù [The sisters]3872-the sisters paced the length of [the garden]3867-the garden without speaking . Then [Hadria]211-hadria came to a standstill at the sun - dial , at the crossing of [the paths]3879-the paths , and began absently to trace the figures of the hours , with the stalk of a rose . ‚Äú[653-most parents] After all , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria said , ‚Äú[620-parents] [parents]620-parents are presumably not actuated by humanitarian motives in bringing one into [this wild world]656-this wild world . [They]620-parents do n't even profess to have felt an unselfish desire to see one enjoying [oneself]657-oneself at [their]620-parents expense ( though , as a matter of fact , what enjoyment [one]329-one has generally is at [their]620-parents expense ) . [People]3687-people are always enthusiastically congratulated on the arrival of [a new child]660-a new child , though it be the fourteenth , and the income two hundred a year ! This seems to point to a pronounced taste for [new children]661-new children , regardless of the consequences ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Oh , of course , ‚Äù said [Algitha]81-algitha , ‚Äú[0-i] it 's one of the canons ! [Women]606-women , above all , are expected to jubilate at all costs . And [I]0-i think [most of [them]606-women]663-most of them do , more or less sincerely . ‚Äù ‚Äú[606-women] Very well then , ‚Äù cried [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[606-women] it is universally admitted that [children]626-children are summoned into [the world]334-the world to gratify parental instincts . Yet [the parents]582-the parents throw all the onus of existence , after all , upon [the children]667-the children , and make [them]667-the children pay for it , and apologise for it , and justify it by a thousand sacrifices and an ever - flowing gratitude . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i am quite ready to give gratitude and sacrifice too , ‚Äù said [Algitha]81-algitha , ‚Äú[0-i] but [I]0-i do n't feel that [I]0-i ought to sacrifice everything to an idea that seems to [me]0-i wrong . Surely [a human being]668-a human being has a right to [his]668-a human being own life . If [he]668-a human being has not that , what , in heaven 's name , has [he]668-a human being ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[668-a human being] Anything but that ! ‚Äù cried [Hadria]211-hadria . While the momentous interview was going on , [Hadria]211-hadria walked restlessly up and down [the garden]3867-the garden , feverishly waiting . [The borders]3881-the borders were brilliant with vast sunflowers , white lilies , and blazing ‚Äú[668-a human being] red - hot pokers ‚Äù tangled together in splendid profusion , a very type of richness and glory of life . Such was the sort of existence that [Hadria]211-hadria claimed from [Fate]102-fate . [Her]211-hadria eyes turned to [the bare , forlorn hills that even the August sunshine]3882-the bare , forlorn hills that even the august sunshine could not conjure into sumptuousness , and there [she]211-hadria saw the threatened reality . When at last [Algitha]81-algitha 's fine figure appeared at the further end of [the path]3883-the path , [Hadria]211-hadria hastened forward and took [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister 's arm . ‚Äú[0-i] It was worse than [I]0-i had feared , ‚Äù [Algitha]81-algitha said , with a quiver in [her]0-i voice . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i know [I]0-i am right , and yet it seems almost more than [I]0-i am equal for . When [I]0-i told [mother]3851-mother , [she]3851-mother turned deadly white , and [I]0-i thought , for a moment , that [she]3851-mother was going to faint . Let 's sit down on this seat . ‚Äù ‚Äú[211-hadria] Oh , it was horrible , [Hadria]211-hadria ! [Mother]103-mother must have been cherishing hopes about [us]670-us , in a way that [I]0-i do n't think [she]3851-mother quite knew [herself]3851-mother . After that first moment of wretchedness , [she]3851-mother flew into a passion of rage ‚Äî that dreadful , tearing anger that [people]3687-people only feel when something of [themselves]3687-people is being wrenched away from [them]3687-people . [She]3851-mother said that [[her]3851-mother children]576-her children were all bad and unnatural ; that [she]3851-mother had spent [her]3851-mother whole life in [their]576-her children interests ; that if it had not been for [her]3851-mother , [we]670-us should all of [us]670-us have grown up without education or accomplishments , or looks , or anything else ; that [she]3851-mother watched over [us]670-us incessantly when [we]670-us were [little children]673-little children , denying [herself]3851-mother , spending [her]3851-mother youth in devotion to [us]670-us , when [she]3851-mother might have gone into [the world]334-the world , and had some brightness and pleasure . It is an insult to [every woman alive]697-every woman alive ! ‚Äù In [[Hadria]211-hadria 's room]3863-hadria 's room that night , [Algitha]81-algitha finally decided to delay [her]81-algitha going for another six months , hoping by that time that [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother would have grown used to the idea , and less opposed to it . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton dismissed it , as obviously absurd . But this high - handed treatment roused all the determination that [Algitha]81-algitha had inherited from [[her]81-algitha father]609-her father . [She]81-algitha put aside this , for [her]81-algitha purpose . Further delay , through [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan , brought the season round again to autumn , before [Algitha]81-algitha was able to make [her]81-algitha final preparations for departure . ‚Äú[698-them] Do try and reconcile [them]698-them to the idea , ‚Äù [she]81-algitha said to [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister , as [they]698-them stood on [the platform of [Ballochcoil station]3891-ballochcoil station]3890-the platform of ballochcoil station , very white and wretched - looking . ‚Äú[698-them] It breaks [my]0-i heart to see [father]3862-father look so fixed and angry , and [mother]3851-mother so miserable .
