Dear [me]0-i , a day 's journey will bring [me]0-i back , at any time . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i 'll do [my]0-i best , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[0-i] here 's [[your]701-your train]702-your train ; what a clumsy instrument of fate it does look ! ‚Äù There was not much time for farewells . In a few minutes [the train]3892-the train was steaming out of [the station]3893-the station . [A solitary figure]3894-a solitary figure stood on [the platform]3895-the platform , watching the monster curving and diminishing along the line , with its white smoke soaring merrily into the air , in great rolling masses , that melted , as if by some incantation , from thick , snow - like whiteness to rapid annihilation . AS [Hadria]211-hadria drove over [the winding upland road]3896-the winding upland road back to [[her]211-hadria home]3897-her home , [her]211-hadria thoughts followed [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister into [her]211-hadria new existence , and then turned wistfully backwards to the days that had been marked off into the past by [Algitha]81-algitha 's departure . How bright and eager and hopeful [they]3899-they had all been , how full of enthusiasm and generous ambitions ! Even as [they]3899-they talked of battle , [they]3899-they stretched forth [their]3899-they hands for the crown of victory . At the last meeting of the Preposterous Society , [Ernest]86-ernest had repeated a poem of [his]86-ernest favourite [Emerson]87-emerson , called Days , and the poem , which was familiar to [Hadria]211-hadria , sounded in [her]211-hadria memory , as the pony trotted merrily along [the well - known homeward way]3900-the well - known homeward way . In spite of [Hadria]211-hadria 's memorable lecture of a year ago , it was still the orthodox creed of [the Society]359-the society , that [Circumstance]106-circumstance is [the handmaid of the Will]3902-the handmaid of the will ; that [one]329-one can demand of [one]329-one 's days ‚Äú[0-i] bread , kingdoms , stars , or sky , ‚Äù and that the Days will obediently produce the objects desired . If [one has but the spirit that can soar high enough to really be resolved upon stars]3905-one has but the spirit that can soar high enough to really be resolved upon stars , or the ambition sufficiently vaulting to be determined on kingdoms , then ‚Äî so ran the dogma ‚Äî stars and kingdoms would be forthcoming , though obstacles were never so determined . [No member]3906-no member except [Hadria]211-hadria had ever dreamt of insinuating that one might have a very pronounced taste for stars and kingdoms ‚Äî nay , a taste so dominant that life would be worthless unless they were achieved ‚Äî yet might be forced , by the might of events , to forego them . [Hadria]211-hadria 's own heresy had been of the head rather than of the heart . But to - day , feeling began to share the scepticism of the intellect . What if one 's stars and kingdoms lay on the further side of a crime or a cruelty ? What then was left but to gather up [one]329-one 's herbs and apples , and bear , as best one might , the scorn of the unjust Days ? [Hadria]211-hadria cast about in [her]211-hadria mind for a method of utilizing to the best advantage possible , the means at [her]211-hadria disposal : to force circumstance to yield a harvest to [her]211-hadria will . To be [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation meant no light task , for [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was exacting by nature : [she]97-mrs. fullerton had given much , and [she]97-mrs. fullerton expected much in return . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton logic was somewhat faulty , but that could not be gracefully pointed out to [her]97-mrs. fullerton by [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter . Having allowed [her]97-mrs. fullerton own abilities to decay , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had developed an extraordinary power of interfering with the employment of the abilities of [others]432-others . [Hadria]211-hadria had rather underrated than exaggerated this difficulty . [[Her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother would keep [her]211-hadria for hours , discussing a trivial point of domestic business , giving elaborate directions about it , only to do it [herself]211-hadria in the end . [She]211-hadria spent [her]211-hadria whole life in trifles of this kind , or over social matters . Everything was done cumbrously , with an incredible amount of toil and consideration , and without any noticeable results . [Hadria]211-hadria , fighting against a multitude of harassing little difficulties , struggled to turn the long winter months to some use . But [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton broke the good serviceable time into jagged fragments . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i really ca n't see , ‚Äù said [the mother]578-the mother , when [the daughter]3913-the daughter proposed to set apart certain hours for household duties , and to have other portions of the day to [herself]3913-the daughter , ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i really ca n't see why [a girl]3734-a girl 's little occupations should be treated with so much consideration . However , [I]0-i have no wish for grudging assistance . ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria 's temper was far indeed from perfect , and painful scenes often occurred . But as a rule , [she]211-hadria would afterwards be seized with a fit of remorse , knowing that [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother was suffering bitterly from [her]520-her mother keen disappointment about [Algitha]81-algitha . The failure of a life - long hope must try the endurance of [the bravest]3915-the bravest . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , seeing that [Hadria]211-hadria was more patient , quickly took advantage of the favourable moment , with a rapid instinct that had often done [her]211-hadria good service in the management of a niggard destiny . The valuable mood must not be allowed to die fruitless . [The elder girl]3916-the elder girl 's defection thus became , to [the mother]578-the mother , a sort of investment , bearing interest of docility in [the younger]3918-the younger . Because [the heartless Algitha]81-algitha had left [home]3770-home , it seemed to [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton that the very least that [Hadria]211-hadria could do , was to carry out [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's lightest wish . And so the weeks went by , in dreary , troublous fashion , cut into a hundred little barren segments . The mind had no space , or stretch , or solitude . It was incessantly harassed , and its impetus was perpetually checked . But [Hadria]211-hadria hoped on . This could not last for ever . Some day , doubtless , if [she]211-hadria sank not in spirit , the stars and the kingdoms would come . Meanwhile , the position of affairs was decidedly ridiculous . [She]211-hadria was here as [the family consolation]3836-the family consolation , and [nobody]3732-nobody seemed to be consoled ! [Her]211-hadria efforts had been sincere and even enthusiastic , but [the boys]3870-the boys only laughed at [her]211-hadria , in this r√¥le , and [nobody]3732-nobody was apparently in the least gratified ( except [those imps of [boys]496-boys]3925-those imps of boys ! ) . For a long time , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton seemed to be oblivious of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter 's efforts , but one day , when [they]3928-they had been talking about [Algitha]81-algitha , [the mother]578-the mother said : ‚Äú[705-your father] [[Your]704-you father]705-your father and [I]0-i now look to [you]704-you , [Hadria]211-hadria . [I]0-i do think that [you]704-you are beginning to feel a little what [your]704-you duty is . If [you]704-you also were to turn deserter in [our]706-our old age , [I]0-i think it would kill [us]706-our . ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria felt a thrill of horror . The network of Fate seemed to be fast closing round [her]211-hadria . The temporary was to become fixed . [She]211-hadria must act all [her]211-hadria days according to the conviction of [others]432-others , or [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents would die of grief ! When [she]211-hadria went to [the hills]413-the hills that afternoon , [she]211-hadria felt as if [she]211-hadria must walk on and on into the dreamy distance , away from all these toils and claims , away into [the unknown world]3933-the unknown world and never return . But , alas ! the night descended and return [she]211-hadria must . These wild impulses could never be followed . The day had been peculiarly harassing and cut up ; [some neighbours]3934-some neighbours had been to afternoon tea and tennis , and the sight of [their]3934-some neighbours faces and the sound of [their]3934-some neighbours talk had caused , in [Hadria]211-hadria , an unutterable depression . The light , conventional phrases rang in [her]211-hadria ears still , the expression of the faces haunted [her]211-hadria , and into [her]211-hadria heart crept a chill that benumbed every wish and hope and faith that [she]211-hadria had ever cherished . [She]211-hadria sat up late into the night . Since freedom and solitude could not be had by day , the nights were often [her]211-hadria sole opportunity . At such times [she]211-hadria would work out [her]211-hadria musical ideas , which in the dead silence of [the house]296-the house were brought forth plentifully . These , from [her]211-hadria point of view , were the fruitful hours of the twenty - four . Thoughts would throng the darkness like swarms of living things . [Hadria]211-hadria 's mood found expression to - night in a singular and most melancholy composition . [She]211-hadria called it Futility . It was unlike anything that [she]211-hadria had ever done before , and [she]211-hadria felt that it shewed an access of musical power . [She]211-hadria dreamt an absurd dream : That [she]211-hadria was [herself]211-hadria one of [those girls with the high pattering accents , playing tennis without ceasing and with apparent cheerfulness]3936-those girls with the high pattering accents , playing tennis without ceasing and with apparent cheerfulness ; talking just as [they]3934-some neighbours had talked , and about just the same things ; and all the time , a vast circle of shadowy forms stood watching , beckoning , and exhorting and warning , and turning away , at last , in sorrowful contempt , because [she]211-hadria preferred to spend [her]211-hadria youth eternally in futilities . And then [they]3934-some neighbours all slowly drifted by with sad eyes fixed on [her]211-hadria , and [she]211-hadria was still left playing , playing . And it seemed as if whole weeks passed in that way , and [she]211-hadria grew mortally tired , but some power prevented [her]211-hadria from resting . The evil spell held [her]211-hadria enthralled . Always cheerful , always polite and agreeable , [she]211-hadria continued [her]211-hadria task , finding [herself]211-hadria growing accustomed to it at last , and duly resigned to the necessity , wearisome though it was . Then all hope that the game would ever cease went away , and [she]211-hadria played on , mechanically , but always with that same polite cheerfulness , as of afternoon calls . [She]211-hadria would not for [the world]334-the world admit that [she]211-hadria was tired . But [she]211-hadria was so tired that existence became a torture to [her]211-hadria , and [her]211-hadria heart seemed about to break with the intolerable strain ‚Äî when [she]211-hadria woke up with a start , and found [herself]211-hadria lying in a constrained attitude , half - choked by the bed - clothes . [She]211-hadria did not see the comic side of the dream till next morning , when [she]211-hadria told it at breakfast for the benefit of [the family]360-the family . As [Hadria]211-hadria was [an ardent tennis - player]3939-an ardent tennis - player , it struck [[her]211-hadria brethren]3940-her brethren as a particularly inappropriate form of nightmare . [Hadria]211-hadria , at this time , went frequently with [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father on [his]609-her father farming walks , as [he]609-her father liked to have [one or more of [the family]360-the family]3942-one or more of the family with [him]609-her father . [She]211-hadria enjoyed these walks , for [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton would talk about philosophy and science , often of the most abstruse and entrancing kind . [[His]89-mr. fullerton children]362-his children were devoted to [him]89-mr. fullerton . During these expeditions , [they]362-his children always vied with [one another]3945-one another to ferret out the most absurd story to tell [him]89-mr. fullerton , [he]89-mr. fullerton being held as conqueror who made [[their]362-his children father]3946-their father laugh most heartily . Sometimes [they]362-his children all went in a body , armed with wild stories ; and occasionally , across [the open fields]3947-the open fields , a row of [eccentric - looking figures]3948-eccentric - looking figures might be seen , struggling in the grip of hilarious paroxysms ; [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton doubled up in the middle of [a turnip - field]3949-a turnip - field , perhaps , with [[his]89-mr. fullerton family]3868-his family in contortions round [him]89-mr. fullerton . The air of [the hills]413-the hills seemed to run to [their]362-his children heads , like wine . Roulades of laughter , hearty guffaws , might have been heard for surprising distances , much to the astonishment of [the sober labourers]3952-the sober labourers bending over [their]362-his children toil . [Ernest]86-ernest had to go back to [college]3953-college ; [Fred]83-fred and [Austin]84-austin to [school]3954-school . [The house]296-the house seemed very quiet and sad after [the boys]3870-the boys left , and [Hadria]211-hadria missed [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister more and more , as time went on . [Algitha]81-algitha wrote most happily . ‚Äú[0-i] With all its drawbacks , this existence of hard work ( yet not too hard ) suits [me]0-i exactly . It uses up [my]0-i energies ; yet , in spite of the really busy life [I]0-i lead , [I]0-i literally have more leisure than [I]0-i used to have at [home]3770-home , where all through the day , there was some little detail to be attended to , some call to make , some convention to offer incense to , some prejudice to respect . Here , once [my]0-i day 's work is over , it is over , and [I]0-i have good solid hours of leisure . [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i have earned those hours when [they]708-they come ; also that [I]0-i have earned a right to [my]0-i keep , as [Wilfred Burton]107-wilfred burton , [the socialist]709-the socialist , puts it somewhat crudely . When [I]0-i go to bed at night , [I]0-i can say : ‚Äò Because of [me]0-i , this day , heavy hearts have been made a little lighter . ‚Äô [I]0-i hear all sorts of opinions , and see all sorts of [people]3687-people . [I]0-i never was so happy in [my]0-i life . ‚Äù It was [Hadria]211-hadria 's habit still to take solitary rambles over [the country]401-the country . [A passionate lover of Nature]3959-a passionate lover of nature , [she]211-hadria found endless pleasure in its ever - changing aspects . Yet of late , a new feeling had begun to mutter angrily within [her]211-hadria : a resentment against these familiar sights and sounds , because they were the boundaries of [her]211-hadria horizon . [She]211-hadria hated the line of the round breezy hills where the row of fir - trees stood against the sky , because that was the edge of [[her]211-hadria world]3960-her world , and [she]211-hadria wanted to see what was beyond . [She]211-hadria must and would see what was beyond , some day . [Her]211-hadria hope was always vague ; for if [she]211-hadria dared to wonder how the curtain of life was to be lifted , [she]211-hadria had to face the fact that there was no reasonable prospect of such a lifting . Still , the utter horror of living on always , in this fashion , seemed to prove it impossible . On one dim afternoon , when the sun was descending , [Hadria]211-hadria 's solitary figure was noticed by [a white - haired lady]3961-a white - haired lady , presumably [a tourist]3962-a tourist , who had stopped to ask a question of [some farm labourers]3963-some farm labourers , working in [a field]3964-a field . [She]211-hadria ceased to listen to the information , on the subject of [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , that was given to [her]211-hadria in a broad Scottish dialect . The whole scene , which an instant before had impressed [her]211-hadria as one of beauty and peace , suddenly focussed itself round [the dark figure]3965-the dark figure , and grew sinister in its aspect . At that moment , nothing would have persuaded [the onlooker]3966-the onlooker that [the hastening figure]3967-the hastening figure was not hastening towards misfortune . [A woman of impulse]3968-a woman of impulse , [she]211-hadria set off in purposeless pursuit . [Hadria]211-hadria 's pace was very rapid ; [she]211-hadria was trying to outrun thought . It was impossible to live without hope , yet hope , in [this forlorn land]3969-this forlorn land , was growing faint and tired . [[Her]211-hadria pursuer]3970-her pursuer was [a remarkable - looking woman , no longer young , with [her]3961-a white - haired lady prematurely white hair drawn up from [her]3961-a white - haired lady brow with a proud sweep that suited well [her]3961-a white - haired lady sharply defined features and [her]3961-a white - haired lady air of defiance]3971-a remarkable - looking woman , no longer young , with her prematurely white hair drawn up from her brow with a proud sweep that suited well her sharply defined features and her air of defiance . [She]3961-a white - haired lady was carelessly dressed after the prevailing fashion , and gave the impression of not having [her]3961-a white - haired lady life successfully in hand , but rather of being driven by it , as by a blustering wind , against [her]3961-a white - haired lady inclination . The impression which had seized [her]211-hadria , a moment ago , deepened as [she]211-hadria went . Something in the scene and [the hastening figure]3967-the hastening figure roused a sense of dread . With [her]211-hadria , an impression was like a spark to gunpowder . [Her]211-hadria imagination blazed up . Life , in its most tragic aspect , seemed before [her]211-hadria in the lonely scene , with [the lonely figure]3973-the lonely figure , moving , as if in pursuit of a lost hope , towards the setting sun . If [Hadria]211-hadria had not paused on [the brow of [the hill]3975-the hill]3974-the brow of the hill , it is unlikely that [she]211-hadria would have been overtaken , but that pause decided the matter . [The stranger]3976-the stranger seemed suddenly to hesitate , wondering , apparently , what [she]211-hadria had done this eccentric thing for . [Hadria]211-hadria , feeling a presence behind [her]211-hadria , turned nervously round and gave a slight start . In recording it for [Algitha]81-algitha 's benefit that evening , [Hadria]211-hadria found that [she]211-hadria could not reproduce the exhilarating quality , or describe the influence of [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's personality . [She]211-hadria was ‚Äú[111-mrs. mcewen] alive all round , ‚Äù as [[her]211-hadria disciple]4054-her disciple asserted . [Her]211-hadria love of Nature was intense . [Hadria]211-hadria had never before realized that [she]211-hadria had been without full sympathy in this direction . [She]211-hadria awoke to a strange retrospective sense of solitude , feeling a new pity for [the eager little child of years ago]4055-the eager little child of years ago , who had wandered up to [the garret]293-the garret , late at night , to watch the moonlight spread its white shroud over [the hills]413-the hills . With every moment spent in the society of [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria , new and clearer light seemed to [Hadria]211-hadria , to be thrown upon all the problems of existence ; not by any means only through what [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria directly said , but by what [she]109-valeria implied , by what [she]109-valeria took for granted , by what [she]109-valeria omitted to say . ‚Äú[111-mrs. mcewen] It seems like a home - coming from long exile , ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria wrote to [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i have been looking through a sort of mist , or as [one]329-one looks at one 's surroundings before quite waking . Now everything stands out sharp and cut , as objects do in the clear air of [the South]10-the south . Ah [me]0-i , [the South]10-the south ! [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria has spent much of [her]109-valeria life [there]571-there , and [my]0-i inborn smouldering passion for it , is set flaming by [her]109-valeria descriptions ! [You]770-you remember that brief little fortnight that [we]771-we spent with [mother]3851-mother and [father]3862-father in [Italy]11-italy ? [I]0-i seem now to be again under the spell of the languorous airs , the cloudless blue , [the white palaces]774-the white palaces , [the grey olive groves]775-the grey olive groves , and the art , the art ! Oh , [Algitha]81-algitha , [I]0-i must go to [the South]10-the south soon , soon , or [I]0-i shall die of [home]3770-home sickness ! [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria says that this is only one side of [me]0-i breaking out : that [I]0-i am northern at heart . [I]0-i think it is true , but meanwhile the thought of [the South]10-the south possesses [me]0-i . [I]0-i confess [I]0-i think [mother]3851-mother had some cause to be alarmed when [she]3851-mother saw [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , if [she]3851-mother wants to keep [us]778-us in a chastened mood , at [home]3770-home . It seems as if all of [me]0-i were in high carnival . Life is raised to a higher power . [I]0-i feel nearly omnipotent . Epics and operas are [child]780-child 's play to [me]0-i ! It is true [I]0-i have produced comparatively few ; but , oh , those that are to come ! [I]0-i feel fit for anything , from pitch - and - toss to manslaughter . [I]0-i think of the two , [I]0-i rather lean to the manslaughter . Oh , [I]0-i do n't mean it in the facetious sense ! that would be a terrible downfall from [my]0-i present altitudes . To such devices [the usual wretched girl , who has never drawn rebellious breath]781-the usual wretched girl , who has never drawn rebellious breath , or listened to the discourses of [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria , has to turn for a living , or to keep ennui at bay . But [I]0-i , no , [the inimical sex]782-the inimical sex may possess [their]783-they souls in peace , as far as [I]0-i am concerned . [They]783-they might retort that [they]783-they never had felt nervous , but a letter has the same advantage as the pulpit : [the adversary]784-the adversary can never get up and contradict . ‚Äú [That ridiculous adversary]4059-that ridiculous adversary , [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , is staying again at [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren , and [I]784-the adversary hear from [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon that [he]4059-that ridiculous adversary thinks it very strange that [I]784-the adversary should see so much of [so extraordinary a person]4060-so extraordinary a person as [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria ! Opinions differ of course ; [I]784-the adversary think it very strange that [the Gordons]92-the gordons should see so much of [so ordinary a person]4061-so ordinary a person as [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins . [Everybody]3781-everybody makes much of [him]94-harold wilkins here , and , alas ! all [the girls]370-the girls run after [him]94-harold wilkins , and even fall in love with [him]94-harold wilkins ; why , [I]784-the adversary ca n't conceive . For if driven by dire compulsion of fate , to bend [one]329-one 's thoughts upon some prosaic example of that prosaic sex , why not choose one of the many far more attractive candidates available ‚Äî [the Gordons]92-the gordons , [the McKenzies]114-the mckenzies , and so forth ? When [I]784-the adversary go to tennis parties with [mother]3851-mother ‚Äî [they]4066-they are still playing upon [the asphalte courts]4067-the asphalte courts ‚Äî and see the little dramas that go on , the jealousies and excitements , and general much - ado - about - nothing , [I]784-the adversary can scarcely believe that [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria really belongs to [the same planet]4068-the same planet as [ours]4069-ours . But [I]784-the adversary do n't feel so contemptuous as [I]784-the adversary did ; it is so pitiful . Out of [my]784-the adversary great wealth [I]784-the adversary can afford to be more generous . ‚Äú[784-the adversary] And when [I]0-i see [those wretched girls]785-those wretched girls fluttering round [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins , [I]0-i no longer turn up [my]0-i ‚Äò aughty nose ‚Äô ( as [old Mrs. Brooks]115-old mrs. brooks used to say ) . [I]0-i only think to [myself]0-i , ‚Äò [Heavens]786-heavens and [earth]787-earth ! what an aching , empty life [those young women]788-those young women must lead , if [they]788-those young women are actually reduced for interest and amusement to the utterances of [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins ! ‚Äô [They]788-those young women would have the pull of one though , if the utterances of [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins were the only utterances to be heard ! Perish the thought of such beggary ! ‚Äù The talks with [Valeria Du Prel]109-valeria grew more intimate , and more deeply interesting to [Hadria]211-hadria , every day . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria used often to look at [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion in amazement . ‚Äú[0-i] Where did [you]0-i come from ? ‚Äù [she]109-valeria exclaimed on one occasion . ‚Äú[0-i] [One]329-one would suppose [you]0-i had lived several lives ; [you]0-i seem to know things in such a subtle , intimate fashion ! ‚Äù [She]109-valeria used to ponder over the problem , wondering what [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue would say to it . There appeared to be more here than mere heredity could account for . But science had never solved this problem ; originality seemed always to enter upon its career , uncaused and unaccountable . It was ever a miraculous phenomenon . [The Professor]4071-the professor had always said so . Still the heritage was rich enough , in this case . Heredity might have some discoverable part in the apparent marvel . [Each member of [the Fullerton family]4073-the fullerton family]4072-each member of the fullerton family had unusual ability of some kind . [Their]4072-each member of the fullerton family knowledge of science , and [their]4072-each member of the fullerton family familiarity with the problems of philosophy , had often astonished [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . [Hadria]211-hadria 's accounts of the Preposterous Society made [her]211-hadria laugh and exclaim at the same moment . [She]211-hadria gave an envious sigh at the picture of [the eager little group]4074-the eager little group , with [their]4074-the eager little group warmth of affection for [one another]3945-one another , and [their]4074-the eager little group vivid interests . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , with all [her]109-valeria sadness , was youthful in spirit . [Hadria]211-hadria found [her]109-valeria far younger than [many girls of [her]211-hadria own age]4076-many girls of her own age . This set [her]211-hadria thinking . [She]211-hadria observed how rigid [most people]4077-most people become in a few years , and how the personality grows wooden , in the daily repetition of the same actions and the same ideas . This stiffening process had been attributed to the malice of Time ; but now [Hadria]211-hadria began to believe that narrow and ungenerous thought lay at the root of the calamity . The entire life of [the little world in which [she]211-hadria had grown up]4078-the little world in which she had grown up , on all its sides , in all its ideals and sentiments , stood before [her]211-hadria , as if [some great painter]4079-some great painter had made a picture of it . [She]211-hadria had never before been able to stand so completely apart from the surroundings of [her]211-hadria childhood . And [she]211-hadria was able to do so now , not because [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria discoursed about it , but because [Hadria]211-hadria 's point of view had shifted sympathetically to the point of view of [[her]211-hadria companion]3995-her companion , through the instinctive desire to see how these familiar things would look to alien eyes . That which had seemed merely prosaic and dreary , became characteristic ; the very things which [she]211-hadria had taken most for granted were exactly those which turned out to be the significant and idiomatic facts . These had made permanent inroads into the mind and character . It was with these that [Hadria]211-hadria would have to reckon all [her]211-hadria days , under whatever conditions [she]211-hadria might hereafter be placed . Daily surroundings were not merely pleasant or unpleasant facts , otherwise of no importance ; they were the very material and substance of character ; the push and impetus , or the let and hindrance ; [the guardians]4081-the guardians or [the assassins of the soul]4082-the assassins of the soul . [MISS DU PREL]109-valeria had promised to allow [Hadria]211-hadria to drive [her]211-hadria to [Darachanarvan]13-darachanarvan , [a little town]4083-a little town on [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , about [seven miles across [country]4087-country]4086-seven miles across country . [Hadria]211-hadria was in high spirits , as [they]4088-their trundled along [the white roads]4089-the white roads with the wind in [their]4088-their faces , [the hills]413-the hills and the blue sky spread out before [them]4088-their , the pleasant sound of the wheels and the trotting of the pony setting [their]4088-their thoughts to rhythm . The trees were all shedding their last yellow leaves , and the air was full of those faded memories of better days , whirling in wild companies across [the road]4037-the road , rushing upward on the breast of some vagabond gust , drifting , spinning , shuddering along [the roadside]4092-the roadside , to lie there at last , quiet , among a host of [brothers]377-brothers , with little passing tremors , as if ( said [Valeria]109-valeria ) [they]4088-their were silently sobbing because of [their]4088-their banishment from [[their]4088-their kingdom of the air]4094-their kingdom of the air . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , though [she]109-valeria enjoyed the beauty of the day and the scenery , seemed sad of mood . ‚Äú[0-i] This weather recalls so many autumns , ‚Äù [she]109-valeria said . ‚Äú[0-i] It reminds [me]0-i too vividly of wonderful days , whose like [I]0-i shall never see again , and [friends , many of whom are dead]790-friends , many of whom are dead , and [many lost sight of in this inexorable coming and going of]791-many lost sight of in this inexorable coming and going of [people and things]792-people and things , this inexorable change that goes on for ever . [I]0-i feel as if [I]0-i should go mad at times , because it will not stop , either in [myself]0-i or [others]432-others . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Ah , that is a dreadful thought ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] It comes to [me]0-i so insistently , perhaps , because of [my]0-i roving life , ‚Äù [she]0-i said . [She]0-i paused for a moment , and then [she]0-i fell into one of [her]0-i exalted moods , when [she]0-i seemed to lose consciousness of the ordinary conditions around [her]0-i , or rather to pierce deeper into their significance and beauty . [Her]0-i speech would , at such times , become rhythmic and picturesque ; [she]0-i evidently saw vivid images before [her]0-i , in which [her]0-i ideas embodied themselves . ‚Äú[0-i] [Most people who live always in one place]794-most people who live always in one place see the changes creeping on so gradually that [they]794-most people who live always in one place scarcely feel them , but with [me]0-i this universal flux displays itself pitilessly , [I]0-i can not escape . Go where [I]0-i will , there is something to measure the changes by . A shoal of yellow leaves whispers to [me]0-i of seasons long ago , and the old past days , with [their]795-their own intimate character that nothing ever repeats , flash before [me]0-i again with the vividness of yesterday ; and a flight of birds ‚Äî ah ! if [I]0-i could express what [they]795-their recall ! The dead years pass again in a great procession , a motley company ‚Äî some like [emperors]796-emperors , crowned and richly dowered , with the sound of trumpets and the tramping of many obsequious feet ; and others like [beggars]797-beggars , despoiled and hungry , trudging along [a dusty high road]798-a dusty high road , or like grey pilgrims bound , with bleeding feet , for [a far - off shrine]799-a far - off shrine . ‚Äù [They]4095-they entered [a little beech - wood]4096-a little beech - wood , whose leaves made a light of their own , strange and mystical . ‚Äú[800-you] [Yours]800-you must have been a wonderful life ! ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[800-you] Yes , [I]0-i have seen and felt many things , ‚Äù answered [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , stirred by the intoxication of the motion and the wind and the sunlight , ‚Äú[0-i] life has been to [me]0-i a series of intense emotions , as it will be to [you]800-you , [I]0-i fear ‚Äî ‚Äù ‚Äú[800-you] [You]800-you fear ? ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[800-you] Yes ; for that means suffering . Every wind that blows uses [you]800-you as an √Üolian harp . ‚Äù ‚Äú[800-you] That must be charming , at least for [those who live in [[your]800-you neighbourhood]802-your neighbourhood]801-those who live in your neighbourhood , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[801-those who live in your neighbourhood] No ; for often the harp rings false . [They]4098-they were traversing [an open , breezy country]4099-an open , breezy country , chequered with [wooded hollows]4100-wooded hollows , where generally [a village]4101-a village sought shelter from the winds . [They]4104-they were spinning down hill now , into [a warm bit of country watered by [the river]437-the river]4105-a warm bit of country watered by the river , and [Hadria]211-hadria drew rein . [The spot]395-the spot was so pleasant that [they]4104-they alighted , tied the pony to a tree , and wandered over the grass to [the river]437-the river 's edge . [Hadria]211-hadria picked [her]211-hadria way from stone to slippery stone , into [the middle of [the river]437-the river]4109-the middle of the river , where there was comparatively safe standing room . Here [she]211-hadria was suddenly inspired to execute the steps of a reel , while [Valeria]109-valeria stood dismayed on the bank , expecting every moment , to see the dance end in the realms of the trout . But [Hadria]211-hadria kept [her]211-hadria footing , and continued to step it with much solemnity . Meanwhile , [two young men on horseback]4111-two young men on horseback were coming down [the road]4037-the road ; but as a group of trees hid it from [the river]437-the river at this point , [they]4111-two young men on horseback were not noticed . Are [you]833-this conquering hero fond of dancing ? ‚Äù [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins was noted , far and wide , for [his]94-harold wilkins dancing , and the question was wounding . [He]94-harold wilkins was tall and loosely built , with brown expressionless eyes , dark hair , a pink complexion , shelving forehead , and a weak yet obstinate mouth . [[His]94-harold wilkins companion]4118-his companion also was tall and dark , but [his]94-harold wilkins face was pale , [his]94-harold wilkins forehead broad and high , and a black moustache covered [his]94-harold wilkins upper lip . [Hadria]211-hadria was so tickled by this finished behaviour under difficulties , that [she]211-hadria took [her]211-hadria cue from it , and decided to treat the matter in the same polished spirit . [She]211-hadria too would take it all decorously for granted . [Mr. Wilkins]94-harold wilkins introduced [[his]94-harold wilkins friend]4122-his friend : [Mr. Hubert Temperley]118-hubert . Can [I]0-i help [you]834-you ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[834-you] Thank [you]834-you , ‚Äù replied [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[834-you] This is a merely temporary resting - place . [We]836-we ought to be getting on ; [we]836-we have some miles yet to drive , ‚Äù and [she]211-hadria hurried [[her]211-hadria friend]4123-her friend away . [They]836-we were conducted to [the pony - cart]4124-the pony - cart by [the cavaliers]4125-the cavaliers , who raised [their]4125-the cavaliers hats , as [the ladies]4126-the ladies drove off at a merry pace , bowing [their]4126-the ladies farewells . ‚Äú[3844-woman] The eternal riddle ! ‚Äù [Temperley]118-hubert exclaimed , as [they]836-we turned the corner of [the road]4037-the road . ‚Äú[3844-woman] What is the eternal riddle ? ‚Äù [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins enquired . ‚Äú[3844-woman] [Woman]3844-woman , [woman]3844-woman ! ‚Äù [Temperley]118-hubert replied , a little impatiently . [He]118-hubert had not found [young Wilkins]94-harold wilkins quick to catch [his]118-hubert meaning during the two hours ' ride , and it occurred to [him]118-hubert that [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton would have been [a more interesting companion]4128-a more interesting companion . [He]118-hubert made a good many enquiries about [her]112-miss fullerton and [[her]112-miss fullerton family]4129-her family , on the way back to [Drumgarren]12-drumgarren . ‚Äú[3844-woman] [We]839-we are inviited to tennis at [[their]840-their house]841-their house , for next Tuesday , ‚Äù said [Harold]94-harold wilkins , ‚Äú[3844-woman] so [you]842-you will have a chance of pursuing the acquaintance . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i do n't admire [that sort of girl]843-that sort of girl . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Do n't [you]0-i ? [I]0-i am attracted by originality . [I]0-i like [a woman]3753-a woman to have something in [her]3753-a woman . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Depends on what it is . [I]0-i hate [a girl]3734-a girl to have a lot of silly ideas . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Perhaps [you]0-i prefer [her]3753-a woman to have but one , ‚Äù said [Temperley]118-hubert , ‚Äú[0-i] that one being that [Mr. Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins is [a charming fellow]846-a charming fellow . ‚Äù ‚Äú[846-a charming fellow] Nothing of the kind , ‚Äù cried [Harold]94-harold wilkins . ‚Äú[846-a charming fellow] [I]0-i ca n't help it if [girls]3769-girls run after [me]0-i ; it 's a great bore . ‚Äù [Temperley]118-hubert laughed . ‚Äú[0-i] [You]0-i , like [Achilles]119-achilles , are pursued by [ten thousand girls]848-ten thousand girls . [I]0-i deeply sympathize , though it is not an inconvenience that has troubled [me]0-i , even in [my]0-i palmiest days . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Why , how old are [you]0-i ? Surely [you]0-i are not going to talk as if those days were over ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i am moderately palmly still ! ‚Äù [Temperley]118-hubert admitted . ‚Äú[0-i] Still , the hour approaches when the assaults of time will become more disastrous . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [You]0-i and [Hadria Fullerton]211-hadria ought to get on well together , for [she]211-hadria is very musical , ‚Äù said [Harold Wilkins]94-harold wilkins . ‚Äú[211-hadria] Ah ! ‚Äù cried [Temperley]118-hubert with new interest . ‚Äú[211-hadria] [I]0-i could have almost told that from [her]211-hadria face . Does [she]211-hadria play well ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[211-hadria] Well , [I]0-i suppose so . [She]211-hadria plays things without any tune that bore [one]329-one to death , but [I]0-i daresay [you]0-i would admire it . [She]211-hadria composes too , [I]0-i am told . ‚Äù ‚Äú[211-hadria] Really ? Dear [me]0-i , [I]0-i must make a point of having a talk with [her]211-hadria , on the earliest opportunity . ‚Äù Meanwhile , [the occupants of [the pony - cart]4124-the pony - cart]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart had arrived at [Darachanarvan]13-darachanarvan , where [they]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart were to put up [the pony]4132-the pony and have luncheon . It was [a prosaic little Scottish town]4133-a prosaic little scottish town , with only a beautiful survival , here and there , from the past . After luncheon , [they]4130-the occupants of the pony - cart wandered down to [the banks of [the river]437-the river]479-the banks of the river , and watched [the trout]4136-the trout and [the running water]4137-the running water . [Hadria]211-hadria had long been wishing to find out what [[her]211-hadria oracle]4138-her oracle thought about certain burning questions on which [the sisters]3872-the sisters held such strong , and such unpopular sentiments , but just because the feeling was so keen , it was difficult to broach the subject . An opportunity came when [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria spoke of [her]109-valeria past . [Hadria]211-hadria was able to read between the lines . When [a mere girl]4140-a mere girl , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria had been thrown on [the world]334-the world ‚Äî brilliant , handsome , impulsive , generous ‚Äî to pass through a fiery ordeal , and to emerge with aspirations as high as ever , but with [her]109-valeria radiant hopes burnt out . But [she]109-valeria did not dwell on this side of the picture ; [she]109-valeria emphasized rather , the possibility of holding on through storm and stress to the truth that is born in one ; to belief in ‚Äú[211-hadria] the noblest and wildest hopes ( if [you]850-you like to call them so ) that ever thrilled generous hearts . ‚Äù But [she]109-valeria gave no encouragement to certain of [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion 's most vehement sentiments . [She]109-valeria seemed to yearn for exactly that side of life from which [the younger]3918-the younger shrank with so much horror . [She]109-valeria saw it under an entirely different aspect . [Hadria]211-hadria felt thrown back on [herself]211-hadria , lonely once more . ‚Äú[851-you] [You]851-you have seen [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria said at length , ‚Äú[91-mrs. gordon] what do [you]851-you think of [her]91-mrs. gordon ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[851-you] Nothing ; [she]91-mrs. gordon does not inspire thought . ‚Äù ‚Äú[851-you] Yet once [she]91-mrs. gordon was [a person]852-a person , not a thing . ‚Äù ‚Äú[91-mrs. gordon] , If [a woman]3753-a woman ca n't keep [her]3753-a woman head above water in [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's position , [she]3753-a woman must be [a feeble sort of person]854-a feeble sort of person . ‚Äù ‚Äú[3753-a woman] [I]0-i should not dare to say that , until [I]0-i had been put through [the mill]855-the mill [myself]0-i , and come out unpulverised . ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria failed to see what there was so very dreadful in [[Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's lot]4144-mrs. gordon 's lot . [She]91-mrs. gordon had , perhaps , rather more [children]626-children than was necessary , but otherwise ‚Äî ‚Äú[0-i] Oh , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , ‚Äù cried [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[0-i] [you]0-i might be [a mere man]856-a mere man ! That is just what [[my]0-i brothers]857-my brothers say . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i do n't understand what [you]0-i mean , ‚Äù said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú[0-i] Do explain . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Do [you]0-i actually ‚Äî [you]0-i of [all people]858-all people ‚Äî not recognize and hate the idea that lies so obviously at the root of all the life that is swarming round [us]859-us ‚Äî ? ‚Äù [Valeria]109-valeria studied [[her]109-valeria companion]3995-her companion 's excited face . ‚Äú[0-i] Are [you]0-i in revolt against the very basis of existence ? ‚Äù [she]109-valeria asked curiously . ‚Äú[0-i] No : at least ... but this is not what [I]0-i am driving at exactly , ‚Äù replied [Hadria]211-hadria , turning uneasily away from the close scrutiny . ‚Äú[0-i] Do n't [you]0-i know ‚Äî oh , do n't [you]0-i see ‚Äî how many women secretly hate , and shrink from this brutal domestic idea that fashions [their]860-them fate for [them]860-them ? ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's interest quickened . ‚Äú[0-i] Nothing strikes [me]0-i so much as the tamely acquiescent spirit of [the average woman]624-the average woman , and [I]0-i doubt if [you]0-i would find [another woman in [England]14-england]862-another woman in england to describe the domestic existence as [you]0-i do . ‚Äù ‚Äú[862-another woman in england] Perhaps not ; tradition prevents [them]860-them from using bad language , but [they]860-them feel , [they]860-them feel . ‚Äù ‚Äú[860-them] [Young girls]863-young girls perhaps , brought up very ignorantly , find life a little scaring at first , but [they]863-young girls soon settle down into [happy wives]864-happy wives and [mothers]865-mothers . ‚Äù ‚Äú[865-mothers] As the fibre grows coarser , ‚Äù assented [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[865-mothers] No ; as the affections awaken , and the instincts that hold society together , come into play . [I]0-i have revolted [myself]0-i from the conditions of life , but it is a hopeless business ‚Äî beating [one]329-one 's wings against the bars . ‚Äù ‚Äú[329-one] The bars are , half of them , of human construction , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[329-one] and against those one may surely be allowed to beat . ‚Äù ‚Äú[329-one] Of human construction ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i mean that prejudice , rather than instinct , has built up the system that [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon so amiably represents . ‚Äù ‚Äú[91-mrs. gordon] Prejudice has perhaps taken advantage of instinct to establish a somewhat tyrannical tradition , ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria admitted , ‚Äú[91-mrs. gordon] but instinct is at the bottom of it . There is , of course , in [our]867-our society , no latitude for variety of type ; that is the fault of so many institutions . ‚Äù ‚Äú[211-hadria] The ordinary domestic idea may have been suitable when [women]606-women were emerging from the condition of simple animals , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[120-nature] but now it seems to [me]0-i to be out of date . ‚Äù ‚Äú[120-nature] It can never be entirely out of date , dear [Hadria]211-hadria . [Nature]120-nature has asked of [women]606-women a great and hard service , but [she]120-nature has given [them]606-women the maternal instinct and its joys , in compensation for the burden of this task , which would otherwise be intolerable and impossible . It can only be undertaken at the instigation of some stupendous impetus , that blinds [the victim]870-the victim to the nature of [her]120-nature mission . It must be a sort of obsession ; an intense personal instinct , amounting to madness . [Nature]120-nature , being determined to be well served in this direction , has supplied the necessary monomania , and the domestic idea , as [you]871-you call it , grows up round this central fact . ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria moved restlessly to and fro by [the river bank]4147-the river bank . ‚Äú[329-one] [One]329-one presumes to look upon [oneself]329-one , at first ‚Äî in [one]329-one 's earliest youth , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria said , ‚Äú[329-one] as undoubtedly human , with human needs and rights and dignities . But this turns out to be an illusion . It is as an animal that one has to play the really important part in life ; it is by submitting to the demands of society , in this respect , that [one]329-one wins rewards and commendation . Of course , if one likes to throw in a few ornamental extras , so much the better ; it keeps up appearances and the aspect of refined sentiment ‚Äî but the main point ‚Äî ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] [You]871-you are extravagant ! ‚Äù cried [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú[871-you] That is not the right way to look at it . ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] It is certainly not the convenient way to look at it . It is doubtless wise to weave as many garlands as [you]871-you can , to deck [yourself]871-you for the sacrifice . By that means , [you]871-you do n't quite see which way [you]871-you are going , because of the masses of elegant vegetation . ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] Ah ! [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]871-you exaggerate , [you]871-you distort ; [you]871-you forget so many things ‚Äî the sentiments , the affections , the thousand details that hallow that crude foundation which [you]871-you see only bare and unsoftened . ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] A repulsive object tastefully decorated , is to [me]0-i only the more repulsive , ‚Äù returned [Hadria]211-hadria , with suppressed passion . ‚Äú[871-you] There will come a day when [you]871-you will feel very differently , ‚Äù prophesied [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú[871-you] Perhaps . Why should [I]0-i , more than [the others]303-the others , remain uninfluenced by the usual processes of blunting , and grinding down , and stupefying , till [one]329-one grows accustomed to [one]329-one 's function , [one]329-one 's intolerable function ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3722-my dear , [[my]0-i dear]3722-my dear ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry if [I]0-i shock [you]871-you , but that is how [I]0-i feel . [I]0-i have seen this sort of traditional existence and nothing else , all [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i have been brought up to it , with the rest ‚Äî prepared and decked out like some animal for market ‚Äî all in the most refined and graceful manner possible ; but how can [one]329-one help seeing through the disguise ; how can [one]329-one be blind to the real nature of the transaction , and to the fate that awaits [one]329-one ‚Äî awaits [one]329-one as inexorably as death , unless by some force of [one]329-one 's own , with all the world ‚Äî [friends]886-friends and [enemies]887-enemies ‚Äî in opposition , [one]329-one can avert it ? ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria remained silent . ‚Äú[871-you] [You]871-you can avert it , ‚Äù [she]109-valeria said at last ; ‚Äú[871-you] but at what cost ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[109-valeria] [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , [I]0-i would rather sweep a crossing , [I]0-i would rather beg in [the streets]889-the streets , than submit to the indignity of such a life ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] Then what do [you]871-you intend to do instead ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[871-you] Ah ! there 's the difficulty . What can [one]329-one do instead , without breaking [somebody]891-somebody 's heart ? Nothing , except breaking [one]329-one 's own . And even putting that difficulty aside , it seems as if [everyone]3726-everyone 's hand were against [a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for [her]894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her]894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her . ‚Äù ‚Äú[894-a woman who refuses the path that has been marked out for her] No , no , it is not so bad as that . There are many openings now for [women]606-women . ‚Äù ‚Äú[606-women] But , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[606-women] as far as [I]0-i can gather , ordinary ability is not sufficient to enable [them]606-women to make a scanty living . The talent that would take [a man]3704-a man to the top of the tree is required to keep [a woman]3753-a woman in a meagre supply of bread and butter . ‚Äù ‚Äú[606-women] Allowing for exaggeration , that is more or less the case , ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria admitted . ‚Äú[606-women] [I]0-i have revolted against [the common lot]898-the common lot , ‚Äù [she]0-i went on after a pause , ‚Äú[0-i] and [you]899-you see what comes of it ; [I]0-i am alone in [the world]334-the world . [One]329-one does not think of that when [one]329-one is quite young . ‚Äù ‚Äú[329-one] Would [you]899-you rather be in [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon 's position than in [your]899-you own ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[899-you] [I]0-i doubt not that [she]91-mrs. gordon is happier . ‚Äù ‚Äú[899-you] But would [you]899-you change with [her]91-mrs. gordon , surrendering all that [she]91-mrs. gordon has surrendered ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[899-you] Yes , if [I]0-i were of [her]91-mrs. gordon temperament . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Ah ! After a pause [she]109-valeria said : ‚Äú[899-you] [A woman]3753-a woman can not afford to despise the dictates of Nature . [She]3753-a woman may escape certain troubles in that way ; but Nature is not to be cheated , [she]3753-a woman makes [[her]3753-a woman victim]905-her victim pay [her]3753-a woman debt in another fashion . There is no escape . The centuries are behind one , with all [their]906-their weight of heredity and habit ; the order of society adds its pressure ‚Äî [one]329-one 's own emotional needs . Ah , no ! it does not answer to pit [oneself]329-one against [one]329-one 's race , to bid defiance to the fundamental laws of life . ‚Äù ‚Äú[906-their] Such then are the alternatives , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , moving close to [[the river]437-the river 's brink]4149-the river 's brink , and casting two big stones into the current . ‚Äú[906-their] There stand the devil and [the deep sea]909-the deep sea . ‚Äù ‚Äú[899-you] [You]899-you are too young to have come to that sad conclusion , ‚Äù said [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú[899-you] But [I]0-i have n't , ‚Äù cried [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i still believe in revolt . ‚Äù [The other]3994-the other shook [her]3994-the other head . ‚Äú[0-i] And what about love ? Are [you]899-you going through life without the one thing that makes it bearable ? ‚Äú [I]109-valeria would not purchase it at such a cost . If [I]109-valeria ca n't have it without despoiling [myself]109-valeria of everything that is worth possessing , [I]109-valeria prefer to go without . ‚Äù[109-valeria] ‚Äú [You]899-you do n't know what [you]899-you say ! ‚Äù[109-valeria] exclaimed [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú But why ? Love would be ruined and desecrated . [I]109-valeria understand by it a sympathy so perfect , and a reverence so complete , that the conditions of ordinary domestic existence would be impossible , unthinkable , in connection with it . ‚Äù[109-valeria] ‚Äú So do [I]109-valeria understand love . But it comes , perhaps , once in a century , and if one is too fastidious , it passes by and leaves [one]329-one forlorn : at best , it comes only to open the gates of [Paradise]15-paradise , for a moment , and to close [them]4152-them again , and leave one in outer darkness . ‚Äù[109-valeria] ‚Äú Always ? ‚Äù[109-valeria] ‚Äú [I]109-valeria believe always , ‚Äù[109-valeria] answered [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . The running of [the river]437-the river sounded peacefully in the pause that followed . ‚Äú Well , ‚Äù[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria at length , raising [her]211-hadria head with a long sigh , ‚Äú one can not do better than follow [one]329-one 's own instinct and thought of the moment . Regret may come , do what [one]329-one may . [One]329-one can not escape from [one]329-one 's own temperament . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú [One]329-one can modify it . ‚Äù[109-valeria] ‚Äú [I]211-hadria can not even wish to modify [mine]211-hadria , so that [I]211-hadria should become amenable to these social demands . Audacious , is it not ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú [I]109-valeria like audacity , ‚Äù[109-valeria] returned [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria . ‚Äú As [I]109-valeria understand [you]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria require an altogether new dispensation ! ‚Äù[109-valeria] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a half smile , conscious of [her]211-hadria stupendous demand . Then [she]211-hadria said , with a peculiar movement of the head , as if throwing off a heavy weight , and looking before [her]211-hadria steadily : ‚Äú Yes , [I]211-hadria require a new dispensation . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [HUBERT TEMPERLEY]118-hubert made a point of going to the tennis - party , on Tuesday , at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , in order to talk to [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton . [He]118-hubert had not expected to find original musical talent in [this out - of - the - way place]911-this out - of - the - way place . [Hadria]211-hadria was in a happy mood , for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had so far overcome [her]520-her mother prejudice against [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , as to ask [her]211-hadria to join the party . The festivity had , therefore , lost its usual quality of melancholy . It was a warm afternoon , and [every one]913-every one seemed cheerful ‚Äú and almost intelligent , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria commented . The first words that [Mr. Temperley]118-hubert uttered , made [her]211-hadria turn to [him]118-hubert , in surprise . [She]211-hadria was so unaccustomed to be interested in what [the people about here]914-the people about here had to say . [Even intelligent visitors]915-even intelligent visitors usually adopted the tone of [the inhabitants]916-the inhabitants . [Hubert Temperley]118-hubert 's manner was very polished . [His]118-hubert accent denoted mental cultivation . [He]118-hubert spoke with eloquence of literature , and praised enthusiastically most great names dating securely from the hallowed past . Of modern literature [he]118-hubert was [a stern critic]917-a stern critic ; of music [he]118-hubert spoke with ardour . ‚Äú [I]118-hubert hear that [you]211-hadria not only perform but compose , [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton , ‚Äù[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert said . ‚Äú As soon as [I]118-hubert heard that , [I]118-hubert felt that [I]118-hubert must make [your]211-hadria acquaintance . [[My]118-hubert friends]4159-my friends , [the Gordons]92-the gordons , are very charming , but [they]4159-my friends do n't understand a note of music , and [I]118-hubert am badly off for a kindred spirit . ‚Äù[118-hubert] ‚Äú [My]211-hadria composing is a very mild affair , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria answered . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria suppose [you]118-hubert are more fortunate . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú Not much . [I]118-hubert am pretty busy [you]211-hadria see . [I]118-hubert have [my]118-hubert profession fession . [I]118-hubert play a good deal ‚Äî the piano and the ' cello are [my]118-hubert instruments . But [my]118-hubert difficulty is to find [someone]4160-someone to accompany [me]118-hubert . [[My]118-hubert sister]4161-my sister does when [she]4161-my sister can , but of course with [a house]4162-a house and [family]4163-family to look after ‚Äî [I]118-hubert am sometimes selfish enough to wish [she]4161-my sister had not married . [We]4164-we used to be [such good friends]4165-such good friends . ‚Äù[118-hubert] ‚Äú Is that all over ? ‚Äù[118-hubert] ‚Äú It is different . [She]4161-my sister always manages to be busy now , ‚Äù[118-hubert] said [Temperley]118-hubert in a slightly ironical tone . [He]118-hubert plunged once more , into a musical discussion . [Hadria]211-hadria had reluctantly to cut it short , in order to arrange tennis - matches . This task was performed as usual , somewhat recklessly . Polite and amiable in indiscriminate fashion , [Hadria]211-hadria ignored the secret jealousies and heart - burnings of [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , only to recognise and repent [her]211-hadria mistakes when too late . To - day [she]211-hadria was even more unchastened than usual in [her]211-hadria dealings with inflammable social material . ‚Äú [Hadria]211-hadria ! ‚Äù[97-mrs. fullerton] cried [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , taking [her]211-hadria aside , ‚Äú How could [you]211-hadria ask [Cecilia Gordon]121-cecilia gordon to play with [young McKenzie]122-young mckenzie ? [You]211-hadria know [[their]122-young mckenzie families]4166-their families are not on speaking terms ! ‚Äù[97-mrs. fullerton] [Everyone]3726-everyone , except [the culprit]920-the culprit , had remarked the haughty manner in which [Cecilia]121-cecilia gordon wielded [her]121-cecilia gordon racket , and the gloomy silence in which the set was played . [Hadria]211-hadria , though not impenitent , laughed . ‚Äú How does [Miss Gordon]123-miss gordon manage to be energetic and chilling at the same time ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria exclaimed . [Temperley]118-hubert and [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria strolled off together , [his]118-hubert vast height bent deferentially towards [her]109-valeria . This air of deference proved somewhat superficial . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria found that [his]118-hubert opinions were of an immovable order , with very defined edges . In some indescribable fashion , those opinions partook of the general elegance of [his]118-hubert being . Not for worlds would [he]118-hubert have harboured an exaggerated or immoderate idea . In politics [he]118-hubert was conservative , but [he]118-hubert did not abuse [[his]118-hubert opponents]942-his opponents . [He]118-hubert smiled at [them]942-his opponents : [he]118-hubert saw no reason for supposing that [they]942-his opponents did not mean quite as well as [he]118-hubert did , possibly better . What [he]118-hubert did see reason to doubt , was [their]942-his opponents judgment . [His]118-hubert tolerance was urbane and superior . On all questions , however , whether [he]118-hubert knew much about [them]942-his opponents or little , [his]118-hubert judgment was final and absolute . [He]118-hubert swept away whole systems of thought that had shaken [the world]334-the world , with a confident phrase . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked at [him]118-hubert with increasing amazement . May [I]118-hubert ask why ? ‚Äù[118-hubert] ‚Äú Because [I]118-hubert consider that is the kind of work for which [they]4191-all women are best fitted , ‚Äù[118-hubert] replied [Temperley]118-hubert serenely . ‚Äú Then [you]118-hubert are to be judge and jury in the case ; [your]118-hubert opinion , not [theirs]4191-all women , is to decide the matter . [I]211-hadria think that must be the object of [them]4219-them ‚Äî to accustom [people]3687-people to do without human sympathy . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Temperley]131-temperley tried to start a conversation , taking a place beside [her]211-hadria , on the seat , and setting [himself]131-temperley to draw [her]211-hadria out . [Hadria]211-hadria , feeling that [her]211-hadria character was being analysed , did what [many people]986-many people do without realizing it : [she]211-hadria instinctively arranged its lights and shades with a view to artistic effect . It was not till late that night , when the events of the day passed before [her]211-hadria in procession , that [she]211-hadria recognized what [she]211-hadria had done , and laughed at [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria had not attempted to appear in a better light than [she]211-hadria deserved ; quite as often as not , [she]211-hadria submitted to appear in a worse light ; [her]211-hadria effort had been to satisfy some innate sense of proportion or form . [His]1019-his was the next chuckle , and ‚Äú Do [you]89-mr. fullerton remember that day when ‚Äî ? ‚Äù[1019-his] and so forth , [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton 's healthy roar following avalanche - like , upon the reminiscence . ‚Äú [We]4242-we thought [him]4071-the professor [a good and kind magician]4243-a good and kind magician when [we]4242-we were [children]626-children , ‚Äù[211-hadria] was [Hadria]211-hadria 's thought , ‚Äú and now [one]329-one is grown up , there is no disillusion . [THE Professor]4071-the professor 's presence in [the house]296-the house had a profound influence on [the inmates]1025-the inmates , one and all . [Temperley]118-hubert looked annoyed . It struck [Hadria]211-hadria that [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue had a very sad expression when [he]116-professor fortescue was not speaking . [He]116-professor fortescue sat and looked on , enjoying [his]116-professor fortescue idleness with the zest of [a hard worker]1065-a hard worker . [She]211-hadria was leaning against the dyke , pensively enjoying [her]211-hadria festive meal . The dark fresh blue of [her]211-hadria gown , and the unwonted tinge of colour in [her]211-hadria cheeks , gave a vigorous and healthful impression , in harmony with the weather - beaten stones and the windy breadth of [the northern landscape]1066-the northern landscape . [The Professor]4071-the professor studied the face with a puzzled frown . [He]4071-the professor flattered [himself]4071-the professor that [he]4071-the professor was [a subtle physiognomist]1068-a subtle physiognomist , but in this case , [he]4071-the professor would not have dared to pronounce judgment . Danger and difficulty might have been predicted , for it was a moving face , one that could not be looked upon quite coldly . And [the Professor]4071-the professor had come to the conclusion , from [his]4071-the professor experience of life , that the instinct of [the average human being whom another has stirred to strong emotion]1070-the average human being whom another has stirred to strong emotion , is to fasten upon and overwhelm [that luckless person]1071-that luckless person , to burden [him]1071-that luckless person with responsibilities , to claim as much of time , and energy , and existence , as can in any way be wrung from [him]1071-that luckless person , careless of the cost to [the giver]1072-the giver . [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue noticed , as [Hadria]211-hadria looked down , a peculiar dreaminess of expression , and something indefinable , which suggested a profoundly emotional nature . At present , the expression was softened . That this softness was not altogether trustworthy , however , [the Professor]4071-the professor felt sure , for [he]4071-the professor had seen , at moments , when something had deeply stirred [her]211-hadria , expressions anything but soft come into [her]211-hadria face . [He]4071-the professor thought [her]211-hadria capable of many things of which [the well - brought - up young Englishwoman]1074-the well - brought - up young englishwoman is not supposed to dream . It seemed to [him]4071-the professor , that [she]211-hadria had at least two distinct natures that were at war with one another : [the one greedy and pleasure - loving]1075-the one greedy and pleasure - loving , careless and even reckless ; the other deep - seeing and aspiring . But which of these two tendencies would experience probably foster ? ‚Äú [I]4071-the professor wonder what [you]211-hadria like best , next to acidulated drops , ‚Äù[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said at length , with one of [his]4071-the professor half - bantering smiles . ‚Äú There are few things in [this wide world]4265-this wide world that can be mentioned in the same breath with them , but toffy also has its potency upon the spirit . ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú [I]4071-the professor like not this mocking tone . ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú Then [I]211-hadria will not mock , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said . ‚Äú Yes , [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äù[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor went on meditatively , ‚Äú [you]211-hadria have grown up , if [an old friend]4266-an old friend may make such remarks , very much as [I]4071-the professor expected , from the promise of [your]211-hadria childhood . [You]211-hadria used to puzzle [me]4071-the professor even then . ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú Do [I]211-hadria puzzle [you]4071-the professor now ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria asked . ‚Äú Inexpressibly ! ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú How amusing ! But how ? ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú [One]329-one can generally see at a glance , or pretty soon , the general trend of [a character]4268-a character . But not with [you]211-hadria . A psalm was being sung , in a harsh but devout fashion , by [the congregation]1116-the congregation . The sound managed to find its way to the sweet outer air , though the ugly rectangular windows were all jealously closed against its beneficence . The sky had become overcast , and a few drops of rain having given warning of a shower , it was thought advisable to take shelter in [the porch]1117-the porch , till it was over . The psalm was ground out slowly , and with apparent fervour , to the end . Then the voice of [the minister]1118-the minister was heard wrestling in prayer . [The Professor]4071-the professor looked grave and sad , as [he]4071-the professor stood listening . And then occurred the incident that made this afternoon memorable to [Hadria]211-hadria . In [her]211-hadria last letter to [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , [she]211-hadria had said that [she]211-hadria could not imagine [the Professor]4071-the professor contemptuous or angry . [One]329-one 's sympathy is wasted . [She]211-hadria drew a deep sigh of relief . Without precisely realizing the fact , [she]211-hadria had been gradually sinking into an unformulated conviction that [human beings]4313-human beings are , at heart , ruthless and hard , as soon as [they]4313-human beings are brought beyond the range of familiar moral claims , which have to be respected on pain of popular censure . Self - initiated pity was nowhere to be found . The merciless coldness of [many excellent people]4314-many excellent people ( kind and tender , perhaps , within these accepted limits ) had often chilled [her]211-hadria to the heart , and prompted a miserable doubt of the eventual victory of good over evil in [the world]334-the world , which [[her]211-hadria father]609-her father always insisted was ruled by mere brute force , and would be so ruled to the end of time . [She]211-hadria had tried to find a wider , more generous , and less conventional standard in [her]211-hadria oracle , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria , but to [her]211-hadria bitter disappointment , [that lady]531-that lady had shrugged [her]531-that lady shoulders a little callously , as soon as [she]531-that lady was asked to extend [her]531-that lady sympathy outside [the circle of chartered candidates for [her]531-that lady merciful consideration]4318-the circle of chartered candidates for her merciful consideration . [Hadria]211-hadria 's hero - worship had suffered a severe rebuff . [The creature]4325-the creature had been ill - treated by [some boys]4326-some boys , who found Sunday afternoon hang heavy on [their]4326-some boys hands . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father laughed at [her]211-hadria . ‚Äú[0-i] Just as if [any decent fellow]1151-any decent fellow would not have done as much for [a wounded brute]1152-a wounded brute ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[1151-any decent fellow] There must have been a strange dearth of decent fellows in [church]1153-church that morning then . ‚Äù It was not merely the action , but the feeling revealed by [the Professor]4071-the professor 's words on that occasion , that had turned [Hadria]211-hadria 's sentiment towards [him]4071-the professor , into one of worship . [Algitha]81-algitha warned [her]211-hadria that even [the Professor]4071-the professor was human . [Hadria]211-hadria said [she]211-hadria did not believe it , or rather [she]211-hadria believed that [he]4071-the professor was inordinately , tenderly , superlatively human , and that [he]4071-the professor had gone many steps farther in that direction than [the rest of [[his]4071-the professor generation]4337-his generation]4336-the rest of his generation . [He]4071-the professor was dowered with instincts and perceptions belonging to [some kinder , nobler race than [ours]4339-ours]4338-some kinder , nobler race than ours . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria looked grave . [She]109-valeria took occasion to mention that [the Professor]4071-the professor had never ceased to grieve for [[his]4071-the professor wife]573-his wife , to whom [he]4071-the professor had been passionately attached , and that [he]4071-the professor , almost alone among [men]3698-men , would never love [any other woman]4343-any other woman . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i admire [him]1154-him only the more for that , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[0-i] Do n't let [yourself]0-i care too much for [him]1154-him . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Too much ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Do n't fall in love with [him]1154-him , if [I]0-i must be frank . ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria was silent . ‚Äú[0-i] If [one]329-one were to fall in love at all , [I]0-i do n't see how it would be possible to avoid [his]1154-him being [the man]3754-the man , ‚Äù [she]0-i pronounced at last . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i defy any creature with the least vestige of a heart to remain indifferent to [him]1154-him . ‚Äù ( [Valeria]109-valeria coloured . ) ‚Äú[0-i] Why there is n't [a man]3704-a man , [woman]3844-woman , [child]780-child , or animal about the place who does n't adore [him]1154-him and what can [I]0-i do ? ‚Äù THE autumn was now on the wane ; the robins sang clear , wild little songs in the shrubberies , the sunshine fell slanting across the grass . And at night , the stars twinkled with a frosty brilliancy , and the flowers were cut down by cruel invisible hands . The long dark evenings and the shrieking winds of winter were before them . With the shortening of the days , and the sweeping away of great shoals of leaves , in the frequent gales , [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria 's mood grew more and more sombre . At last [she]0-i announced that [she]0-i could stand the gloom of [this wild North]4344-this wild north no longer . [She]0-i had made arrangements to return to [London]8-london , on the morrow . As suddenly as [she]0-i had appeared on the scene , [she]0-i vanished , leaving but one day to grieve at the prospect of parting . It was through an accidental turn in the conversation , on this last day , that the difference between [her]0-i creed and [the Professor]4071-the professor 's was brought to light , accounting to [Hadria]211-hadria for many things , and increasing , if possible , [her]0-i admiration for [the unconscious Professor]4346-the unconscious professor . As for [her]0-i own private and personal justification for hope , [Valeria]109-valeria asserted that [she]0-i had none . Not even the thought of [her]0-i work ‚Äî usually a talisman against depression ‚Äî had any power to comfort . Who cared for [her]0-i work , unless [she]0-i perjured [herself]0-i , and told the lies that [the public]4347-the public loved to hear ? ‚Äú[0-i] What should [we]1160-we all do , ‚Äù asked [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[0-i] if there were not [a few people like [you]1162-you]1161-a few people like you and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , in [the world]334-the world , to keep [us]1160-we true to [[our]1160-we best selves]1164-our best selves , and to point to something infinitely better than that best ? ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria brightened for a moment . ‚Äú[1162-you] What does it matter if [you]1162-you do not provide mental food for [the crowd]631-the crowd , seeking nourishment for [their]631-the crowd vulgarity ? Let [them]631-the crowd go starve . ‚Äù ‚Äú[631-the crowd] But [they]631-the crowd do n't ; [they]631-the crowd go and gorge elsewhere . Besides , the question of starvation faces [me]0-i rather than [them]631-the crowd . ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria was still disposed to find fault with the general scheme of things , which [she]109-valeria regarded as responsible for [her]109-valeria own woes , great and little . Survival of the fittest ! What was that but another name for the torture and massacre of [the unfit]4348-the unfit ? [Nature]120-nature 's favourite instruments were war , slaughter , famine , misery ( mental and physical ) , sacrifice and brutality in every form , with a special malignity in [her]109-valeria treatment of the most highly developed and [the noblest of the race]4349-the noblest of the race . [The Professor in vain]4350-the professor in vain pointed out that [Valeria]109-valeria 's own revolt against the brutality of Nature , was proof of some higher law in Nature , now in course of development . ‚Äú[631-the crowd] The horror that is inspired in [human beings by that brutality]1166-human beings by that brutality is just as much a part of Nature as the brutality itself , ‚Äù [he]4350-the professor in vain said , and [he]4350-the professor in vain insisted that the supreme business of [man]332-man , was to evolve a scheme of life on a higher plane , wherein [the weak]4352-the weak shall not be forced to agonize for the strong , so far as [mankind]1102-mankind can intervene to prevent it . Let [man]332-man follow the dictates of pity and generosity in [his]332-man own soul . [They]4355-they would never lead [him]332-man astray . While [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria laid the whole blame upon natural law , [the Professor]4071-the professor impeached [humanity]4357-humanity . [Men]3698-men , [he]4350-the professor in vain declared , cry out against the order of things , which [they]3698-men , in a large measure , have [themselves]3698-men created . ‚Äú[631-the crowd] But , good heavens ! the whole plan of life is one of rapine . [We]1167-we did not fashion the spider to prey upon the fly , or the cat to play with the wounded mouse . [We]1167-we did not ordain that [the strong]3695-the strong should fall upon [the weak]4352-the weak , and tear and torture [them]4352-the weak for [their]4352-the weak own benefit . Surely [we]1167-we are not responsible for the brutalities of the animal creation . ‚Äù ‚Äú[4352-the weak] No , but [we]1167-we are responsible when [we]1167-we imitate [them]4352-the weak , ‚Äù said [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria somewhat inconsequently attempted to defend such imitation , on the ground that sacrifice is a law of life , a law of which [she]109-valeria had just been bitterly complaining . But at this , [the Professor]4071-the professor would only laugh . [[His]4071-the professor opponent]4361-his opponent indignantly cited scientific authority of the most solemn and weighty kind ; [the Professor]4071-the professor shook [his]4071-the professor head . Familiarity with [weighty scientific authorities]4363-weighty scientific authorities had bred contempt . ‚Äú[1167-we] Vicarious sacrifice ! ‚Äù [he]4071-the professor exclaimed , with a sudden outbreak of the scorn and impatience that [Hadria]211-hadria had seen in [him]4071-the professor on one other occasion , ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i never heard a doctrine more insane , more immoral , or more suicidal ! ‚Äù [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria hugged [herself]109-valeria in the thought of [her]109-valeria long list of [scouted authorities]4364-scouted authorities . [They]4364-scouted authorities had assured [her]109-valeria that [our]1171-we care of [the weak]4352-the weak , by interfering with the survival of the fittest , is injuring [the race]4366-the race . ‚Äú[1167-we] Go down into [the slums of [[our]1171-we great cities]1172-our great cities]1170-the slums of our great cities , or to [the pestilential East]1173-the pestilential east , and there observe the survival of [the fittest]1174-the fittest , undisturbed by human knowledge or human pity , ‚Äù recommended [the Professor]4071-the professor . [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria failed to see how this proved anything more than bad general conditions . ‚Äú[1174-the fittest] It proves that however bad general conditions may be , [some wretches]1175-some wretches will always survive ; [the ‚Äò fittest , ‚Äô of course , to endure filth and misery]1176-the ‚Äò fittest , ‚Äô of course , to endure filth and misery .
