[He]248-jouffroy went so far as to say that , even without the claims of genius , [a woman]3753-a woman ought to be permitted to please [herself]3753-a woman in the matter . When [he]248-jouffroy heard that [Madame]232-madame vauchelet had [two children]6173-two children , and yet had not abandoned [her]232-madame vauchelet ambition , [he]248-jouffroy nodded gravely and significantly . ‚Äú[0-i] But [Madame]232-madame vauchelet has courage , ‚Äù [he]248-jouffroy commented . ‚Äú[232-madame vauchelet] [She]232-madame vauchelet must have braved much censure . ‚Äù It was the first case of the kind that had come under [his]248-jouffroy notice . [He]248-jouffroy hoped much from it . [His]248-jouffroy opinion of the sex would depend on [Hadria]211-hadria 's power of persistence . In consequence of [numberless pupils who had shewn great promise]6174-numberless pupils who had shewn great promise , and then had satisfied [themselves]6174-numberless pupils who had shewn great promise with ‚Äú[2632-a stupid maternity] [a stupid maternity]2632-a stupid maternity , ‚Äù [Jouffrey]254-jouffrey was inclined to regard [women]606-women with contempt , not as regards [their]606-women talent , which [he]248-jouffroy declared was often astonishing , but as regards [their]606-women persistency of character and purpose . [One]329-one could not rely on [them]606-women . [They]606-women had enthusiasm ‚Äî Oh , but enthusiasm √† faire peur , but presently ‚Äú[2632-a stupid maternity] [un monsieur avec des moustaches seduisantes]2633-un monsieur avec des moustaches seduisantes ‚Äù approaches , and then ‚Äú[2632-a stupid maternity] Phui , c'est tout fini ! ‚Äù There was something of fatality in the affair . The instinct was terrible ; a demoniacal possession . It was for [women]606-women a veritable curse , a disease . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy had pronounced views on the subject . [He]248-jouffroy regarded the maternal instinct as the scourge of genius . It was , for [women]606-women , [the devil]1352-the devil 's truncheon , [his]1352-the devil rod of empire . This ‚Äú[2632-a stupid maternity] reproductive rage ‚Äù held [them]606-women ‚Äî in spite of all [their]606-women fine intuitions and astonishing ability ‚Äî after all on the animal plane ; cut [them]606-women off from the little band of [those who could break up new ground in human knowledge , and explore new heights of Art and Nature]6180-those who could break up new ground in human knowledge , and explore new heights of art and nature . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i speak to [you]2634-you thus , [Madame]232-madame vauchelet , not because [I]0-i think little of [your]2634-you sex , but because [I]0-i grudge [them]2635-them to the monster who will not spare [us]2636-us even one ! ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria worked with sufficient energy to please even [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . [Her]211-hadria heart was in it , and [her]211-hadria progress rapid . Everything was organized , in [her]211-hadria life , for the one object . At [the School of Music]6073-the school of music , [she]211-hadria was in an atmosphere of work , [everyone]3726-everyone being bent on the same goal , each detail arranged to further [the students]6183-the students in [their]6183-the students efforts . It was like walking on [a pavement]6184-a pavement after struggling uphill on loose sand ; like breathing sea - breezes after inhaling a polluted atmosphere . In old days , [Hadria]211-hadria used to be haunted by a singular recurrent nightmare : that [she]211-hadria was toiling up [a steep mountain made of hard slippery rock]6185-a steep mountain made of hard slippery rock , the summit always receding as [she]211-hadria advanced . Behind [her]211-hadria was a vast precipice down which [she]211-hadria must fall if [she]211-hadria lost [her]211-hadria footing ; and always , [she]211-hadria saw hands without bodies attached to [them]6186-them placing stones in the path , so that they rolled down and had to be evaded at the peril of [her]211-hadria life . And each time , after one set of stones was evaded , and [she]211-hadria thought there would be a time of respite , another batch was set rolling , amid thin , scarcely audible laughter , which came on the storm - wind that blew precipice - wards across [the mountain]6187-the mountain ; and invariably [she]211-hadria awoke just as a final avalanche of cruel stones had sent [her]211-hadria reeling over the hideous verge . [One]329-one is disposed to make light of the sufferings gone through in a dream , though it would trouble most of [us]6189-us to explain why , since the agony of mind is often as extreme as possibly could be endured in actual life . From the day of [her]211-hadria arrival in [Paris]35-paris , [Hadria]211-hadria was never again tormented with this nightmare . Composition went on rapidly now . Soon there was a little pile of new work for [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's inspection . [He]248-jouffroy was delighted , criticizing severely , but always encouraging to fresh efforts . As for the publishing , that was a different matter . In spite of [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's recommendation , [publishers]6190-publishers could not venture on anything of a character so unpopular . The music had merit , but it was eccentric . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy was angry . [He]248-jouffroy declared that [he]248-jouffroy would play something of [Madame]232-madame vauchelet 's at the next Ch√¢telet concert . There would be opposition , but [he]248-jouffroy would carry [his]248-jouffroy point . And [he]248-jouffroy did . But [the audience]323-the audience received it very coldly . Although [Hadria]211-hadria had expected such a reception , [she]211-hadria felt a chill run through [her]211-hadria , and a sinking of the heart . It was like a cold word that rebuffs an offer of sympathy , or an appeal for it . It sent [her]211-hadria back into depths of loneliness , and reminded [her]211-hadria how cut off [she]211-hadria was from [the great majority of [[her]211-hadria fellows]4821-her fellows]6192-the great majority of her fellows , after all . And then [Guy de Maupassant]255-guy de maupassant 's dreadful ‚Äú[0-i] Solitude ‚Äù came to [her]211-hadria memory . There is no way ( [the hero of the sketch]6194-the hero of the sketch asserts ) by which [a man]3704-a man can break the eternal loneliness to which [he]3704-a man is foredoomed . [He]248-jouffroy can not convey to [others]432-others [his]248-jouffroy real impressions or emotion , try as [he]248-jouffroy may . By a series of assertions , hard to deny , [the hero]6197-the hero arrives at a terrible conclusion amounting to this : Art , affection , are in vain ; [we]6198-we know not what [we]6198-we say , nor whom [we]6198-we love . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy came out of [the theatre]6199-the theatre , snorting and ruffled . ‚Äú[2637-they] But [they]2637-they are imbeciles , all ! ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria thought that perhaps [she]211-hadria was [the ‚Äú[2637-they] imbecile ‚Äù]6200-the ‚Äú imbecile ‚Äù ; it was a possibility to be counted with , but [she]211-hadria dared not say so to [the irate Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . [He]248-jouffroy was particularly angry , because [the audience]323-the audience had confirmed [his]248-jouffroy own fear that only very slowly would the quality of the music be recognized by even [the more cultivated public]6202-the more cultivated public . [It]6203-it had invaded fresh territory , [he]248-jouffroy said , added to the range of expression , and was meanwhile a new language to [casual listeners]6204-casual listeners . It was rebel music , offensive to [the orthodox]5549-the orthodox . [Hubert]118-hubert had always said that ‚Äú[0-i] it was out of the question , ‚Äù and [he]118-hubert appeared to have been right . ‚Äú[0-i] Bah , ce ne sont que des moutons ! ‚Äù exclaimed [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy . If the work had been poorer , less original , there would not have been this trouble . Was there not some other method by which [Madame]232-madame vauchelet could earn what was necessary , en [attendant]6206-attendant ? In one of [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue 's letters , [he]248-jouffroy had reminded [Hadria]211-hadria of [his]248-jouffroy eagerness to help [her]211-hadria . Yet , what could [he]248-jouffroy do ? [He]248-jouffroy had influence in [the world of]6207-the world of science , but [Hadria]211-hadria could not produce anything scientific ! [She]211-hadria bethought [her]211-hadria of trying to write light descriptive articles , of a kind depending not so much on literary skill as on subject and epistolary freshness of touch . These [she]211-hadria sent to [the Professor]4071-the professor , not without reluctance , knowing how overburdened [he]4071-the professor already was with work and with applications for help and advice . [He]4071-the professor approved of [her]211-hadria idea , and advised the articles being sent the round of the magazines and papers . Through [his]4071-the professor influence , one of the shorter articles was accepted , and [Hadria]211-hadria felt encouraged . [Her]211-hadria day was now very full . The new art was laborious , severely simple in character , though [she]211-hadria studiously made [her]211-hadria articles . [[Her]211-hadria acquaintances]6085-her acquaintances had multiplied very rapidly of late , and although this brought into [her]211-hadria experience much that was pleasant and interesting , the demands of an enlarging circle swallowed an astonishing number of hours . An element of trouble had begun to come into the life that had been so full of serenity , as well as of regular and strenuous work . [Hadria]211-hadria was already feeling the effects of anxiety and hurry . [She]211-hadria had not come with untried powers to the fray . The reserve forces had long ago been sapped , in the early struggles , beginning in [her]211-hadria girlhood and continuing at increasing pressure ever since . There was only enough nerve - force to enable [one]329-one to live from hand to mouth . Expenditure of this force having been so often in excess of income , economy had become imperative . Yet , economy was difficult . [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy was always spurring [her]211-hadria to work , to throw over everything for this object ; letters from [England]14-england incessantly urged a very different course ; [[friends]886-friends in [Paris]35-paris]6212-friends in paris pressed [her]211-hadria to visit [them]6212-friends in paris , to accompany [them]6212-friends in paris hither and thither , to join musical parties , to compose little songs ( some bagatelle in celebration of a birthday or wedding ) , to drive to [the further end of [the town]5882-the town]6213-the further end of the town to play to [this person]6215-this person or that who had heard of [Madame]232-madame vauchelet 's great talent . [Hadria]211-hadria was glad to do anything [she]211-hadria could to express [her]211-hadria gratitude for the kindness [she]211-hadria had received on all hands , but , alas ! there were only a certain number of hours in the day , and only a certain number of years in [one]329-one 's life , and art was long . Moreover , nerves were awkward things to play with . Insidiously , treacherously , difficulties crept up . Even here , where [she]211-hadria seemed so free , the peculiar claims that are made , by common consent , on [a woman]3753-a woman 's time and strength began to weave their tiny cords around [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria took warning , and put an end to any voluntary increase of [her]211-hadria circle , but the step had been taken a little too late . The mischief was done . To give pain or offence for the sake of an hour or two , more or less , seemed cruel and selfish , yet [Hadria]211-hadria often longed for the privilege that [every man]1703-every man enjoys , of quietly pursuing [his]1703-every man work without giving either . A disastrous sense of hurry and fatigue began to oppress [her]211-hadria . This was becoming serious . [She]211-hadria must make a stand . Yet [her]211-hadria attempts at explanation were generally taken as polite excuses for neglecting [those who had been kind and cordial]6219-those who had been kind and cordial . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy taxed [her]211-hadria with looking tired . [One]329-one must not be tired . [One]329-one must arrange the time so as to secure ample rest and recreation after the real work was over . [Women]606-women were so foolish in that way . [They]606-women did everything feverishly . [They]606-women imagined [themselves]606-women to have inexhaustible nerves . [Hadria]211-hadria hinted that it was perhaps others who demanded of [them]606-women what was possible only to inexhaustible nerves . True ; towards [women]606-women , [people]3687-people behaved as [idiots]6225-idiots . How was it possible to produce [one]329-one 's best , if repose were lacking ? Serenity was necessary for all production . As well expect [water]6227-water perpetually agitated to freeze , as expect [the crystals of the mind]6228-the crystals of the mind to produce [themselves]6228-the crystals of the mind under the influence of incessant disturbance . Work ? Yes . Work never harmed [any man]6229-any man or [woman]3844-woman . It was harassment that killed . Work of the mind , of the artistic powers , that was a tonic to the whole being . But little distractions , irregular duties , worries , uncertainties ‚Äî [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy shook [his]248-jouffroy head ominously . And not only to [the artist]6231-the artist were [they]6232-they fatal . It was these that drew such deep lines on the faces of [women still young]6233-women still young . It was these that destroyed ability and hope , and killed [God]139-god only knew how many of [His]139-god good gifts ! Poverty : that could be endured with all its difficulties , if that were the one anxiety . It was never the one but the multitude of troubles that destroyed . Serenity there must be . [A man]3704-a man knew that , and insisted on having it . [Friends]886-friends were [no true friends]6236-no true friends if [they]886-friends robbed one of it . For [him]3704-a man , [he]3704-a man had a poor opinion of that which [people]3687-people called affection , regard . As for [l'amour]256-l'amour , that was the supreme egotism . The affections were simply a means to ‚Äú[0-i] make [oneself]2638-oneself paid . ‚Äù Affection ! Bah ! [One]329-one did not offer it for nothing , bien s√ªr ! It was through this insufferable pretext that [one]329-one arrived at governing others . ‚Äú[2638-oneself] Comment ? [Your]2639-you presence can give [me]0-i happiness , and [you]2639-you will not remain always beside [me]0-i ? It is nothing to [you]2639-you how [I]0-i suffer ? To [me]0-i whom [you]2639-you love [you]2639-you refuse this small demand ? ‚Äù [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy opened [his]248-jouffroy eyes , with a scornful glare . ‚Äú[2639-you] It is in that fashion , [I]0-i promise [you]2639-you , that [one]329-one can rule ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] Ah , [monsieur]2641-monsieur , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äú[0-i] [you]2641-monsieur are [a keen observer]1958-a keen observer . How [I]0-i wish [you]2641-monsieur could live [a woman]3753-a woman 's life for a short time . [You]2641-monsieur are wise now , but after that ‚Äî ‚Äù ‚Äú[232-madame vauchelet] [Madame]232-madame vauchelet , [I]0-i have sinned in [my]0-i day , perhaps to merit purgatorial fires ; but , without false modesty , [I]0-i do not think that [I]0-i have justly incurred the penalty [you]232-madame vauchelet propose to [me]0-i . ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria laughed . ‚Äú[232-madame vauchelet] It would be a strange piece of poetic justice , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria said , ‚Äú[232-madame vauchelet] if all [the men who have sinned beyond forgiveness in this incarnation]2644-the men who have sinned beyond forgiveness in this incarnation , should be doomed to appear in the next , as [well - brought - up women]2645-well - brought - up women . ‚Äù [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy smiled . ‚Äú[2649-mon dieu] Fancy [some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens]2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens , as [[one]329-one 's maiden aunt]2648-one 's maiden aunt . ‚Äù [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy grinned . ‚Äú[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ce serait dur ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ah , [mon Dieu]2649-mon dieu ! ‚Äù cried [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , ‚Äú[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] if [men]3698-men had to endure in the next world that which [they]3698-men have made [women]606-women suffer in this ‚Äî that would be an atrocious justice ! ‚Äù STUBBORNLY [Hadria]211-hadria sent [her]211-hadria packets to [the publishers]6240-the publishers ; [the publishers]6240-the publishers as firmly returned [them]6240-the publishers . [She]211-hadria had two sets flying now , like tennis balls , [she]211-hadria wrote to [Miss Du Prel]109-valeria : one set across [the Channel]6242-the channel . [The publishers]6240-the publishers , [she]211-hadria feared , played the best game , but [she]211-hadria had the English quality of not knowing when [she]211-hadria was beaten . [Valeria]109-valeria had succeeded in finding a place for two of the articles . This was encouraging , but funds were running alarmingly low . [The apartement]6244-the apartement would have either to be given up , or to be taken on for another term , at the end of the week . A decision must be made . [Hadria]211-hadria was dismayed to find [her]211-hadria strength beginning to fail . That made the thought of the future alarming . With health and vigour nothing seemed impossible , but without that ‚Äî It seemed absurd that there should be so much difficulty about earning a living . [Other women]4882-other women had done it . [Valeria]109-valeria had always made light of the matter ‚Äî when [she]109-valeria had the theory of the sovereignty of the will to support . Another couple of articles which seemed to [[their]6240-the publishers creator]6246-their creator to possess popular qualities were sent off . But after a weary delay , [they]6240-the publishers shared the fate of [[their]6240-the publishers predecessors]6247-their predecessors . [Hadria]211-hadria now moved into [a smaller suite of rooms]6248-a smaller suite of rooms , parting regretfully with [Ther√®se]246-ther√®se , and flinging [herself]211-hadria once more on the mercy of [a landlady]6249-a landlady . This time [M. Thillard]247-m. thillard had discovered [the lodging]6250-the lodging for [her]211-hadria ; [a shabby , but sunny little house]6251-a shabby , but sunny little house , kept by [a motherly woman with a reputation for perfect honesty]6252-a motherly woman with a reputation for perfect honesty . Expenses were thus kept down , but unhappily very little was coming in to meet [them]6240-the publishers . It was impossible to pull through the year at this rate . But , of course , there was daily hope of something turning up . The arrival of the post was always an exciting moment . At last [Hadria]211-hadria wrote to ask [Algitha]81-algitha to try and sell for [her]211-hadria a spray of diamonds , worth about eighty pounds . Time must be gained , at all hazards . [Algitha]81-algitha tried everywhere , and enquired in all directions , but could not get more than five - and - twenty pounds for it . [She]211-hadria felt anxious about [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister , and thought of coming over to [Paris]35-paris to see [her]313-her sister , in order to talk over some matters that could no longer be kept out of sight . [Algitha]81-algitha had wished to give [Hadria]211-hadria an opportunity for work and rest , and to avoid recurrence of worry ; but it was no longer possible or fair to conceal the fact that there were troubles looming ahead , at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . [[Their]6254-their father]3946-their father had suffered several severe losses through some bank failures ; and now [that wretched company in which [he]3946-their father had always had such faith]6256-that wretched company in which he had always had such faith appeared to be shaky , and if that were also to smash , the state of affairs would be desperate . [[Their]6254-their father]3946-their father , in [his]3946-their father optimistic fashion , still believed that [the company]4609-the company would pull through . Of course all this anxiety was telling seriously on [[their]6254-their mother]363-their mother . And , alas [she]363-their mother had been fretting very much about [Hadria]211-hadria . After [Algitha]81-algitha 's misdeed , this second blow struck hard . [One]329-one must act on [one]329-one 's own convictions and not on those of [somebody else]6262-somebody else , however beloved [that other person]6263-that other person might be , but truly the penalty of daring to take an independent line of action was almost unbearably severe . It really seemed , at times , as if there were nothing for it but to fold [one]329-one 's hands and do exactly as [one]329-one was bid . [Algitha]81-algitha was beginning to wonder whether [her]81-algitha own revolt was about to be expiated by a life - long remorse ! ‚Äú[2646-some conquering hero reappearing in ringlets and mittens] Ah , if [mother]3851-mother had only not sacrificed [herself]3851-mother for [us]2653-us , how infinitely grateful [I]0-i should feel to [her]3851-mother now ! What sympathy there might have been between [us]2653-us all ! If [she]3851-mother had but given [herself]3851-mother a chance , how [she]3851-mother might have helped [us]2653-us , and what [a friend]727-a friend [she]3851-mother might have been to [us]2653-us , and [we]2653-us to [her]3851-mother ! But [she]3851-mother would not . ‚Äù [Algitha]81-algitha said that [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother evidently felt [Hadria]211-hadria 's departure as a disgrace to [the family]360-the family . It was pathetic to hear [her]520-her mother trying to answer [people]3687-people 's casual questions about [her]520-her mother , so as to conceal the facts without telling an untruth . [Hadria]211-hadria was overwhelmed by this letter . [Her]211-hadria first impulse was to pack up and go straight to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee . But as [Algitha]81-algitha was [there]571-there now , this seemed useless , at any rate for the present . And ought [she]81-algitha after all to abandon [her]81-algitha project , for which so much had been risked , so much pain inflicted ? The question that [she]81-algitha and [Algitha]81-algitha thought [they]2653-us had decided long ago , began to beat again at the door of [her]81-algitha conscience and [her]81-algitha pity . [Her]81-algitha reason still asserted that the suffering which [people]3687-people entail upon [themselves]3687-people , through a frustrated desire to force [their]3687-people own law of conduct on [others]432-others , must be borne by [themselves]3687-people , as the penalty of [their]3687-people own tyrannous instinct and of [their]3687-people own narrow thought . It was utterly unfair to thrust that natural penalty of prejudice and of self - neglect on to the shoulders of [others]432-others . Why should [they]3687-people be protected from the appointed punishment , by the offering of another life on the altar of [their]3687-people prejudice ? Why should such a sacrifice be made in order to gratify [their]3687-people tyrannical desire to dictate ? It was not fair , it was not reasonable . Yet this conclusion of the intellect did not prevent the pain of pity and compunction , nor an inconsequent sense of guilt . Meanwhile it would be best , perhaps , to await [Algitha]81-algitha 's arrival , when affairs might be in a less uncertain state . All decision must be postponed till then . ‚Äú[3851-mother] Try and come soon , ‚Äù [she]81-algitha wrote to [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister . To add to the anxieties of the moment , [little Martha]129-martha seemed to lose in energy since coming to [the new abode]6274-the new abode , and [Hadria]211-hadria began to fear that [the house]296-the house was not quite healthy . [It]296-the house was very cheap , and [the landlady]6087-the landlady was honest , but if it had this serious drawback , another move , with probably another drawback , seemed to threaten . This was particularly troublesome , for who could tell how long it would be possible to remain in [Paris]35-paris ? [Hadria]211-hadria thought of the doctrine of the sovereignty of the will , and of all the grand and noble things that [the Preposterous Society]3682-the preposterous society had said about it , not to mention [Emerson]87-emerson and [others]432-others ‚Äî and [she]211-hadria smiled . However , [she]211-hadria worked on , putting aside [her]211-hadria anxieties , as far as was possible . [She]211-hadria would not fail for lack of will , at any rate . But it was a hard struggle . [Martha]129-martha had to be very carefully watched just now . Happily , after a few anxious days , [she]129-martha began to recover [her]129-martha fresh colour and [her]129-martha high spirits . The move would not be necessary , after all . [Hadria]211-hadria had become more and more attached to [the child]4983-the child , whose lovable qualities developed with [her]4983-the child growth . [She]4983-the child was becoming singularly like [[her]4983-the child unhappy mother]6280-her unhappy mother , in feature and in colouring . [Her]4983-the child eyes were large and blue and sweet , with a little touch of pathos in them that [Hadria]211-hadria could not bear to see . It seemed almost like the after - glow of [the mother]578-the mother 's suffering . Although adding to [Hadria]211-hadria 's anxieties , [the child]4983-the child gave a sense of freshness and youth to [the little m√©nage]6283-the little m√©nage . [She]211-hadria made the anxieties easier to bear . [Hadria]211-hadria came in , one morning , from [her]211-hadria work , tired and full of foreboding . Hat and cloak were laid aside , and [she]211-hadria sank into an arm - chair , lying back to lazily watch the efforts of [the child]4983-the child to overturn [the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because [he]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was less amenable than [the rest]5069-the rest]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest . [Martha]129-martha looked up for sympathy . [She]129-martha wished to be helped in [her]129-martha persistent efforts to get the better of [this upstart blue man with the red cap , who serenely resumed [his]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest erect position just as often as [he]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was forced to the ground]6287-this upstart blue man with the red cap , who serenely resumed his erect position just as often as he was forced to the ground . [He]6285-the obstinate blue man , who was still the favourite plaything , perhaps because he was less amenable than the rest was [a stout , healthy - looking person]6288-a stout , healthy - looking person , inclining to embonpoint ; bound to succeed , if only from sheer solidity of [person]2199-person . [Hadria]211-hadria was drawn into the game , and [the two]4880-the two spent a good half hour on the rug together , playing with that and other toys which [Martha]129-martha toddled off to the cupboard to collect . [The child]4983-the child was in great delight . [Hadria]211-hadria was playing with [her]4983-the child ; [she]211-hadria liked that better than having [Jean Paul Auguste]245-jean paul auguste to play with . [He]245-jean paul auguste took [her]211-hadria toys away and always wanted to play a different game . The clock struck two . [Hadria]211-hadria felt that [she]211-hadria ought to go and see [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet ; it was more than a week since [she]211-hadria had called , and [the kind old friend]6292-the kind old friend was always gently pained at an absence of that length . Then there was an article to finish , and [she]211-hadria ought really to write to [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee and [Henriette]142-henriette and ‚Äî well [the rest]5069-the rest must wait . Several other calls were also more than due , but it was useless even to consider those to - day . In spite of an oppressive sense of having much to do ‚Äî perhaps because of it ‚Äî [Hadria]211-hadria felt as if it were a sheer impossibility to rise from that hearthrug . Besides , [Martha]129-martha would not hear of it . A desire to rest , to idle , to float down [the stream]1809-the stream , instead of trying always to swim against it , became overpowering . The minutes passed away . ‚Äú[3851-mother] The question is , [Martha]129-martha , ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria said gravely , as [she]211-hadria proceeded to pile up [a towering edifice of bricks]6295-a towering edifice of bricks , at [the child]4983-the child 's command , ‚Äú[129-martha] the question is : Are [we]2655-we going to stick to [our]2655-we plan , or are [we]2655-we going to be beaten ? Oh , take care , do n't pull down [the fairy palace]2656-the fairy palace ! That is a bad trick that [little fingers]2657-little fingers have . No , no , [I]0-i must have [[my]0-i fairy palace]2658-my fairy palace ; [I]0-i wo n't have [it]2658-my fairy palace pulled down . It is getting so fine , too ; minarets and [towers]2659-towers , and domes and pinnacles , all mixed beautifully . Such an architecture as [you]2660-you never saw ! But some day perhaps [you]2660-you will see it . Those blue eyes look as if they were made for seeing it , in the time to come . ‚Äù ‚Äú[2662-a pretty house] Pretty eyes ! ‚Äù said [Martha]129-martha with frank vanity , and then : ‚Äú[2662-a pretty house] [Pretty house]2661-pretty house ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[2662-a pretty house] It is indeed [a pretty house]2662-a pretty house ; [they]2662-a pretty house all are . But [they]2662-a pretty house are so horribly shaky . The minarets are top - heavy , [I]0-i fear . That 's the fault of [the makers of these bricks]2663-the makers of these bricks . [They]2663-the makers of these bricks ought to make the solid ones in proper proportion . But [they]2663-the makers of these bricks ca n't be persuaded . ‚Äù ‚Äú[2663-the makers of these bricks] Knock it down , ‚Äù said [Martha]129-martha , thrusting forth a mischievous hand , which was caught in time to prevent entire destruction of the precious edifice . Half the minarets had fallen . ‚Äú[2664-they] [They]2664-they must go up again , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[2664-they] How cruel to spoil all the work and all the beauty . ‚Äù But [Martha]129-martha laughed with the delight of easy conquest . [She]129-martha watched with great interest the reconstruction , and seemed anxious that every detail should be finished and worthy [her]129-martha iconoclasm . Having satisfied [herself]129-martha that [her]129-martha strength would not be wasted on an incomplete object , [she]129-martha made a second attempt to lay [the palace]6297-the palace low . Again [she]129-martha was frustrated . [The building]4303-the building had soared , by this time , to an ambitious height , and [its]4303-the building splendour had reached the limits of the materials at command . The final pinnacle which was required to cope [the structure]1845-the structure had been mislaid . [Hadria]211-hadria was searching for it , when [Martha]129-martha , seizing [her]129-martha chance , struck [the palace]6297-the palace a blow in its very heart , and in an instant , the whole was a wreck . ‚Äú[2664-they] Oh , if that is to be the way of it , why should [I]0-i build ? asked [Hadria]211-hadria . [Martha]129-martha gave the command for another ornamental object which [she]129-martha might destroy . ‚Äú [One]329-one would suppose [you]129-martha were [a County - Council]6302-a county - council , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed , ‚Äú or [the practical man]6303-the practical man . No , [you]129-martha shall have no more beauty to annihilate , [little Vandal]257-little vandal . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Martha]129-martha , however , was now engaged in dissecting a doll , and presently a stream of sawdust from its chest announced that [she]129-martha had accomplished [her]129-martha dearest desire . [She]129-martha had found out what was inside that human effigy . ‚Äú [I]129-martha wish [I]129-martha could get at the sawdust that [I]129-martha am stuffed with , ‚Äù[129-martha] [Hadria]211-hadria thought dreamily , as [she]211-hadria watched the doll grow flabbier . ‚Äú It is wonderful how [little one]2165-little one does know [one]329-one 's own sawdust . It would be convenient to feel a little surer just now , for evidently [I]211-hadria shall need it all very soon . And [I]211-hadria feel somewhat like that doll , with the stream pouring out and the body getting limp . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [She]211-hadria rose at last , and went to the window . The radiance of sun and green trees and the stir of human life ; the rumble of omnibuses and the sound of wheels ; the suggestion to the imagination of [the river]437-the river just a little way off , and [the merry little bateaux - mouches]2666-the merry little bateaux - mouches ‚Äî it was too much . [Hadria]211-hadria rang for [Hannah]212-hannah ; asked [her]212-hannah to take [the child]4983-the child for a walk in [the Bois]60-the bois , stooped down to kiss the little upturned face , and went off . In another ten minutes [she]211-hadria was on board one of [the steam - boats]2668-the steam - boats , on [her]211-hadria way up [the river]437-the river . [She]211-hadria had no idea whither [she]211-hadria was going ; [she]211-hadria would leave that to chance . [She]211-hadria only desired to feel the air and the sun and have an opportunity to think . [She]211-hadria soothed [her]211-hadria uneasiness at the thought of [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet 's disappointment by promising [herself]211-hadria to call to - morrow . [She]211-hadria sat watching [the boats]2670-the boats and the water and [the gay banks of [the river]437-the river]2671-the gay banks of the river with a sense of relief , and a curious sort of fatalism , partly suggested perhaps , by the persistent movement of [the boat]5930-the boat , and the interminable succession of new scenes , all bubbling with human life , full of the traces of past events . One layer of consciousness was busily engaged in thinking out the practical considerations of the moment , another was equally busy with the objective and picturesque world of [the river side]2674-the river side . If the two or more threads of thought were not actually followed at the same instant , the alternation was so rapid as not to be perceived . What was to be done ? How was the situation to be met , if the worst came to the worst ? Ah ! what far harder contests had gone on in [these dwellings]2675-these dwellings that one passed by the hundred . What lives of sordid toil had been struggled through , in the effort to earn the privilege of continuing to toil ! [Hadria]211-hadria was inspired by keen curiosity concerning [these homes]2676-these homes and [gardens]2029-gardens , and the whole panorama that opened before [her]211-hadria , as [the little steamer]2678-the little steamer puffed up [the river]437-the river . [She]211-hadria longed to penetrate below the surface and decipher the strange palimpsest of human life . What scenes , what tragedies , what comedies , [those bright houses]2680-those bright houses and [demure little villas]2681-demure little villas concealed . It was not exactly consoling to remember how small [her]211-hadria own immediate difficulties were in comparison to those of others , but it seemed to help [her]211-hadria to face [them]2682-them . [She]211-hadria would not be discouraged . [She]211-hadria had [her]211-hadria liberty , and that had to be paid for . Surely patience would prevail in the end . [She]211-hadria had learnt so much since [she]211-hadria left [home]3770-home ; among other things , the habit of facing practical difficulties without that dismay which carefully - nurtured women inevitably feel on [their]2684-their first movement out of shelter . Yes , [she]211-hadria had learnt much , surprisingly much , in the short time . [Her]211-hadria new knowledge contained perhaps rather dangerous elements , for [she]211-hadria had begun to realize [her]211-hadria own power , not only as [an artist]4849-an artist , but as [a woman]3753-a woman . In this direction , had [she]211-hadria so chosen .... [Her]211-hadria thoughts were arrested at this point , with a wrench . [She]211-hadria felt the temptation assail [her]211-hadria , as of late it had been assailing [her]211-hadria faintly , to explore [this territory]2687-this territory . But no , that was preposterous . It was certainly not that [she]211-hadria regarded [herself]211-hadria as accountable , in this matter , to [any one]2075-any one but [herself]211-hadria ; it was not that [she]211-hadria acknowledged the suzerainty of [[her]211-hadria husband]553-her husband . A mere legal claim meant nothing to [her]211-hadria , and [he]553-her husband knew it . But there were moral perils of no light kind to be guarded against ; the danger such as [a gambler]2690-a gambler runs , of being drawn away from the real objects of life , of losing hold of [one]329-one 's main purpose , to say nothing of the probable moral degeneration that would result from such experiment . Yet there was no blinking the fact that the desire had been growing in [Hadria]211-hadria to test [her]211-hadria powers of attraction to the utmost , so as to discover exactly their range and calibre . [She]211-hadria felt rather as [a boy]2692-a boy might feel who had come upon a cask of gunpowder , and longed to set a match to it , just to see exactly how high it would blow off the roof . [She]211-hadria had kept the growing instincts at bay , being determined that nothing avoidable should come between [her]211-hadria and [her]211-hadria purpose . And then ‚Äî well considering in what light [most men]1974-most men , in [their]1974-most men hearts , regarded [women]606-women ‚Äî if one might judge from [their]1974-most men laws and [their]1974-most men conduct and [their]1974-most men literature , and the society that [they]1974-most men had organized ‚Äî admiration from this sex was a thing scarcely to be endured . Yet superficially , it was gratifying . Why it should be so , was difficult to say , since it scarcely imposed upon [one]329-one 's very vanity . Yet it was easy enough to understand how [women who had no very dominant interest in life]2696-women who had no very dominant interest in life , might come to have a thirst for masculine homage and for power over [men]3698-men till it became like [the gambler]2698-the gambler 's passion for play ; and surely it had something in it of the same character . [The steamer]2699-the steamer was stopping now at [St. Cloud]64-st. cloud . Yielding to an impulse , [Hadria]211-hadria alighted at [the landing - stage]2700-the landing - stage and walked on through [the little town]2701-the little town towards [the palace]6297-the palace . The sun was deliciously hot ; its rays struck through to the skin , and seemed to pour in life and well - being . [The wayfarer]957-the wayfarer stood looking up [the steep green avenue]2704-the steep green avenue , resting for a moment , before [she]957-the wayfarer began the ascent . At [the top of [the hill]3975-the hill]2705-the top of the hill [she]211-hadria paused again to look out over [Paris]35-paris , which lay spread far and wide beneath [her]211-hadria , glittering and brilliant ; [the Eiffel Tower]53-the eiffel tower rising above domes and spires , in solitary inconsequence . It seemed to [her]211-hadria as if [she]211-hadria were looking upon [the world]334-the world and upon life , for the last time . A few weeks hence , would [she]211-hadria be able to stand there and see [the gay city]2708-the gay city at [her]211-hadria feet ? [She]211-hadria plunged back along one of [the converging avenues]2709-the converging avenues , yielding to the fascination of green alleys leading one knows not whither . Wandering on for some time , [she]211-hadria finally drifted [down hill]2710-down hill again , towards [the stately little garden near [the palace]6297-the palace]2711-the stately little garden near the palace . [She]211-hadria was surprised by a hurrying step behind [her]211-hadria , and [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy 's voice in [her]211-hadria ear . [She]211-hadria was about to greet [him]248-jouffroy in [her]211-hadria usual fashion , when [he]248-jouffroy stopped [her]211-hadria by plunging head foremost into a startling tirade ‚Äî about [her]211-hadria art , and [her]211-hadria country , and [her]211-hadria genius , and [his]248-jouffroy despair ; and finally [his]248-jouffroy resolve that [she]211-hadria should not belong to the accursed list of women who gave up [their]2713-their art for ‚Äú la famille . ‚Äù[248-jouffroy] The more [Hadria]211-hadria tried to discover what had happened and what [he]248-jouffroy meant , the faster [he]248-jouffroy spoke and the more wildly [he]248-jouffroy gesticulated . [He]248-jouffroy had seen how [she]211-hadria was drifting away from [her]211-hadria work and becoming entangled in little affairs of no importance , and [he]248-jouffroy would not permit it . [He]248-jouffroy cared not what [her]211-hadria circumstances might be ; [she]211-hadria had a great talent that [she]211-hadria had no right to sacrifice to any circumstances whatever . [He]248-jouffroy had come to save [her]211-hadria . [[Your]142-henriette mentor]2763-your mentor must indeed be slumbering . [You]142-henriette are simply scathing ‚Äî on [my]0-i behalf ! [You]142-henriette utter paradoxes . [I]0-i want to understand [your]142-henriette point of view . ‚Äù It is simple enough . [I]0-i deny that motherhood has duties except when it is absolutely free , absolutely uninfluenced by the pressure of opinion , or by any of the innumerable tyrannies that [most children]6354-most children have now to thank for [their]6354-most children existence . ‚Äù[0-i] [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley shook [her]141-miss temperley head . ‚Äú [I]141-miss temperley do n't see that any ‚Äò tyranny , ‚Äô as [you]142-henriette call it , exonerates [a mother]4953-a mother from [her]4953-a mother duty to [[her]4953-a mother child]1838-her child . ‚Äù[141-miss temperley] ‚Äú There [we]6357-our differ . It forges chains of [her]3753-a woman own flesh and blood ; it weaves cords of [her]3753-a woman own love and instinct . [She]3753-a woman agonizes , and the fruit of [her]3753-a woman agony is not even legally [hers]3753-a woman . Name [me]0-i a position more abject ! [You]211-hadria must have reckoned on an appeal to [my]211-hadria generosity , and on the utter helplessness of [my]211-hadria position when once [I]211-hadria was safely entrapped . It was extremely clever and well thought out . [I]0-i ‚Äî ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] When have [I]0-i disputed that ? ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria advanced towards [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley , and stood looking [her]141-miss temperley full in the face . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i believe that [Hubert]118-hubert has acted conscientiously , according to [his]118-hubert standard . The doll fell with a great crash , into the fender among the fire - irons , and there was a little burst of laughter . [Miss Temperley]141-miss temperley passed through the door , at the same instant , with great dignity . AS [Hadria]211-hadria had foretold , [she]141-miss temperley commenced the attack on [herself]141-miss temperley as soon as [Henriette]142-henriette had departed , and all night long , the stormy inner debate was kept up . [Her]211-hadria mind never wavered , but [her]211-hadria heart was rebellious . [Hubert]118-hubert deserved to pay for [his]118-hubert conduct ; but if [we]6432-we all had to pay for [our]6432-we conduct to the uttermost farthing , that would be hard , if just . If [Hadria]211-hadria assumed the burden of [Hubert]118-hubert 's debt , it would mean what [M. Jouffroy]248-jouffroy had pointed out . [Hubert]118-hubert 's suffering would be only on account of offended public opinion ; [hers]211-hadria ‚Äî but then [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents would suffer as well as [Hubert]118-hubert . Round and round went the thoughts , like vast wheels , and when towards morning , [she]211-hadria dozed off a little , the wheels were still turning in a vague , weary way , and as they turned , the life seemed to be crushed gradually out of the sleeper . [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy came to enquire whether the decision had been made . [He]248-jouffroy was in a state of great excitement . [He]248-jouffroy gave fervent thanks that [Hadria]211-hadria had stood firm . ‚Äú[0-i] [You]2831-you do not forget [my]0-i words , [Madame]195-madame bertaux ? ‚Äù ‚Äú[195-madame bertaux] [I]0-i shall never forget them , [Monsieur]2832-monsieur . ‚Äù [Henriette]142-henriette discreetly forbore to say anything further on the subject of dispute . [She]142-henriette waited , hopefully . ‚Äú[2832-monsieur] [Hubert]118-hubert has been troubled about the money that [[your]0-i father]705-your father set apart , on [your]0-i marriage , as a contribution to the household expenses , ‚Äù [she]142-henriette said , one morning . ‚Äú[0-i] [[Your]0-i father]705-your father did not place it all in [your]0-i name . ‚Äù ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i know , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú[0-i] It is tied up , in some way , for the use of [the family]360-the family . The letter announced the failure of [the Company]4609-the company . It was the final blow . [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee would have to be given up . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton 's settlement was all that [she]97-mrs. fullerton and [[her]97-mrs. fullerton husband]553-her husband would now have to live upon . [Hadria]211-hadria sat gazing at the letter , with a dazed expression . Almost before the full significance of the calamity had been realized , a telegram arrived , announcing that [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had fallen dangerously ill . The rest of that day was spent in packing , writing notes , settling accounts , and preparing for departure . ‚Äú[0-i] When ‚Äî how are [you]0-i going ? ‚Äù cried [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet , in dismay . ‚Äú[0-i] By [the night boat]2840-the night boat , by [the night boat]2840-the night boat , ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria replied hurriedly , as if the hurry of [her]211-hadria speech would quicken [her]211-hadria arrival in [England]14-england . [The great arches of [the station]3893-the station]6436-the great arches of the station which had appealed to [her]211-hadria imagination , at the moment of arrival , swept upward , hard and grey , in the callous blue light . [Hadria]211-hadria breathed deep . Was [she]211-hadria [the same person who had arrived that night , with every nerve thrilled with hope and resolve]6438-the same person who had arrived that night , with every nerve thrilled with hope and resolve ? Ah ! there had been so much to learn , and the time had been so short . Starting with [her]211-hadria present additional experience , [she]211-hadria could have managed so much better . But of what use to think of that ? How different the homeward journey from the intoxicating outward flight , in the heyday of the spring ! What did that telegram mean ? Ill ; dangerously , dangerously . The words seemed to be repeated cruelly , insistently , by the jogging of [the train]3892-the train and the rumble of the wheels . The anxiety gnawed on , rising at times into terror , dulling again to a steady ache . And then remorse began to fit a long - pointed fang into a sensitive spot in [her]211-hadria heart . In vain to resist . It was securely placed . Let reason hold [her]211-hadria peace . A thousand fears , regrets , self - accusations , revolts , swarmed insect - like in [Hadria]211-hadria 's brain , as [the train]3892-the train thundered through the darkness , every tumultuous sound and motion exaggerated to the consciousness , by the fact that there was no distraction of the attention by outside objects . Nothing offered itself to the sight except the strange lights and shadows of the lamp thrown on the cushions of [the carriage]2272-the carriage ; [Henriette]142-henriette 's figure in one corner , [Hannah]212-hannah , with [the child]4983-the child , in another , and the various rugs and trappings of wandering Britons . Everything was contracted , narrow . [The sea - passage]6443-the sea - passage had the same sinister character . [Hadria]211-hadria compared it to the crossing of [the Styx]68-the styx in [[Charon]265-charon 's gloomy ferry - boat]6444-charon 's gloomy ferry - boat . [She]211-hadria felt a patriotic thrill on hearing the first mellow English voice pronouncing the first kindly English sentence . The simple , slow , honest quality of the English nature gave [one]329-one a sense of safety . What splendid raw material to make [a nation]2577-a nation out of ! But , ah , it was sometimes dull to live with ! These impressions , floating vaguely in the upper currents of the mind , were simultaneous with a thousand thoughts and anxieties , and gusts of bitter fear and grief . What would be the end of it all ? This uprooting from [the old home]6447-the old home ‚Äî it wrung [one]329-one 's heart to think of it . Scarcely could the thought be faced . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father , [an exile from [[his]609-her father beloved fields and [hills]6452-hills]6451-his beloved fields and hills]6450-an exile from his beloved fields and hills ; [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother banished from [[her]520-her mother domain]6454-her domain of so many years , and after all these disappointments and mortifications and sorrows ! It was piteous . Where would [they]6455-they live ? What would [they]6455-they do ? [Hadria]211-hadria fought with [her]211-hadria tears . Ah ! it was hard for [old people]6456-old people to have to start life anew , bitterly hard . This was the moment for [[their]6456-old people children]654-their children to flock to [their]6456-old people rescue , to surround [them]6456-old people with care , with affection , with devotion ; to make [them]6456-old people feel that at least something that could be trusted , was left to [them]6456-old people from the wreck . ‚Äú[0-i] Ah ! There was silence for some minutes , but the silence swarmed with the ghosts of voices . The air seemed thick with shapes , and terrors , and strange warnings . [The doctor]1471-the doctor had not disguised the fact that [the patient]6463-the patient was fighting hard for life , and that it was impossible to predict the result . Everything depended on whether [her]211-hadria strength would hold out . The weakness of the heart was an unfortunate element in the case . To save strength and give plentiful nourishment , without heightening the fever , must be the constant effort . [Algitha]81-algitha 's experience stood [her]211-hadria in good stead . [Her]211-hadria practical ability had been quickened and disciplined by [her]211-hadria work . [She]211-hadria had trained [herself]211-hadria in nursing , among other things . [Hadria]211-hadria 's experience was small . [She]211-hadria had to summon [her]211-hadria intelligence to the rescue . [The Fullerton stock]1207-the fullerton stock had never been deficient in this particular . The clock struck the half - hour as [they]6487-they passed along [the landing]6489-the landing . A strange fancy came to [Hadria]211-hadria , that a dusky figure drifted away before [her]211-hadria , as [she]211-hadria advanced . It seemed as though death had receded at [her]211-hadria approach . The old childish love for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother had revived in all its force , during this long fight with [the reaper of souls]6491-the reaper of souls . [She]211-hadria felt all [her]211-hadria energies strung with the tension of battle . [She]211-hadria fought against a dark horror that [she]211-hadria could not face . Knowing , and realising vividly , that if [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother lived , [her]211-hadria own dreams were ended for ever , [she]211-hadria wrestled with desperate strength for the life that was at stake . [[Her]211-hadria father]609-her father 's silent wretchedness was terrible to see . [He]609-her father would not hear a word of doubt as to [the patient]6463-the patient 's recovery . [He]609-her father grew angry if [anyone]806-anyone hinted at danger . [He]609-her father insisted that [[his]609-her father wife]573-his wife was better each day . [She]2863-she would soon be up and well again . ‚Äú[0-i] Never well again , ‚Äù [the doctor]1471-the doctor had confided to [Hubert]118-hubert , ‚Äú[0-i] though [she]2863-she may possibly pull through . ‚Äù [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton 's extravagant hopefulness sent a thrill along the nerves . It was as if [he]609-her father had uttered the blackest forebodings . The present crisis had stirred a thousand feelings and associations , in [Hadria]211-hadria , which had long been slumbering . [She]211-hadria seemed to be sent back again , to the days of [her]211-hadria childhood . The intervening years were blotted out . [She]211-hadria realized now , with agonising vividness , the sadness of [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's life , the long stagnation , the slow decay of disused faculties , and the ache that accompanies all processes of decay , physical or moral . Not only the strong appeal of old affection , entwined with the earliest associations , was at work , but the appeal of womanhood itself:‚Äîthe grey sad story of [a woman]3753-a woman 's life , bare and dumb and pathetic in its irony and pain : the injury from without , and then the self - injury , its direct offspring ; unnecessary , yet inevitable ; the unconscious thirst for the sacrifice of [others]432-others , the hungry claims of a nature unfulfilled , the groping instinct to bring the balance of renunciation to the level , and indemnify [oneself]6501-oneself for the loss suffered and the spirit offered up . And that propitiation had to be made . It was as inevitable as that the doom of [Orestes]266-orestes should follow the original crime of [the house of [Atreus]70-atreus]6502-the house of atreus . [Hadria]211-hadria 's whole thought and strength were now centred on the effort to bring about that propitiation , in [[her]211-hadria own person]6503-her own person . [She]211-hadria prepared the altar and sharpened the knife . In that subtle and ironical fashion , [her]211-hadria fate was steadily at work . [The sick - room]6470-the sick - room was very still when [the sisters]3872-the sisters entered . It was both warm and fresh . The night - light threw long , stealthy shadows over [the room]379-the room . The fire burnt with a red glow . The bed lay against the long wall . As [the two figures]450-the two figures entered , there was a faint sound of quick panting , and a moan . [Hadria]211-hadria rushed to the bedside . ‚Äú[2863-she] Quick , quick , some brandy , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria called . The nervous system had been wrecked , not by any one shock or event , but by the accumulated strains of a lifetime . The constitution was broken up , once and for all . [A cottage]1766-a cottage had been taken , as near as possible to [the Red House]4718-the red house , where [the old couple]6527-the old couple were to settle for the rest of [their]6527-the old couple days , within reach of [[their]6527-the old couple children]654-their children and [grandchildren]6529-grandchildren . Every wish of [the invalid]6530-the invalid must be respected , just or unjust . Absolute repose of mind and body was imperatively necessary , and this could only be attained for [her]97-mrs. fullerton by a complete surrender , on the part of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children , of any course of action that [she]97-mrs. fullerton seriously disapproved . The income was too limited to allow of [Algitha]81-algitha 's returning to [[her]81-algitha parents]3931-her parents ; otherwise [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton would have wished it . [Algitha]81-algitha had now to provide for [herself]81-algitha , as the allowance that [[her]81-algitha father]609-her father had given [her]81-algitha could not be continued . [She]81-algitha had previously done [her]81-algitha work for nothing , but now [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan , under whose care [she]81-algitha had been living , offered [her]81-algitha a paid post in [a Convalescent Home in which [she]81-algitha was interested]6534-a convalescent home in which she was interested . ‚Äú[0-i] [I]0-i am exceptionally fortunate , ‚Äù said [Algitha]81-algitha , ‚Äú[95-mrs. trevelyan] for [Mrs. Trevelyan]95-mrs. trevelyan has arranged most kindly , so that [I]0-i can get away to see [mother]3851-mother and [father]3862-father at the end of every week . ‚Äù Both [Mr.]6535-mr. and [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had taken it for granted that [Hadria]211-hadria would remain at [the Red House]4718-the red house , and that [Hubert]118-hubert would ‚Äú[95-mrs. trevelyan] forgive ‚Äù [her]211-hadria , as [they]6537-they put it . [Algitha]81-algitha was to come down each week from Saturday till Monday , and [the brothers]6539-the brothers when [they]6539-the brothers could . During the rest of the week , [the invalid]6530-the invalid would depend on [[her]97-mrs. fullerton younger daughter]577-her younger daughter . [Hadria]211-hadria 's leaving [home]3770-home , and the rumour of a quarrel between [her]211-hadria and [Hubert]118-hubert , had conduced to [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's illness , perhaps had even caused it . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton had taken it bitterly to heart . It had become obvious that [Hadria]211-hadria would have now to remain at [the Red House]4718-the red house , for [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's sake , and that being so , [she]97-mrs. fullerton and [Hubert]118-hubert agreed that it was useless to discuss any other reasons for and against it . [Hubert]118-hubert was only too glad of [her]211-hadria return , for appearance ' sake . [Neither of [them]6539-the brothers]6546-neither of them thought , for a moment , of what [Henriette]142-henriette called a ‚Äú[95-mrs. trevelyan] reconciliation . ‚Äù What had passed before [Hadria]211-hadria 's departure had revealed finally , the hopelessness of such an attempt . Matters settled down heavily and with an air of finality . If only [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's declining years were happy and peaceful , that would be something of importance gained , but , alas ! [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton seemed anything but happy . [Her]97-mrs. fullerton helplessness was hard to bear , and [she]97-mrs. fullerton felt the worldly downfall , severely . All this , and the shattered state of [her]97-mrs. fullerton nerves tended to make [her]97-mrs. fullerton exacting and irritable ; and as [she]97-mrs. fullerton had felt seriously aggrieved for so many years of [her]97-mrs. fullerton life , [she]97-mrs. fullerton now regarded the devotion of [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children as a debt tardily paid , and the habit grew insensibly upon [her]97-mrs. fullerton of increasing [her]97-mrs. fullerton demands , as [she]97-mrs. fullerton found [everyone]3726-everyone so ready to submit to [them]3726-everyone . The possession of power had its usual effect . [She]97-mrs. fullerton knew no mercy in its use . [[Her]97-mrs. fullerton daughters]364-her daughters were made to feel that if [they]364-her daughters had been less headstrong and selfish in the past , [she]97-mrs. fullerton would have been [a vigorous and active woman to this day]6551-a vigorous and active woman to this day . Obviously , the very least [they]364-her daughters could do , was to try by all means in [their]364-her daughters power , to lighten the burden [they]364-her daughters had laid upon [her]97-mrs. fullerton . Yet [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was , by nature , unselfish . [She]97-mrs. fullerton would have gladly sacrificed [herself]97-mrs. fullerton for [[her]97-mrs. fullerton children]576-her children 's good , as indeed [she]97-mrs. fullerton had persistently and doggedly sacrificed [herself]97-mrs. fullerton for [them]576-her children , during [their]576-her children childhood , but naturally [she]97-mrs. fullerton had [her]97-mrs. fullerton own view of what constituted [their]576-her children ‚Äú[95-mrs. trevelyan] good . ‚Äù It did not consist in wasting [one]329-one 's youth and looks among [the slums of [the East End]6555-the east end]6554-the slums of the east end , or in deserting [[one]329-one 's [home]3770-home]6557-one 's home to study music and mix in a set of [second - rate people]6559-second - rate people , in [an out - of - the - way district of [Paris]35-paris]6560-an out - of - the - way district of paris . As for [Hadria]211-hadria 's conduct about [little Martha]129-martha , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton could scarcely bring [herself]97-mrs. fullerton to speak about it . It terrified [her]97-mrs. fullerton . [She]97-mrs. fullerton thought it indicated some taint of madness in [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter 's mind . [Two charming children of [her]97-mrs. fullerton own]6562-two charming children of her own and ‚Äî but [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton , with a painful flush , would turn [her]97-mrs. fullerton mind from the subject . [She]97-mrs. fullerton had to believe [[her]97-mrs. fullerton daughter]3909-her daughter either mad or bad , and that was terrible to [her]97-mrs. fullerton maternal pride . [She]97-mrs. fullerton could indeed scarcely believe that it had not all been a painful dream , for [Hadria]211-hadria was now so good and dutiful , so tender and watchful ; how could [she]211-hadria have behaved so abominably , so crazily ? Every day [Hadria]211-hadria came to [the cottage]1763-the cottage , generally with a bunch of fresh flowers to place by [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's couch , and then all the affairs of [the household]2435-the household were talked over and arranged , [the daughter]3913-the daughter doing what was needed in the way of ordering provisions or writing notes , for [the invalid]6530-the invalid could now write only with the greatest difficulty . Then [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton liked to have a chat , to hear what was in the papers , what was going on in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood , and to discuss all sorts of dreary details , over and over again . Books that [Hadria]211-hadria would sometimes bring were generally left unread , unless they were light novels of a rigidly conventional character . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton grew so excited in [her]97-mrs. fullerton condemnation of any other kind , that it was dangerous to put them before [her]97-mrs. fullerton . In the evenings , [the old couple]6527-the old couple liked to have a rubber , and often [Hubert]118-hubert and [Hadria]211-hadria would make up the necessary quartett ; [four silent human beings]6571-four silent human beings , who sat like [solemn children]6572-solemn children at [their]6572-solemn children portentous play , while the clock on the mantelpiece recorded the moments of [their]6527-the old couple lives that [they]6527-the old couple dedicated to the mimic battle . Hours and hours were spent in this way . But [Hadria]211-hadria found that [she]0-i could not endure it every night , much to the surprise of [[her]0-i parents]3931-her parents . The monotony , the incessant recurrence , had a disastrous effect on [her]0-i nerves , suggesting wild and desperate impulses . ‚Äú[95-mrs. trevelyan] [I]0-i should go out of [my]0-i mind , if [I]0-i had no breaks , ‚Äù [she]0-i said at last , after trying it for some months . ‚Äú[0-i] In the interests of future rubbers , [I]0-i must leave off , now and then . [He]2883-he that plays and runs away , will live to play another day . ‚Äù [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton thought it strange that [Hadria]211-hadria could not do even this little thing for [[her]211-hadria parents]3931-her parents , without grumbling , but [she]0-i did not wish to make a martyr of [her]211-hadria . [They]3931-her parents must try and find [some one else]6575-some one else to take [her]211-hadria place occasionally . Sometimes [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming would accept the post , sometimes [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton , and often [Ernest]86-ernest or [Fred]83-fred , whose comparatively well - ordered minds were not sent off [their]3931-her parents balance so easily as [Hadria]211-hadria 's . In this fashion , the time went by , and the new state of affairs already seemed a hundred years old . [Paris]35-paris was a clear , but far - off dream . An occasional letter from [Madame Vauchelet]232-madame vauchelet or [Jouffroy]248-jouffroy , who mourned and wailed over [Hadria]211-hadria 's surrender of [her]211-hadria work , served to remind [her]211-hadria that it had once been actual and living . There still existed [a [Paris]35-paris far away beyond [the hills]413-the hills]6576-a paris far away beyond the hills , brilliant , vivid , exquisite , inspiring , and at this very moment [the people]4302-the people were coming and going , [the river]437-the river was flowing , the little steamers plying,‚Äîbut how hard it was to realise ! [The family]360-the family was charmed with the position of affairs . ‚Äú[2883-he] It is such a mercy things have happened as [they]2884-they have ! ‚Äù was the verdict , delivered with much wise shaking of heads . ‚Äú[2884-they] There can be no more mad or disgraceful behaviour on the part of [[Hubert]118-hubert 's wife]2885-hubert 's wife , that is one comfort . [She]2885-hubert 's wife ca n't murder [[her]2885-hubert 's wife mother]520-her mother outright , though [she]2885-hubert 's wife has not been far off it ! ‚Äù From the first , [Hadria]211-hadria had understood what the future must be . These circumstances could not be overcome by any deed that [she]211-hadria could bring [herself]211-hadria to do . Even [Valeria]109-valeria was baffled . [Her]211-hadria theories would not quite work . [Hadria]211-hadria looked things straight in the face . That which was strongest and most essential in [her]211-hadria must starve ; there was no help for it , and [no one]383-no one was directly to blame , not even [herself]211-hadria . [Fate]102-fate , chance , [Providence]191-providence , [the devil]1352-the devil , or whatever it was , had determined against [her]211-hadria particular impulses and [her]211-hadria particular view of things . After all , it would have been rather strange if these powers had happened exactly to agree with [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was not so ridiculous ( [she]211-hadria told [herself]211-hadria ) as to feel personally aggrieved , but so long as fate , chance , [Providence]191-providence , or the devil , gave [her]211-hadria emotions and desires and talent and will , it was impossible not to suffer . [She]211-hadria might fully recognise that the suffering was of absolutely no importance in the great scheme of things , but that did not make the suffering less . If it must be , it must be , and there was an end to it . Should [someone]4160-someone gain by it , that was highly satisfactory , and more than could be said of most suffering , which exists , it would seem , only to increase and multiply after the manner of some dire disease . This was what [Hadria]211-hadria dreaded in [her]211-hadria own case : that the loss would not end with [her]211-hadria . [The children]667-the children , [Martha]129-martha , [everyone who came under [her]211-hadria influence]6585-everyone who came under her influence , must share in it . [Henriette]142-henriette irritated [her]211-hadria by an approving sweetness of demeanour , carefully avoiding any look of triumph , or rather triumphing by that air which said : ‚Äú[2885-hubert 's wife] [I]0-i would n't crow over [you]2887-you for [the world]334-the world ! ‚Äù [She]142-henriette was evidently brimming over with satisfaction . [The family]360-the family and [its]360-the family reputation were saved . ‚Äú[0-i] [You]2889-you appear to think that the eyes of [Europe]71-europe are riveted on [the Temperley family]2890-the temperley family , ‚Äù said [Hadria]211-hadria ; ‚Äú[2889-you] an august race , [I]0-i know , but there are one or two other branches of [the human stock in existence]2891-the human stock in existence . ‚Äù ‚Äú[329-one] [One]329-one must consider what [people]3687-people say , ‚Äù said [Henriette]142-henriette . [Hadria]211-hadria 's time now was filled more and more with detail , since there were two households instead of one to manage . The new charge was particularly difficult , because [she]211-hadria had not a free hand . Without entirely abandoning [her]211-hadria music , it had , perforce , to fall into abeyance . Progress was scarcely possible . But as [Henriette]142-henriette pointed out ‚Äî it gave so much pleasure to [others]432-others ‚Äî when [Hadria]211-hadria avoided music that was too severely classical . At [Craddock Place]29-craddock place , one evening , [she]211-hadria was taken in to dinner by [a callow youth]6588-a callow youth , who found a fertile subject for [his]6588-a callow youth wit , in the follies and excesses of what [he]6588-a callow youth called the ‚Äú[3687-people] new womanhood . ‚Äù It was so delightful , [he]6588-a callow youth said , to come to [the country]401-the country , where [women]606-women were still charming in the good old way . [He]6588-a callow youth knew that this new womanhood business was only a phase , do n't [you]6591-you know , but upon [his]6588-a callow youth word , [he]6588-a callow youth was getting tired of it . [Hadria]211-hadria was not surprised that [he]6588-a callow youth could not stand it . There had been a scathing article , [the youth]6593-the youth said , in one of the evening papers . [He]6588-a callow youth wondered how the ‚Äú[3687-people] New Woman ‚Äù felt after reading it ! It simply made mincemeat of [her]606-women . ‚Äú[269-mr. st. george] Wretched creature ! ‚Äù [Hadria]211-hadria exclaimed . [The youth]6593-the youth wished that [women]606-women would really do something , instead of making all this fuss . [Hadria]211-hadria agreed that it was a pity [they]606-women were so inactive . Could not [one or two of the more favoured sex]6596-one or two of the more favoured sex manage to inspire [them]606-women with a little initiative ? [The youth]6593-the youth considered that [women]606-women were , by nature , passive and reflective , not original . [Hadria]211-hadria thought the novelty of that idea not the least of its charms . [The youth]6593-the youth allowed that , in [her]6593-the youth own way , and in [her]6593-the youth own sphere , [woman]3844-woman was charming and singularly intelligent . [He]6588-a callow youth had no objection to [her]6593-the youth developing as much as [she]6593-the youth pleased , in proper directions . ( [Hadria]211-hadria felt really encouraged . ) But it was so absurd to pretend that [women]606-women could do work that was peculiar to [men]3698-men . ( [Hadria]211-hadria agreed , with a chuckle . ) When had [they]6603-they written one of [Shakespeare]268-shakespeare 's dramas ? ( When indeed ? History was ominously silent on that point . ) ‚Äú[269-mr. st. george] [Hadria]211-hadria , what is amusing [you]211-hadria ? ‚Äù enquired [[her]211-hadria hostess]4819-her hostess , across the table . ‚Äú[211-hadria] Oh , well ‚Äî only the discouraging fact that [no woman]5158-no woman , as [Mr. St. George]269-mr. st. george convincingly points out , has ever written one of [Shakespeare]268-shakespeare 's dramas ! ‚Äù ‚Äú[269-mr. st. george] Oh , ‚Äù said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton with a broad smile , ‚Äú[269-mr. st. george] but [you]211-hadria know , [Mr. St. George]269-mr. st. george , [we]2895-we really have n't had quite the same chances , have [we]2895-we ? ‚Äù Perhaps not quite , as far as literature went , [the youth]6593-the youth admitted tolerantly , but there was failure in original work in every direction . [Women]606-women 's strength lay in a different domain ‚Äî in [the home]2476-the home . It was of no use to try to fight against Nature . [Hadria]211-hadria , in desperation , was thinking of throwing minor considerations to the winds , and going to see for [herself]211-hadria the state of affairs ( it could be managed without [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother 's knowledge , and so would not endanger [her]211-hadria health or life ) , when [the two boys]1811-the two boys were sent back hastily from [school]3954-school , where scarlet fever had broken out . [Her]0-i life was passing , passing , and the supreme gifts would never be [hers]0-i . [She]97-mrs. fullerton feared that [Hadria]211-hadria spent too many hours over [her]211-hadria composing ; [she]211-hadria sat up at night , perhaps . What good did all this composing do ? [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was sure that [Hadria]211-hadria saw [too few people]6646-too few people , lived too monotonous a life . [Craddock Place]29-craddock place was filled with [guests]4588-guests just now , and [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton used [her]176-lady engleton utmost persuasion to induce [Hubert]118-hubert and [Hadria]211-hadria to come to dinner , or to join the party , in the evening , whenever [they]4588-guests could . [Hadria]211-hadria shrank from the idea . It was adding another burden to [her]211-hadria already failing strength . To talk coherently , to be lively and make [oneself]6648-oneself agreeable , to have to think about [one]329-one 's dress,‚Äîit all seemed inexpressibly wearisome . But [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton was so genuinely eager to administer [her]176-lady engleton cure that [Hadria]211-hadria yielded , half in gratitude , half in order to save the effort of further resistance . [She]211-hadria dragged [herself]211-hadria [upstairs]4836-upstairs to dress , wishing to heaven [she]211-hadria had refused , after all . [She]211-hadria had only one evening gown suitable for the occasion . It was of some white silken stuff , with dull rich surface . A bunch of yellow roses and green leaves formed the decoration . [Hubert]118-hubert approved of [her]211-hadria appearance . To [her]211-hadria own surprise [she]211-hadria felt some new feeling creep into [her]211-hadria , under the influence of the exquisite attire . It put [her]211-hadria a little more in tune . At least there were beautiful and dainty things in [the world]334-the world . The fresh green of the rose leaves , and the full yet delicate yellow of the fragrant roses on the creamy lace , evoked a feeling akin to the emotion stirred by certain kinds of music ; or , in other words , the artistic sensibility had been appealed to through colour and texture , instead of through harmony . [The drawing - room at [Craddock Place]29-craddock place]6652-the drawing - room at craddock place was glowing with subdued candle - light . It seemed as if [Hadria]211-hadria were exercising some influence of a magnetic quality . [She]211-hadria was always the point of attraction , whether [she]211-hadria created a spell with [her]211-hadria music , or [her]211-hadria speech , or [her]211-hadria mere personality . In [her]211-hadria present mood , this was peculiarly gratifying . The long divorce from initiative work which events had compelled , the loss of nervous vigour , the destruction of dream and hope , had all tended to throw [her]211-hadria back on more accessible forms of art and expression , and suggested passive rather than active dealings with life . [She]211-hadria was wearied with petty responsibilities , and what [she]211-hadria called semi - detached duties . It was a relief to sit down in white silk and lace , and draw [people]3687-people to [her]211-hadria simply by the cheap spell of good looks and personal magnetism . That [she]211-hadria possessed these advantages , [her]211-hadria life in [Paris]35-paris had made obvious . It was the first time that [she]211-hadria had been in contact with a large number of widely differing types , and [she]211-hadria had found that [she]211-hadria could appeal to [them]6669-them all , if [she]211-hadria would . To - night the atmosphere was light and soft , brilliant and enervating . ‚Äú[178-claude moreton] This is [my]0-i Capua , ‚Äù [she]211-hadria said laughingly , to [[her]211-hadria hostess]4819-her hostess . It invited every luxurious instinct to come forth and sun itself . [Marion Fenwick]273-marion fenwick 's soft , sweet voice , singing Italian songs to the accompaniment of the guitar , repeated the invitation . It was like a fairy gift . Energy would be required to refuse it . And why , in heaven 's name , if [she]211-hadria might not have what [she]211-hadria really wanted , was [she]211-hadria to be denied even the poor little triumphs of ornamental womanhood ? Was the social order which had frustrated [her]211-hadria own ambitions to dominate [her]211-hadria conscience , and persuade [her]211-hadria voluntarily to resign that one kingdom which can not be taken from [a woman]3753-a woman , so long as [her]211-hadria beauty lasts ? Why should [she]211-hadria abdicate ? [The human being]5264-the human being was obviously susceptible to personality beyond all other things . And beauty moved [that absurd creature]6673-that absurd creature preposterously . There , at least , [the woman who chanced to be born with these superficial attractions]6674-the woman who chanced to be born with these superficial attractions , had a royal territory , so long as [she]211-hadria could prevent [[her]211-hadria clamorous fellows]6675-her clamorous fellows from harassing and wearing those attractions away . [They]6675-her clamorous fellows could only do it indirectly , by appealing to the conscience which [they]6675-her clamorous fellows had trained ; to the principles that [they]6675-her clamorous fellows had instilled ; by convincing [the woman]4547-the woman that [she]4547-the woman owed [herself]4547-the woman , as a debt , to [[her]4547-the woman legal owner]6677-her legal owner , to be paid in coined fragments of [her]4547-the woman being , till [she]4547-the woman should end in inevitable bankruptcy , and [the legal owner]6678-the legal owner [himself]6678-the legal owner found [her]4547-the woman a poor investment ! [Mrs. Jordan]179-mrs. jordan bristled , and launched [herself]179-mrs. jordan upon a long and virtuous sentence .
