[Valeria]109-valeria was tongue - tied . ‚Äú Now do [you]211-hadria see why [I]211-hadria feel so terrified when [anyone]806-anyone proposes to narrow down [his]806-anyone existence , even in the smallest particular , for [my]211-hadria sake ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] asked [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú It is because [I]211-hadria see what awful power [a human being]668-a human being may acquire of ravaging and of ruling other lives , and [I]211-hadria do n't want to acquire that power . [I]211-hadria see that the tyranny may be perfectly well - intentioned , and indeed scarcely to be called tyranny , for it is but half conscious , yet only the more irresistible for that . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú It is [one]329-one 's own fault if [one]329-one submits to conscious tyranny , ‚Äù[4071-the professor] [the Professor]4071-the professor put in , ‚Äú and [I]4071-the professor think [tyrant]7082-tyrant and [victim]7083-victim are then much on a par . ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú A mere demand can be resisted , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria added ; ‚Äú it is grief , real grief , however unreasonable , that brings [people]3687-people to [their]3687-people knees . But [Hadria]211-hadria held that [everybody]3781-everybody was more or less subject to the thraldom . And the thraldom increased as the mind and the experience narrowed . And as the narrowing process progressed , [she]211-hadria said , the exhausting or vampire quality grew and grew . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria have seen it , [I]211-hadria have seen it ! [Those who have been starved in life]7095-those who have been starved in life , levy a sort of tax on the plenty of [others]432-others , in the instinctive effort to replenish [their]7095-those who have been starved in life own empty treasure - house . [One]329-one can only reduce [one]329-one 's victim to a beggary like [one]329-one 's own . ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Valeria]109-valeria was perturbed . ‚Äú The more [I]109-valeria see of life , the more bitter a thing it seems to be [a woman]3753-a woman ! One more or less‚Äî. ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria gave a shrug . [The Professor]4071-the professor broke in , abruptly . ‚Äú It is exactly the one more or less that sends the balance up or down , that decides the fate of [men]3698-men and [nations]7130-nations . [An individual]7131-an individual often counts more than a generation . If that were not so , nothing would be possible , and hope would be insane . ‚Äù[4071-the professor] ‚Äú Perhaps it is ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria beneath [her]211-hadria breath . [The Professor]4071-the professor had risen . [He]4071-the professor heard the last words , but made no remonstrance . Yet there was a something in [his]4071-the professor expression that gave comfort . ‚Äú [I]4071-the professor fear [I]4071-the professor shall have to be going back , ‚Äù[4071-the professor] [he]4071-the professor said , looking at [his]4071-the professor watch . As [he]4071-the professor spoke , the first notes of a nightingale stole out of the shrubbery . Voices were hushed , and [the three]6873-the three stood listening spellbound , to the wonderful impassioned song . [Hadria]211-hadria marvelled at its strange serenity , despite the passion , and speculated vaguely as to the possibility of a paradox of the same kind in the soul of [a human being]668-a human being . Passion and serenity ? Had not [the Professor]4071-the professor combined these apparent contradictions ? There was ecstasy so supreme in the bird 's note that it had become calm again , like great heat that affects the senses , as with frost , or a flooded river that runs swift and smooth for very fulness . Presently , a second nightingale began to answer from a distant tree , and [the garden]3867-the garden was filled with the wild music . One or two stars had already twinkled out . ‚Äú [I]4071-the professor ought really to be going , ‚Äù[4071-the professor] said [the Professor]4071-the professor . But [he]4071-the professor lingered still . [His]4071-the professor eyes wandered anxiously to [Hadria]211-hadria 's white face . [He]4071-the professor said good - night to [Valeria]109-valeria , and then [he]4071-the professor and [Hadria]211-hadria walked to the gate together . ‚Äú [You]4071-the professor will come back and see [us]6873-the three at [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene soon after [you]4071-the professor return , wo n't [you]4071-the professor ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said wistfully . ‚Äú Of course [I]211-hadria will . And [I]211-hadria hope that meanwhile , [you]4071-the professor will set to work to get strong and well . All [your]4071-the professor leisure ought to be devoted to that object , for the present . [I]211-hadria hope if ever [I]211-hadria come back to [England]14-england ‚Äî ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú When [you]211-hadria come back , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria corrected , hastily . ‚Äî ‚Äú that [we]3378-we may meet [oftener]7132-oftener . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú Indeed , that will be something to look forward to ! ‚Äù[3378-we] [They]3378-we exchanged the hearty , lingering handshake of trusty friendship and deep affection . The last words , the last good wishes , were spoken , the last wistful effort was made of [two human souls]3379-two human souls to bid [each other]4561-each other be of good cheer , and to bring to [one another comfort and hope]3381-one another comfort and hope . [Hadria]211-hadria leant on the gate , [a lonely figure in the dim star - light]3382-a lonely figure in the dim star - light , watching the form that had already become shadowy , retreating along [the road]4037-the road and gradually losing itself in the darkness . [AUTUMN]283-autumn had come round again . [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene had calmed down after the exciting event of the summer . [[Martha]129-martha 's little cottage]3384-martha 's little cottage was now standing empty , the virginia creeper trailing wildly , in thick festoons and dangling sprays over [the porch]1117-the porch and creeping up round the windows , even threatening to cover them with a ruddy screen , since now the bright little face no longer looked out of the latticed panes , and [the cottage]1763-the cottage was given over to dust and spiders . [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley was often seen by [the villagers]2235-the villagers passing along [the road]4037-the road towards [Craddock]23-craddock . [She]154-mrs. temperley would sometimes pause at [the cottage]1763-the cottage , to gather a few of the flowers that still came up in [the tiny garden]3390-the tiny garden . It was said that [she]154-mrs. temperley gathered them to lay on [[Ellen Jervis]184-ellen jervis 's grave]3391-ellen jervis 's grave . ‚Äú [Dear]2230-dear , [dear]2230-dear , [she]154-mrs. temperley do take on about [that child]2190-that child ! ‚Äù[155-dodge] [Dodge]155-dodge used to say , as [she]155-dodge passed up [[the street]5996-the street of [Craddock]23-craddock]3393-the street of craddock . And [Mrs. Gullick]156-mrs. gullick , [good soul]3394-good soul , would shake [her]156-mrs. gullick head and express [her]156-mrs. gullick sympathy , in spite of not ‚Äú holding ‚Äù[156-mrs. gullick] with [Mrs. Temperley]154-mrs. temperley 's ‚Äú ways . ‚Äù[156-mrs. gullick] [[Her]156-mrs. gullick poorer neighbours]4739-her poorer neighbours understood far more than [the others]303-the others could understand , how sorely [she]156-mrs. gullick was grieving about [the child]4983-the child . Because [she]156-mrs. gullick said nothing on the subject , it was generally supposed that [she]156-mrs. gullick had ceased to care . After all , it was an act of charity that [she]156-mrs. gullick had undertaken , on an impulse , and it was quite as well that [she]156-mrs. gullick should be relieved of the responsibility . [Hannah]212-hannah used to write regularly , to let [her]212-hannah know how [Martha]129-martha was . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had directed [Hannah]212-hannah to do this . [The nurse]1797-the nurse had to admit that [he]181-professor theobald was very good and very devoted to [the child]4983-the child . [She]156-mrs. gullick throve in [[her]156-mrs. gullick new home]6110-her new home , and seemed perfectly happy . [Hadria]211-hadria was now delivered over to the tender mercies of [her]211-hadria own thoughts . [Her]211-hadria memories burnt , as corrosive acids , in [her]211-hadria brain . [She]211-hadria could find no shadow of protection from [her]211-hadria own contempt . There was not one nook or cranny into which that ruthless self - knowledge could not throw its cruel glare . In the hours of darkness , in the haunted hours of the early morning , [she]211-hadria and [her]211-hadria memories played horrible games with [one another]3945-one another . [She]211-hadria was hunted , [they]3402-they [the hunters]3403-the hunters . There was no thought on which [she]211-hadria could rest , no consoling remembrance . [She]211-hadria often wished that [she]211-hadria had followed [her]211-hadria frequent impulse to tell [Miss Du]109-valeria Prel the whole wretched story . But [she]211-hadria could not force [herself]211-hadria to touch the subject through the painful medium of speech . [Valeria]109-valeria knew that [Hadria]211-hadria was capable of any outward law - breaking , but [she]109-valeria would never be prepared for the breaking of [her]109-valeria own inner law , the real canon on which [she]109-valeria had always laid so much stress . And then [she]109-valeria had shrunk from the idea of betraying a secret not solely [her]109-valeria own . If [she]109-valeria told the story , [Valeria]109-valeria would certainly guess the name . [She]109-valeria felt a still greater longing that [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue should know the facts ; [he]116-professor fortescue would be able to help [her]109-valeria to face it all , and to take the memory into [her]109-valeria life and let its pain eat out what was base and evil in [her]109-valeria soul . [He]116-professor fortescue would give [her]109-valeria hope ; [his]116-professor fortescue experience , [his]116-professor fortescue extraordinary sympathy , would enable [him]116-professor fortescue to understand it all , better than [she]109-valeria did [herself]109-valeria . If [he]116-professor fortescue would look at this miserable episode unflinchingly , and still hold out [his]116-professor fortescue hand to [her]109-valeria , as [she]109-valeria knew [he]116-professor fortescue would , and still believe in [her]109-valeria , then [she]109-valeria might believe still in [herself]109-valeria , in [her]109-valeria power of rising after this lost illusion , this shock of self - detection , and of going on again , sadder , and perhaps stronger ; but if [he]116-professor fortescue thought that since [she]109-valeria was capable of a real treason against [[her]109-valeria gods]3404-her gods , that [she]109-valeria was radically unsound at heart , and a mass of sophistication , then ‚Äî [Hadria]211-hadria buried [her]211-hadria face in the pillow . [She]211-hadria went through so often now , these paroxysms of agony . Do what [she]211-hadria would , look where [she]211-hadria might , [she]211-hadria saw no relief . [She]211-hadria was afraid to trust [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria was afraid to accept [her]211-hadria own suggestions of comfort , if ever a ray of it came to [her]211-hadria , lest it should be but another form of self - deception , another proof of moral instability . In [her]211-hadria eternal tossing to and fro , in mental anguish , the despairing idea often assailed [her]211-hadria : that after all , it did not matter what [she]211-hadria did or thought . [She]211-hadria was but [an atom of the vast whole , a drop in the ocean of human life]3405-an atom of the vast whole , a drop in the ocean of human life . [She]211-hadria had no end or motive in anything . [She]211-hadria could go on doing what had to be done to the last , glad if [she]211-hadria might bring a little pleasure in so acting , but beyond that , what was there to consider ? The wounds to [her]211-hadria vanity and [her]211-hadria pride ached a little , at times , but the infinitely deeper hurt of disillusion overwhelmed the lesser feeling . [She]211-hadria was too profoundly sad to care for that trivial mortification . Sometimes , [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue used to write to [Hadria]211-hadria , and [she]211-hadria looked forward to these letters as to nothing else . [She]211-hadria heard from [Valeria]109-valeria also , who had met [the Professor at [Siena]281-siena]3406-the professor at siena . [She]109-valeria said [he]3406-the professor at siena did not look as well as [she]109-valeria had hoped to find [him]3406-the professor at siena . [She]109-valeria could not see that [he]3406-the professor at siena had gained at all , since leaving [England]14-england . [He]3406-the professor at siena was cheerful , and enjoying [sunny Italy]11-italy as much as [his]3406-the professor at siena strength would allow . [Valeria]109-valeria was shocked to notice how very weak [he]3406-the professor at siena was . [He]3406-the professor at siena had a look in [his]3406-the professor at siena face that [she]109-valeria could not bear to see . When [one]329-one was ill , [home]3770-home was the best place after all . ‚Äú [You]3406-the professor at siena and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue , ‚Äù[109-valeria] [she]109-valeria said , in closing [her]109-valeria letter , ‚Äú are [the two people [I]109-valeria love in [the world]334-the world]7136-the two people i love in the world . Write to [me]109-valeria , dearest [Hadria]211-hadria , for [I]109-valeria am very anxious and wretched . ‚Äù[109-valeria] The affairs of life and death mix themselves incongruously enough , in [this confused world]3411-this confused world . The next news that stirred the repose of [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene , was that of [Algitha]81-algitha 's engagement to [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred . In spite of [his]3406-the professor at siena socialistic views , [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton was satisfied with the marriage , because [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred was well - connected and had good expectations . [The mother]578-the mother had feared that [Algitha]81-algitha would never marry at all , and [she]578-the mother not only raised no objection , but seemed relieved . [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred had come down to stay at [the Red House]34-the red house , during one of [Algitha]81-algitha 's holidays , and it was then that the betrothal had taken place . The marriage promised to be happy , for [the couple]3413-the couple were deeply attached and had interests in common . [They]3413-the couple intended to continue to work on the same lines after [they]3413-the couple were married . [Both parents]3414-both parents were favourably impressed by [the son - in - law elect]3415-the son - in - law elect , and [the Cottage]1763-the cottage became the scene of exciting arguments on the subject of socialism . [Mr. Fullerton]89-mr. fullerton insisted on holding [Wilfrid Burton]83-fred responsible for every sort of theory that had ever been attributed not merely to [socialists]3417-socialists , but to [communists]3418-communists , [anarchists]3419-anarchists , [collectivists]3420-collectivists , [nihilists]3421-nihilists , and the rest ; and nothing would persuade [him]89-mr. fullerton that [the young man]4116-the young man was not guilty of all these contradictory enormities of thought . [The Professor]4071-the professor 's presence seemed to change the very atmosphere . [She]109-valeria was thankful for the great privilege of [his]4071-the professor friendship . A new tone had come over [Valeria]109-valeria 's letters , of late ; the desperate , almost bitter element had passed away , and something approaching serenity had taken its place . [No one]383-no one , [she]109-valeria said , could be in [the Professor]4071-the professor 's presence every day , and remain exactly the same as before . [He]4071-the professor came and went among [[his]4071-the professor fellows]951-his fellows , quietly , beneficently , and each was the better for having met [him]4071-the professor , more or less , according to the fineness and sensitiveness of the nature . ‚Äú [My]109-valeria love for [him]4071-the professor , ‚Äù[109-valeria] said [Valeria]109-valeria , ‚Äú used at one time to be a great trouble to [me]109-valeria . Now [I]109-valeria am glad of it , and though there must be an element of pain in a hopeless love , yet [I]109-valeria hold [myself]109-valeria fortunate to have cherished it . ‚Äù[109-valeria] [Hadria]211-hadria received this letter from [the postman]3462-the postman when [she]211-hadria was coming out of [[Dodge]155-dodge 's cottage]3463-dodge 's cottage . How [she]211-hadria envied [Valeria]109-valeria ! To love with [her]211-hadria whole heart , without a shadow of doubt ; to have that element of warmth in [her]211-hadria life which could never fail [her]211-hadria , like sunshine to [the earth]2009-the earth . Among the cruelest elements of [Hadria]211-hadria 's experience had been that emptying of [her]211-hadria heart ; the rebuff to the need for love , the conviction that [she]211-hadria was to go through life without its supreme emotion . [Professor Theobald]181-professor theobald had thrown away what might have been a master - passion . The outlook was so blank and cold , so unutterably lonely ! [She]211-hadria looked back to the days at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , as if several lifetimes had passed between [her]211-hadria and [them]3466-them . [I]81-algitha think [you]118-hubert were right , after all . It is a matter of relation . ‚Äù[81-algitha] The autumn was unusually fine , and the colours sumptuous beyond description . [Hubert]118-hubert had successfully carried the day with regard to the important case which had taken [him]118-hubert abroad , and had now returned to [Craddock Dene]22-craddock dene . [Henriette]142-henriette came to stay at [the Red House]34-the red house . [He]118-hubert placed the tips of [his]118-hubert fingers together and looked into the fire . ‚Äú [I]118-hubert think that the companionship of [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton has been of great service to [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äù[118-hubert] [he]118-hubert observed , after a long pause . ‚Äú Unquestionably , ‚Äù[142-henriette] assented [Henriette]142-henriette . ‚Äú [She]176-lady engleton has had an enormous influence upon [her]176-lady engleton . [She]176-lady engleton has taught [Hadria]211-hadria to see that one may hold [one]329-one 's own ideas quietly , without flying in [everybody]3781-everybody 's face . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton is [a pronounced agnostic]7159-a pronounced agnostic , yet [she]176-lady engleton never misses a Sunday at [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , and [I]142-henriette am glad to see that [Hadria]211-hadria is following [her]176-lady engleton example . It must be a great satisfaction to [you]118-hubert , [Hubert]118-hubert . [People]3687-people used to talk unpleasantly about [Hadria]211-hadria 's extremely irregular attendance . It is such a mistake to offend [people]3687-people 's ideas , in a small place like this . ‚Äù[142-henriette] ‚Äú That is what [I]118-hubert told [Hadria]211-hadria , ‚Äù[118-hubert] said [Hubert]118-hubert , ‚Äú and [[her]211-hadria mother]520-her mother has been speaking seriously to [her]211-hadria on the subject . [Hadria]211-hadria made no opposition , rather to [my]118-hubert surprise . [She]211-hadria said that [she]211-hadria would go as regularly as [our]7163-our dining - room clock , if it gave [us]7163-our all so much satisfaction . ‚Äù[118-hubert] ‚Äú How charming ! ‚Äù[142-henriette] cried [Henriette]142-henriette benevolently , ‚Äú and how characteristic ! ‚Äù[142-henriette] As [Hadria]211-hadria sank in faith and hope , [she]211-hadria rose in the opinion of [[her]211-hadria neighbours]1818-her neighbours . [She]211-hadria was never nearer to universal unbelief than now , when [the orthodox]5549-the orthodox began to smile upon [her]211-hadria . Life presented itself to [her]211-hadria as a mere welter of confused forces . If goodness , or aspiration , or any godlike thing arose , for a moment ‚Äî like [some shipwrecked soul with hands outstretched above the waves]3473-some shipwrecked soul with hands outstretched above the waves ‚Äî swiftly it sank again submerged , leaving only a faint ripple on the surface , soon overswept and obliterated . [She]211-hadria could detect no light on the face of [the troubled waters]5227-the troubled waters . Looking around [her]211-hadria at other lives , [she]211-hadria saw the story written in different characters , but always the same ; hope , struggle , failure . The pathos of old age wrung [her]211-hadria heart ; the sorrows of [the poor]543-the poor , [the lonely]3476-the lonely , the illusions of [the seeker after wealth]3477-the seeker after wealth , the utter vanity of the objects of [men]3698-men 's pursuit , and the end of it all ! ‚Äú [I]81-algitha wonder what is the secret of success , [Hadria]211-hadria ? ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú Speaking generally , [I]81-algitha should say to have a petty aim . ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú Then if [one]329-one succeeds after a long struggle , ‚Äù[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha pensively . ‚Äú [One]329-one finds it , [I]81-algitha doubt not , the dismalest of failures . ‚Äù[81-algitha] A great cloud of darkness seemed to have descended over [the earth]2009-the earth . [Hadria]211-hadria felt cut off even from Nature . The splendours of the autumn appeared at a vast distance from [her]211-hadria . [They]3480-they belonged to [another world]2583-another world . [She]211-hadria could not get near [them]3480-they . [Mother earth]3482-mother earth had deserted [[her]3482-mother earth child]1838-her child . A superficial apathy was creeping over [her]211-hadria , below which burnt a slow fire of pain . But the greater the apathy , which expressed itself outwardly in a sort of cheerful readiness to take things as they came , the more delighted [everybody]3781-everybody appeared to be with [the repentant sinner]3485-the repentant sinner . [[Her]211-hadria associates]4518-her associates seemed to desire earnestly that [she]211-hadria should go to [church]1153-church , as [they]4518-her associates did , in [her]211-hadria best bonnet ‚Äî and why not ? [She]211-hadria would get a best bonnet , as ridiculous as [they]4518-her associates pleased , and let [Mr. Walker]217-mr. walker do [his]217-mr. walker worst . What did it matter ? Who was the better or the worse for what [she]211-hadria thought or how [she]211-hadria acted ? What mattered it , whether [she]211-hadria were consistent or not ? What mattered it if [she]211-hadria seemed , by [her]211-hadria actions , to proclaim [her]211-hadria belief in dogmas that meant nothing to [her]211-hadria , except as interesting products of [the human mind]3488-the human mind ? [She]211-hadria had not enough faith to make it worth while to stand alone . [Lord Engleton]157-lord engleton said [he]157-lord engleton thought it right to go to [church]1153-church regularly , for the sake of setting an example to [the masses]3490-the masses , a sentiment which always used to afford [Hadria]211-hadria more amusement than many intentional witticisms . [She]211-hadria went often to the later service , when the autumn twilight lay heavy and sad upon [the churchyard]1413-the churchyard , and the peace of evening stole in through the windows of [the church]1115-the church . Then , as the sublime poetry of psalmist or [prophet]3493-prophet rolled through the Norman arches , or the notes of the organ stole out of [the shadowed chancel]3494-the shadowed chancel , a spirit of repose would creep into the heart of [the listener]1121-the listener , and the tired thoughts would take a more rhythmic march . [She]211-hadria felt nearer to [[her]211-hadria fellows]4821-her fellows , at such moments , than at any other . [Her]211-hadria heart went out to [them]4821-her fellows , in wistful sympathy . [They]4821-her fellows seemed to be standing together then , one and all , at the threshold of the great Mystery , and though [they]4821-her fellows might be parted ever so widely by circumstance , temperament , mental endowment , manner of thought , yet after all , [they]4821-her fellows were [brethren]3497-brethren and [fellow sufferers]3498-fellow sufferers ; [they]4821-her fellows shared the weakness , the longing , the struggle of life ; [they]4821-her fellows all had affections , ambitions , heart - breakings , sins , and victories ; the differences were slight and transient , in the presence of the vast unknown , the Ultimate Reality for which [they]4821-her fellows were all groping in the darkness . This sense of brotherhood was strongest with regard to [the poorer members of [the congregation]1116-the congregation]3499-the poorer members of the congregation : [the labourers]5962-the labourers with [their]5962-the labourers toil - stained hands and bent heads , [the wives]3275-the wives , [the weary mothers]3503-the weary mothers , [their]4821-her fellows faces seamed with the ceaseless strain of child - bearing , and hard work , and care and worry . In [their]4821-her fellows prematurely ageing faces , in [their]4821-her fellows furrowed brows , [Hadria]211-hadria could trace the marks of Life 's bare and ruthless hand , which had pressed so heavily on [those whose task it had been to bestow the terrible gift]3504-those whose task it had been to bestow the terrible gift . Here the burden had crushed soul and flesh ; here that insensate spirit of Life had worked its will , gratified [its]3505-its rage to produce and reproduce , it mattered not what in the semblance of [the human]3506-the human , so long only as that wretched semblance repeated itself , and repeated itself again , ad nauseum , while it destroyed the creatures which it used for its wild purpose ‚Äî And the same savage story was written , once more , on the faces of [the better dressed women]3507-the better dressed women : worry , weariness , apathy , strain ; these were marked unmistakeably , after the first freshness of youth had been driven away , and the features began to take the mould of the habitual thoughts and the habitual impressions . And on these faces , there was a certain pettiness and coldness not observable on [those of [the poorer women]3509-the poorer women]3508-those of the poorer women . Often , when [one of [the neighbours]1469-the neighbours]3510-one of the neighbours called and found [Hadria]211-hadria alone , some chance word of womanly sympathy would touch a spring , and then a sad , narrow little story of trouble and difficulty would be poured out ; a revelation of the bewildered , toiling , futile existences that were being passed beneath a smooth appearance ; of the heart - ache and heroism and misplaced sacrifice , of the ruined lives that a little common sense and common kindness might have saved ; the unending pain and trouble about matters entirely trivial , entirely absurd ; the ceaseless travail to bring forth new elements of trouble for [those who must inherit the deeds of to - day]3512-those who must inherit the deeds of to - day ; the burdened existences agonizing to give birth to new existences , equally burdened , which in [their]4821-her fellows turn , were to repeat the ceaseless oblation to [the gods of Life]3513-the gods of life . ‚Äú Futile ? ‚Äù[176-lady engleton] said [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton . ‚Äú [I]176-lady engleton think [women]606-women are generally [fools]5590-fools , entre nous ; that is why [they]606-women so often fill [their]606-women lives with sound and fury , accomplishing nothing . ‚Äù[176-lady engleton] [Hadria]211-hadria felt that this was a description of [her]211-hadria own life , as well as that of [most of [[her]211-hadria neighbours]1818-her neighbours]3514-most of her neighbours . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria can understand so well how it is that [women]606-women become conventional , ‚Äù[211-hadria] [she]211-hadria said , apparently without direct reference to the last remark , ‚Äú it is so useless to take the trouble to act on [one]329-one 's own initiative . It annoys [everybody]3781-everybody frightfully , and it accomplishes nothing , as [you]176-lady engleton say . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú [[My]176-lady engleton dear]3722-my dear [Hadria]211-hadria , [you]211-hadria alarm [me]176-lady engleton ! ‚Äù[176-lady engleton] cried [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , laughing . ‚Äú [You]211-hadria must really be very ill indeed , if [you]211-hadria have come to this conclusion ! ‚Äù[176-lady engleton] In looking over some old papers and books , one afternoon , [Hadria]211-hadria came upon the little composition called Futility , which a mood had called forth at [Dunaghee]1-dunaghee , years ago . [She]211-hadria had almost forgotten about it , and in trying it over , [she]211-hadria found that it was like trying over the work of [some other person]3516-some other person . It expressed with great exactness the feelings that overwhelmed [her]211-hadria now , whenever [she]211-hadria let [her]211-hadria imagination dwell upon the lives of [women , of whatever class and whatever kind]3517-women , of whatever class and whatever kind . Futility ! The mournful composition , with its strange modern character , its suggestion of striving and confusion and pain , expressed as only music could express , the yearning and the sadness that burden so many [a woman]3753-a woman 's heart to - day . [She]211-hadria knew that the music was good , and that now [she]211-hadria could compose music infinitely better . The sharpness of longing for [her]211-hadria lost art cut through [her]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria half turned from the piano and then went back , as a moth to the flame . How was this eternal tumult to be stilled ? Facts were definite and clear , there was no room for doubt or for hope . These facts then had to be dealt with . How did [other women]4882-other women deal with [them]3520-them ? Not so much better than [she]211-hadria did , after all , as it appeared when [one]329-one was allowed to see beneath the amiable surface of [their]4882-other women lives . [They]4882-other women were all spinning round and round , in a dizzy little circle , all whirling and toiling and troubling , to no purpose . Even [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton , who appeared so bright and satisfied , had [her]176-lady engleton secret misery which spoilt [her]176-lady engleton life . [She]211-hadria had beauty , talent , wealth , everything to make existence pleasant and satisfactory , but [she]211-hadria had allowed externals and unessentials to encroach upon it , to govern [her]211-hadria actions , to usurp the place of [her]211-hadria best powers , to creep into [her]211-hadria motives , till there was little germ and heart of reality left , and [she]211-hadria was beginning to feel starved and aimless in the midst of what might have been plenty . [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton had turned to [[her]176-lady engleton neighbour]937-her neighbour at [the Red House]4718-the red house in an instinctive search for sympathy , as the more genuine side of [her]176-lady engleton nature began to cry out against the emptiness of [her]176-lady engleton graceful and ornate existence . [Hadria]211-hadria was startled by the revelation . [Hubert]118-hubert had always held up [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton as a model of virtue and wisdom , and perfect contentment . Yet [she]211-hadria too , it turned out , for all [her]211-hadria smiles and [her]211-hadria cheerfulness , was busy and weary with futilities . [She]211-hadria too , like [the fifty daughters of [Danaus]285-danaus]3524-the fifty daughters of danaus , was condemned to [the idiot]3525-the idiot 's labour of eternally drawing water in sieves from [fathomless wells]3526-fathomless wells . [ALGITHA]81-algitha 'S marriage took place almost immediately . There was no reason for delay . [She]81-algitha stayed at [the Cottage]1763-the cottage , and was married at [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , on one of the loveliest mornings of the year , as [the villagers]2235-the villagers noticed with satisfaction . [Both sisters]3874-both sisters had become favourites in [the neighbourhood]524-the neighbourhood among [the poorer people]3531-the poorer people , and [the inhabitants]916-the inhabitants mustered to see the wedding . It was only for [[her]81-algitha mother]520-her mother 's sake that [Algitha]81-algitha had consented to a conventional ceremony . [She]520-her mother said that [she]520-her mother and [Wilfrid]83-fred both hated the whole barbaric show . [They]3874-both sisters submitted only because there was no help for it . [[Algitha]81-algitha 's mother]3534-algitha 's mother would have broken [her]3534-algitha 's mother heart if [they]3874-both sisters had been bound merely by the legal tie , as [she]520-her mother and [Wilfrid]83-fred desired . ‚Äú Indeed , the only tie that [we]3413-the couple respect is that of [our]3413-the couple love and faith . If that failed , [we]3413-the couple should scorn to hold [one another]3945-one another in unwilling bondage . [We]3413-the couple are not entirely without self - respect . ‚Äù[520-her mother] [The couple]3413-the couple were to take a tour in [Italy]11-italy , where [they]3413-the couple hoped to meet [Valeria]109-valeria and [Professor Fortescue]116-professor fortescue . [Joseph Fleming]159-joseph fleming was married , almost at the same time , to [[his]159-joseph fleming merry Irish girl]3536-his merry irish girl . The winter came suddenly . Some terrific gales had robbed the trees of their lingering yellow leaves , and the bare branches already shewed their exquisite tracery against the sky . Heavy rain followed , and [the river]437-the river was swollen , and there were floods that made [the whole country]406-the whole country damp , and rank , and terribly depressing . [Mrs. Fullerton]97-mrs. fullerton felt the influence of the weather , and complained of neuralgia and other ailments . [She]97-mrs. fullerton needed watching very carefully , and plenty of cheerful companionship . This was hard to supply . In struggling to belie [her]97-mrs. fullerton feelings , day after day , [Hadria]211-hadria feared , at times , that [she]97-mrs. fullerton would break down disastrously . [She]211-hadria was frightened at the strange haunting ideas that came to [her]211-hadria , the dread and nameless horror that began to prey upon [her]211-hadria , try as [she]211-hadria would to protect [herself]211-hadria from these nerve - torments , which [she]211-hadria could trace so clearly to [their]3539-their causes . If only , instead of making [one half insane and stupid]3540-one half insane and stupid , the strain of grief would but kill one outright , and be done with it ! [Old Dodge]286-old dodge was [a good friend to [Hadria]211-hadria]3541-a good friend to hadria , at this time . [He]286-old dodge saw that something was seriously wrong , and [he]286-old dodge managed to convey [his]286-old dodge affectionate concern in a thousand little kindly ways that brought comfort to [her]211-hadria loneliness , and often filled [her]211-hadria eyes with sudden tears . Nor was [he]286-old dodge [the only friend [she]211-hadria had in [the village]1124-the village]3542-the only friend she had in the village , whose sympathy was given in generous measure . [Hadria]211-hadria had been able to be of use , at the time of the disastrous epidemic which had carried off [so many of [the population]1644-the population]3544-so many of the population , and since then had been admitted to more intimate relationship with [the people]4302-the people ; learning [their]4302-the people troubles and [their]4302-the people joys , [their]4302-the people anxieties , and the strange pathos of [their]4302-the people lives . [She]211-hadria learnt , at this time , the quality of English kindness and English sympathy , which [Valeria]109-valeria used to say was equalled nowhere in [the world]334-the world . Before the end of the winter , [Algitha]81-algitha and [[her]81-algitha husband]553-her husband returned . ‚Äú [I]286-old dodge 'm real glad , [mum]1416-mum , that [I]286-old dodge be , ‚Äù[286-old dodge] said [Dodge]286-old dodge , ‚Äú to think as [you]1416-mum has [[your]1416-mum sister]1388-your sister with [you]1416-mum again . [Miss Fullerton]112-miss fullerton ‚Äî which [I]286-old dodge means [Mrs. Burton]287-mrs. burton ‚Äî is sure to do [you]1416-mum a sight o ' good , bless ' er . ‚Äù[286-old dodge] [Dodge]286-old dodge was right . [Algitha]81-algitha 's healthy nature , strengthened by happiness and success , was of infinite help to [Hadria]211-hadria , in [her]211-hadria efforts to shake off the symptoms that had made [her]211-hadria frightened of [herself]211-hadria . [She]211-hadria did not know what tricks exhausted nerves might play upon [her]211-hadria , or what tortures [they]3549-they had in store for [her]211-hadria . [Algitha]81-algitha 's judgments were inclined to be definite and clear - cut to the point of hardness . [She]211-hadria did not know the meaning of over - wrought nerves , nor the difficulties of a nature more imaginative than [her]211-hadria own . [She]211-hadria had found [her]211-hadria will - power sufficient to meet all the emergencies of [her]211-hadria life , and [she]211-hadria was disposed to feel a little contemptuous , especially of late , at a persistent condition of difficulty and confusion . [Her]211-hadria impulse was to attack such a condition and bring it to order , by force of will . The active temperament is almost bound to misunderstand the imaginative or artistic spirit and its difficulties . [A real cul de sac]3550-a real cul de sac was to [Algitha]81-algitha almost unthinkable . There must be some means of finding one 's way out . [Hadria]211-hadria 's present attitude amazed and irritated [her]81-algitha . [She]211-hadria objected to [her]211-hadria regular church - going , as dishonest . Was [she]211-hadria not , for the sake of peace and quietness , professing that which [she]211-hadria did not believe ? And how was it that [she]211-hadria was growing more into favour with [the Jordans]288-the jordans and [Walkers]284-miss walkers and [all the narrow , wooden - headed people]3551-all the narrow , wooden - headed people ? Surely an ominous sign . After the long self - suppression , the long playing of a fatiguing r√¥le , [Hadria]211-hadria felt an unspeakable relief in [Algitha]81-algitha 's presence . To [her]211-hadria , at least , [she]211-hadria need not assume a false cheerfulness . [Algitha]81-algitha noticed , with anxiety , the change that was coming over [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister , the spirit of tired acquiescence , the insidious creeping in of a slightly cynical view of things , in place of the brave , believing , imaginative outlook that [she]211-hadria had once held towards life . This cynicism was more or less superficial however , as [Algitha]81-algitha found when [they]3553-they had a long and intimate conversation , one evening in [[Hadria]211-hadria 's room]3863-hadria 's room , by [her]211-hadria fire ; but it was painful to [Algitha]81-algitha to hear the hopeless tones of [[her]81-algitha sister]313-her sister 's voice , now that [she]211-hadria was speaking simply and sincerely , without bitterness , but without what is usually called resignation . ‚Äú No ; [I]211-hadria do n't think it is all for the best , ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria think , as far as [my]211-hadria influence goes , it is all for the worst . What fatal argument [my]211-hadria life will give to those who are seeking reasons to hold [our]3553-they sex in the old bondage ! [My]211-hadria struggles , [my]211-hadria failure , will add to the staggering weight that [we]3553-they all stumble under . [I]211-hadria have hindered more ‚Äî that is the bitter thing ‚Äî by having tried and failed , than if [I]211-hadria had never tried at all . [Mrs. Walker]162-mrs. walker , [Mrs. Gordon]91-mrs. gordon [herself]91-mrs. gordon , has given less arguments to [the oppressors]7176-the oppressors than [I.]211-hadria ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú But why ? That 's exactly what [women]606-women always do and always have done , and plume [themselves]606-women upon it . And so this ridiculous farce is kept up , because [these wretched women]7184-these wretched women go smiling about [the world]334-the world , hugging [their]7184-these wretched women stupid resignation to [their]7184-these wretched women hearts , and pampering up [their]7184-these wretched women sickly virtue , at the expense of [their]7184-these wretched women sex . It is the nearest approach to luxury that [society]367-society allows [her]3753-a woman , ‚Äù[211-hadria] cried [Hadria]211-hadria , irascibly . ‚Äú It is most refreshing to hear [you]211-hadria exaggerate , once more , with the old vigour , ‚Äù[313-her sister] [[her]211-hadria sister]313-her sister cried . ‚Äú If [I]211-hadria have a foible , it is under - statement , ‚Äù[211-hadria] returned [Hadria]211-hadria , with a half - smile . ‚Äú Then [I]81-algitha think [you]211-hadria have n't a foible , ‚Äù[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . ‚Äú That [I]81-algitha am ready to admit ; but seriously , [women]606-women seem bent on proving that [you]211-hadria may treat [them]606-women as [you]211-hadria like , but [they]606-women will ‚Äò never desert [Mr. Micawber]289-mr. micawber . ‚Äô ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha smiled . ‚Äú [They]606-women are so mortally afraid of getting off the line and doing what might not be quite right . [They]606-women take such a morbid interest in [[their]606-women own characters]7189-their own characters . [They]606-women are so particular about [their]606-women souls . [The female soul]7190-the female soul is such a delicate creation ‚Äî like a bonnet . Look at [a woman]3753-a woman trimming and poking at [her]3753-a woman bonnet ‚Äî that 's exactly how [she]3753-a woman goes on with [her]3753-a woman soul . ‚Äù[81-algitha] [Algitha]81-algitha laughed and shrugged [her]81-algitha shoulders . ‚Äú It has trained [her]3753-a woman in a sort of heroism , at any rate , ‚Äù[81-algitha] [she]81-algitha said . ‚Äú Heroism ! talk of [Spartan boys]7192-spartan boys , [they]7192-spartan boys are not in it ! [A woman]3753-a woman will endure martyrdom with the expression of [a seraph,‚Äîan extremely aggravating seraph]7194-a seraph,‚Äîan extremely aggravating seraph . [She]3753-a woman looks after [her]3753-a woman soul as if it were the ultimate fact of [the universe]420-the universe . [She]3753-a woman will trim and preen that ridiculous soul , though the heavens fall and the rest of [her]3753-a woman sex perish . ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú Come now , [I]211-hadria think there are exceptions . ‚Äù[211-hadria] ‚Äú A few , but very few . It is a point of honour , a sacred canon . [Women]606-women will go on patiently drawing water in sieves , and pretend [they]606-women are usefully employed because it tires [them]606-women ! ‚Äù[81-algitha] ‚Äú [They]606-women believe it , ‚Äù[81-algitha] said [Algitha]81-algitha . ‚Äú Perhaps so . It would not allow [her]211-hadria to be passive , it would not permit [her]211-hadria emotions to lie prone and exhausted . Everything was waking , and [she]211-hadria must wake too , to the bitterest regret and the keenest longings of which [she]211-hadria was capable . [She]211-hadria had tried to avoid everything that would arouse these futile emotions ; [she]211-hadria had attempted to organise [her]211-hadria life on new lines , persisting in [her]211-hadria attitude of non - surrender , but winning , as far as [she]211-hadria was able , the rest that , at present , could only be achieved by means of a sort of inward apathy . It was an instinctive effort of self - preservation . [She]211-hadria was like a fierce fire , over which ashes have been heaped to keep down the flames , and check its ardour . [She]211-hadria had to eat [her]211-hadria heart out in dullness , to avoid its flaming out in madness . But the spring came and carried [her]211-hadria away on its torrent . [She]211-hadria might as well have tried to resist an avalanche . [She]211-hadria thought that [she]211-hadria had given up all serious thought of music ; the surrender was necessary , and [she]211-hadria had judged it folly to tempt [herself]211-hadria by further dallying with it . It was too strong for [her]211-hadria . And the despair that it awoke seemed to break up [her]211-hadria whole existence , and render [her]211-hadria unfit for [her]211-hadria daily task . But now [she]211-hadria found that , once more , [she]211-hadria had underrated the strength of [her]211-hadria own impulses . For some time [she]211-hadria resisted , but one day , the sun shone out strong and genial , the budding trees spread their branches to the warm air , a blackbird warbled ecstatically from among the Priory shrubberies , and [Hadria]211-hadria passed into [the garden of the Griffins]3558-the garden of the griffins . [The calm old mansion]3571-the calm old mansion with [its]3571-the calm old mansion delicate outlines , [its]3571-the calm old mansion dreamy exquisite stateliness , spoke of rest and sweet serenity . [The place]981-the place had the melancholy but also the repose of greatness . It was rich in all that lies nearest to the heart of that mysterious , dual - faced divinity that [we]3573-we call beauty , compounded of sorrow and delight . Ah ! if only [its owner]559-its owner could come and take up [[his]559-its owner abode [here]3762-here]3575-his abode here . If only [he]559-its owner would get well ! [Hadria]211-hadria 's thoughts wandered backwards to that wonderful evening , when [she]211-hadria had played to [him]559-its owner and [Algitha]81-algitha , and [they]3577-they had all watched the sunset afterwards , from [the terrace]1680-the terrace . How long was it since [she]211-hadria had touched the piano in [this old drawing - room]3579-this old drawing - room ? Never since [she]211-hadria returned from [Pari]79-pari . Even [[her]211-hadria own piano at [home]3770-home]3580-her own piano at home had been almost equally silent . [She]211-hadria believed that [she]211-hadria had not only quite abandoned hope with regard to music , but that [she]211-hadria had prepared [herself]211-hadria to face the inevitable decay of power , the inevitable proofs of [her]211-hadria loss , as time went on . But so far , [she]211-hadria had only had proofs that [she]211-hadria could do astonishingly much if [she]211-hadria had the chance . To - day , for the first time , the final ordeal had to be gone through . And [her]211-hadria imagination had never conceived its horror . [She]211-hadria was to be taken at [her]211-hadria word . The neglected gift was beginning to show signs of decay and enfeeblement . It had given fair warning for many a year , by the persistent appeal that it made , the persistent pain that it caused ; but the famine had told upon it at last . [It]3582-it was dying . As this fact insinuated itself into the consciousness , in the teeth of a wild effort to deny it , despair flamed up , fierce and violent . [She]211-hadria regretted that [she]211-hadria had not thrown up everything long ago , rather than endure this lingering death ; [she]211-hadria cursed [her]211-hadria hesitation , [she]211-hadria cursed [her]211-hadria fate , [her]211-hadria training , [her]211-hadria circumstances , [she]211-hadria cursed [herself]211-hadria . Whatever there was to curse , [she]211-hadria cursed . What hideous nonsense to imagine [herself]211-hadria ready to face this last insult of fate ! [She]211-hadria was like [a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot , and knows what [he]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot has undertaken only when the flames begin to curl about [his]3583-a martyr , who invites the stake and the faggot feet . [She]211-hadria had offered up [her]211-hadria power , [her]211-hadria imperious creative instinct , to the Lares and [Penates]292-penates ; [those greedy little godlets whom there was no appeasing while an inch of one remained that they could tear to pieces]3584-those greedy little godlets whom there was no appeasing while an inch of one remained that they could tear to pieces . [She]211-hadria clenched [her]211-hadria hands , in agony . [The whole being]3585-the whole being recoiled now , at the eleventh hour , as a fierce wild creature that [one tries to bury alive]3586-one tries to bury alive . [She]211-hadria looked back along the line of the past and saw , with too clear eyes , the whole insidious process , so stealthy that [she]211-hadria had hardly detected it , at the time . [She]211-hadria remembered those afternoons at [the Priory]31-the priory , when the restless , ill - trained power would assert itself , free for the moment , from the fetters and the dismemberment that awaited it in ordinary life . But like [a creature accustomed to the yoke]3587-a creature accustomed to the yoke , [she]211-hadria had found it increasingly difficult to use the moments of opportunity when they came . The force of daily usage , the necessary bending of thoughts in certain habitual directions , had assisted the crippling process , and though the power still lay there , stiffer than of yore , yet the preliminary movements and readjustments used up time and strength , and then gradually , with the perpetual repetition of adverse habits , the whole process became slower , harder , crueler . ‚Äú Good heavens ! are all doors going to be shut against [me]211-hadria ? ‚Äù[211-hadria] It was more than [she]211-hadria could bear ! And yet it must be borne ‚Äî unless ‚Äî no , there was no ‚Äú unless . ‚Äù[211-hadria] It was of no use to coquet with thoughts of suicide . [She]211-hadria had thought all that out long ago , and had sought , at more than one crisis of desperate misery , for refuge from the horror and the insults of life . But there were always [others to be considered]3588-others to be considered . [She]211-hadria could not strike [them]3588-others to be considered so terrible a blow . Retreat was ruthlessly cut off . Nothing remained but the endurance of a conscious slow decay ; nothing but increasing loss and feebleness , as the surly years went by . [They]3589-they were going , going , these years of life , slipping away with [their]3589-they spoils . [Youth]172-youth was departing , everything was vanishing ; [her]211-hadria very self , bit by bit , slowly but surely , till [the House of Life]3590-the house of life would grow narrow and shrunken to the sight , the roof descend . The gruesome old story of [the imprisoned prince]3591-the imprisoned prince flashed into [her]211-hadria mind ; [the wretched captive]3592-the wretched captive , young and life - loving , who used to wake up , each morning , to find that of the original seven windows of [[his]3591-the imprisoned prince dungeon]3593-his dungeon , one had disappeared , while the walls had advanced a foot , and to - morrow yet another foot , till at length the last window had closed up , and the walls shrank together and crushed [him]3591-the imprisoned prince to death . ‚Äú [I]211-hadria ca n't , [I]211-hadria ca n't endure it ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] [Hadria]211-hadria had leaned forward against the key - board , which gave forth a loud crash of discordant notes , strangely expressive of the fall and failure of [her]211-hadria spirit . [She]211-hadria remained thus motionless , while the airs wandered in from [the garden]3867-the garden , and a broad ray of sunlight showed the strange incessant gyrations of the dust atoms , that happened to lie within the revealing brightness . The silence was perfect . [Hadria]211-hadria raised [her]211-hadria head at last , and [her]211-hadria eyes wandered out to [the sweet old garden]3595-the sweet old garden , decked in the miraculous hues of spring . The unutterable loveliness brought , for a second , a strange , inconsequent sense of peace ; it seemed like a promise and a message from [an unknown god]3596-an unknown god . But after that momentary and inexplicable experience , the babble of thought went on as before . The old dream mounted again heavenwards , like a cloud at sunset ; wild fancies fashioned themselves in the brain . And then , in fantastic images , [Hadria]211-hadria seemed to see a panorama of [her]211-hadria own life and the general life pass before [her]211-hadria , in all their incongruity and confusion . The great mass of that life showed itself as prose , because the significance of things had not been grasped or suspected ; but here and there , the veil was pierced ‚Äî by [some suffering soul]3597-some suffering soul , by [some poet]3598-some poet 's vision ‚Äî and the darkness of [our]3599-we daily , pompous , careworn , ridiculous little existence made painfully visible . ‚Äú It is all absurd , all futile ! ‚Äù[3597-some suffering soul] ( so moved the procession of the thoughts ) ; ‚Äú and meanwhile the steady pulse of life beats on , not pausing while [we]3599-we battle out [our]3599-we days , not waiting while [we]3599-we decide how [we]3599-we shall live . [We]3599-we are possessed by a sentiment , an ideal , a religion ; old Time makes no comment , but moves quietly on ; [we]3599-we fling the thing aside as tawdry , insufficient ; the ideal is tarnished , experience of [the world]334-the world converts [us]3599-we ‚Äî and still unmoved , [he]3596-an unknown god paces on . [We]3599-we are off on another chase ; another conception of things possesses [us]3599-we ; and still the beat of [his]3596-an unknown god footstep sounds in [our]3599-we ears , above the tumult . [We]3599-we think and aspire and dream , and meanwhile the fires grow cold upon the hearth , the daily cares and common needs plead eloquently for [our]3599-we undivided service ; the stupendous movement of Existence goes on unceasingly , at [our]3599-we doors ; [thousands]3718-thousands struggling for gold and fame and mere bread , and resorting to infamous devices to obtain them ; the great commercial currents flow and flow , according to [their]3718-thousands mystic laws ; the price of stocks goes up , goes down , and with them , the life and fate of [thousands]3718-thousands ; the inconsequent bells ring out from [Craddock Church]33-craddock church , and [the people]4302-the people congregate ; [the grave of [the schoolmistress]4793-the schoolmistress]7240-the grave of the schoolmistress sleeps in the sunshine , and the sound of the bells streams over [it]7240-the grave of the schoolmistress ‚Äî meaning no irony ‚Äî to lose itself in the quiet of [the hills]413-the hills ; rust and dust collect in [[one]329-one 's house]7244-one 's house , in [one]329-one 's soul ; and this and that , and that and this,‚Äîlike the pendulum of the old time - piece , with its solemn tick ‚Äî dock the moments of one 's life , with each its dull little claim and its tough little tether , and lead one decorously to the gateway of Eternity . ‚Äù[3597-some suffering soul] There was a flutter of wings , in [the room]379-the room . A robin hopped in at the window and perched daintily on the table - ledge , its delicate claws outlined against the whiteness of the dust - sheet , its head inquisitively on one side , as if it were asking the reason of [the musician]6156-the musician 's unusual silence . Suddenly , the little creature fluffed out its feathers , drew itself together , and warbled forth a rich ecstatic song , that seemed to be deliberately addressed to [its human companion]3602-its human companion . [Hadria]211-hadria raised [her]211-hadria bowed head . Up welled the swift unaccustomed tears , while [the robin]3603-the robin , with increasing enthusiasm , continued [his]3603-the robin song . [His]3603-the robin theme , doubtless , was of the flicker of sun - lit shrubberies , the warmth of summer , the glory of spring , the sweetness of the revolving seasons . For cure of heartache , [he]3603-the robin suggested the pleasantness of [garden nooks]3604-garden nooks , and the repose that lingers about a dew - sprinkled lawn . All these things were warmly commended to [the human being whose song of life had ceased]3605-the human being whose song of life had ceased . ‚Äú But they break [my]3603-the robin heart , [little singer]7246-little singer , [they]7247-they break [my]3603-the robin heart ! ‚Äù[3603-the robin] The robin lifted up its head and warbled more rapturously than ever . The tears were falling fast know , and silently . The thoughts ran on and on . ‚Äú [I]3603-the robin know it all , [I]3603-the robin know it all , and [my]3603-the robin heart is broken ‚Äî and it is [my]3603-the robin own fault ‚Äî and it does not matter ‚Äî [the world]334-the world is full of broken hearts ‚Äî and it does not matter , it does not matter . But , oh , if the pain might stop , if the pain might stop ! [The robin]3603-the robin sings now , because the spring is here ; but it is not always spring . [The robin]3603-the robin seemed to think that [he]3603-the robin had a mission to cheer [[his]3603-the robin companion]4118-his companion , for [he]3603-the robin warbled merrily on . And beside [him]3603-the robin , [the dust - motes]3609-the dust - motes danced the wildest of dances , in the shaft of sunshine . ‚Äú It is very lovely , it is very lovely ‚Äî [the world]334-the world is a miracle , but it is all like a taunt , it is like an insult , this glory of [the world]334-the world . [I]3609-the dust - motes am born [a woman]3753-a woman , and to be born [a woman]3753-a woman is to be exquisitely sensitive to insult and to live under it always , always . [I]3609-the dust - motes wish that [I]3609-the dust - motes were as marble to the magic of Life , [I]3609-the dust - motes wish that [I]3609-the dust - motes cared for nothing and felt nothing . [I]3609-the dust - motes pray only that the dream and the longing may be killed , and killed quickly ! ‚Äù[3609-the dust - motes] In the silence , the bird 's note sounded clear and tender . The dance of [the dust - motes]3609-the dust - motes , like the great dance of Life itself , went on without ceasing . [The robin]3603-the robin seemed to insist on a brighter view of things . [Hadria]211-hadria was shedding the first unchecked tears that [she]211-hadria had shed since [her]211-hadria earliest childhood . And then , for the second time to - day , that strange unexplained peace stole into [her]211-hadria heart . [He]4071-the professor had overcome the difficulty of expense , which had always been the main obstacle to a practical solution of the problem . Henceforth there was no need for [any creature]3625-any creature to suffer , in dying for [man]332-man 's use . Sometimes [it]3603-the robin would come into [the room]379-the room and hop on to a chair or table , coquetting from perch to perch , and looking at [the invalid]6530-the invalid , with bright inquisitive eyes . [I]3664-i commend [them]3687-people to [you]211-hadria . ‚Äù[3664-i] [The figure]3666-the figure lay motionless , as if asleep . The expression was one of utter peace . It seemed as if all the love and tenderness , all the breadth and beauty of the soul that had passed away , were shining out of the quieted face , from which all trace of suffering had vanished . The look of desolation that used , at times , to come into it , had entirely gone . [Hadria]211-hadria and [Valeria]109-valeria stood together , by the bedside . At the foot of the bed was a glass vase , holding a spray of wild cherry blossom ; [Hadria]211-hadria had brought it , to [the invalid]6530-the invalid 's delight , the day before . There were other offerings of fresh flowers ; a mass of azaleas from [Lady Engleton]176-lady engleton ; bunches of daffodils that [Valeria]109-valeria had gathered in [the meadows]5896-the meadows ; and [old Dodge]286-old dodge had sent a handful of brown and yellow wallflower , from [[his]286-old dodge garden]3669-his garden . The blind had been raised a few inches , so as to let in the sunlight and the sweet air . It was a glorious morning . The few last hot days had brought everything out , with a rush . The boughs of the trees , that [the Professor]4071-the professor had loved so to watch during [his]4071-the professor illness , were swaying gently in the breeze , just as they had done when [his]4071-the professor eyes had been open to see [them]3671-them . The wood - pigeons were cooing , the young rooks cawing shrilly in [the rookery]3659-the rookery . [Valeria]109-valeria seemed to be stunned . [Hadria]211-hadria went towards [her]109-valeria hastily . ‚Äú What 's that ? ‚Äù[109-valeria] cried [Valeria]109-valeria with a nervous start and a scared glance towards the window . ‚Äú The robin ! ‚Äù[211-hadria] said [Hadria]211-hadria , and the tears started to [her]109-valeria eyes . The bird had hopped in at [his]3674-his usual hour , in a friendly fashion . [He]3674-his picked up a few stray crumbs that had been left on the sill from yesterday , and then , in little capricious flights from stage to stage , finally arrived at the rail of the bed , and stood looking from side to side , with black , bright eyes , at [the motionless figure]3675-the motionless figure . Hitherto it had been accustomed to a welcome . Why this strange silence ? The robin hopped round on the rail , polished [his]3674-his beak meditatively , fluffed out [his]3674-his feathers , and then , raising [his]3674-his head , sang a tender requiem .
